loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is very thankful to Kiva for the loan granted to her in the amount of PHP 20,000 with which she bought three boxes of canned goods, two cases of soft drinks, 30 sachets of powdered laundry soap, shampoo, and other items to sell to her store. The revenue of her income helps support their everyday expenses. Also, Flora was able to pay her loan on time as her income increased, thanks to the loan.

Flora is now requesting a loan amounting to PHP 22,000 to buy frozen goods products (ham, hot dogs, sweetened preserved pork and sausages) to increase her income more as more customers are patronizing her products and becoming regular customers. 

Flora hopes to continuously operate her store as it become their main source of income. She still wants to add a rice and mineral water business someday as she continuously saves to realize her plans.

loans.use: to buy frozen goods (ham, hot dogs, sweetened preserved pork and sausages)

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 35 years old and has four children. Mary Grace is married, and three of her children are currently in school.

Mary Grace is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Mary Grace requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Mary Grace has been raising pigs for four years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Mary Grace would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Giereson

texts.en:
In the walled city of Intramuros lives a loving, understanding and hardworking man, Giereson, 26 years of age, and a motorcycle driver.

Giereson knows how hard it is to work and values it so much. That's why he is equipping himself by pursuing hard in his current job. For three years, he has been driving people to and from their destinations. Each ride costs regularly PHP 8.00 per person and each day, he just earns enough. In a month, he can subsist on an average of PHP 8,000.

However, it's a challenge for him when uncontrollable situations come along like heavy rains. At times like these, it's very difficult for him to push the tricycle through the floods because the cycle has a greater risk of malfunctioning. But, it's the love for his family that urges him to keep going.

Now, he comes to you to request a loan that he will use for maintaining his motorcycle. He needs an amount of PHP 8,000 for this.

"I really dream of acquiring more motorcycles in time. And, it would be a big help for me if I get access to this loan indeed. I hope Kiva will help me realize this so I can add income for the family," he said.

He meets up with his co-fellowship** members to share stories of his life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God he studies.

** All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to maintain his motorcycle for business use.

loans.name: Reyes Isabel

texts.es: Don reyes de 62 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz, maicillo y frijol desde hace 20 años inicio con capital propio, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y así seguir con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias.
texts.en: Don Reyes, 62, lives in his own house with his wife; he has been growing corn, sorghum and beans for 20 years. He started with his own capital; he sells his products in the various markets that are near his home. He is applying for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, pest control, etc. and to thus continue with his work which earns him good profits.

loans.use: buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, pest control, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
Ma. Luz is 58 years old and married with eight children. 

Ma. Luz is in the agricultural business, farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Ma. Luz requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Ma. Luz has been farming sugarcane for 20 years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ma. Luz would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es: Doña Celia de 57 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica desde hace 13 años a la elaboración y venta de pupusas y tortillas su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia en una zona muy transitada, con lo que obtienen de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de chicharrón, quesillo, frijoles, maíz y demás ingredientes y asi poder seguir con su trabajo que le genera buenos ingresos.
texts.en:
Celia is 57 years of age. She lives in her own home with her family. For the past 13 years she has made a living making and selling pupusas (stuffed tortillas) and tortillas. Her business is located in her home which is in a busy area. With what she makes from sales she can cover some of her household expenses. 

She is requesting the loan to purchase pork, curd cheese, beans, corn and other ingredients and in this way be able to continue with her work which provides her with a good income.

loans.use: to purchase pork, curd cheese, beans, corn and other ingredients.

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo, a 49-year-old micro-entrepreneur from Intramuros City, has been in the transportation business for six years now, and through this, he is able to make a living for the family.

He drives a tricycle that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. He then remits a boundary (daily quota) to the owner of the tricycle every day. In his work, he finds it hard to raise enough for his family because sometimes, what he brings home is just what is left from the quota. But no matter how hard it is, even if he has to endure the heat of the sun every day or drive across the floods during heavy rains, what abounds in him is still the love for his family.

Reynaldo wants to apply now for a PHP 8,000 loan to continue operations of his business. He will be using the loan to buy spare parts and accessories and pay for the maintenance of his motorcycle.

Reynaldo's dream is always for his family - to ensure that someday they will be able to experience a life that is far from where they are today, out of the breadline. He also wants to have more motorcycles in the future. And, he assures you that if you allow him to have this chance, he will be faithful in propagating what you have entrusted him.

He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God he studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and accessories and pay for the maintenance of his motorcycle.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 39 years old and married with two children.

Roselyn is in the agricultural business, farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Roselyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Roselyn has been farming sugarcane for 10 years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Roselyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Zounogo Group

texts.fr: Bibata est âgée de 47 ans mariée mère de 4 enfants. Vendeuse depuis 15 ans. Elle veut le prêt à ACFIME pour s’acheter 100 000 f cfa de pagnes et 50 000 dans les autres articles de beautés pour les femmes. Elle se déplace vers ses clients, le client peut faire la commande elle va chercher ses pagnes de qualité pour les données moyennant un prix à un bref délai. Elle a déjà reçu le prêt à ACFIME et à rembourser aux dates prévues.
texts.en:
Bibata is a 47-year-old married mother of four children. She has been a saleswoman for the past 15 years.

She wants the loan from ACFIME to buy 100,000 francs' worth of pagnes (colorful West-African fabric) and 50,000 francs' worth of other fashionable items for women. She goes to her customers, who can place order for pagnes she then fetches for a price within a short period of time.

She has already received the loan from ACFIME to be reimbursed on scheduled dates.

loans.use: buy 100,000 francs' worth of pagnes (colorful West-African fabric) and 50,000 francs' worth of women's fashionable items

loans.name: Sondos

texts.en:
Sondos, who appears in the photo, is a 20-year-old married young lady from Ramallah city. Her husband is a construction worker who gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs.

Sondos is a student in the university where she studies accounting. She wants to take the BA degree and find a job to help her family with part of their expenses.

She took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the university installment for the coming semester. By taking this loan, she will be able to pay for some of the urgent expenses she has.

loans.use: to pay the university installment for the coming semester

loans.name: Neil

texts.en:
Neil’s variety store is struggling as you can see in the picture. He has a lot of receivables from his neighbors in Santa Barbara, Iloilo. Many of his debtors pay after several weeks or months and he cannot force them because there are times when money is really difficult to earn. It’s a good thing that he has an alternative source of income, which is his tricycle. His wife, Eva, looks after the store while he is driving his tricycle. His income somehow sustains their everyday needs and educational expenses of his two young children. But he still aims to improve his variety store so it can earn enough to prepare for his children’s higher education. As much as possible, he wants to save early for the future. A PHP 40,000 loan would be very helpful for him to buy additional stock of dry goods and grocery items for his store and part of it will be used to pay for his tricycle’s maintenance. You can be the answer to his prayers through your generous support. Thank you so much in advance.

Neil is an enthusiastic member of CCT where he gains inspiration from his co-fellowship* members who regularly meet once a week to study the Word of God and share stories of their life and businesses.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of dry goods and grocery items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy piglets (swine) and feed and make school payments.

loans.name: Silvia Roxana

texts.es: Silvia es una mujer de 38 años de edad que vive en casa de su propiedad junto a su madre y su hijo de 20 años de edad el cual se encuentra estudiando con el apoyo de Silvia. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que se dedica desde hace 5 años a prestar sus servicios de cocinera en un restaurante de playa, por lo que se siente feliz de contar con este ingreso y poder apoyar a su madre en su vejez. Silvia poco a poco ha mejorado su vivienda de lámina, anteriormente cambio las láminas del techo y paredes, ahora solicita un crédito a FUSAI el cual invertirá en: postes de cemento, arena, cemento, grava, alambre de púas y clavos para cercar su vivienda y brindar seguridad a su familia.
texts.en:
Silvia is a woman of 38 years. She lives in her own house together with her mother and her 20 year old son, who is studying thanks to Silvia's help.

She is a working woman who for the last 5 years has been employed as a cook at a beach restaurant. She is happy to be able to rely on this source of income in order to support her mother in her old age.

Little by little, Silvia has been improving her house made of sheet metal. Previously, she had exchanged the sheets of the roof and the walls. Now she is requesting a loan with FUSAI, which she will invest in cement posts, sand, cement, gravel, barbed wire and nails, in order to fence off her home and provide security for her family.

loans.use: to invest in cement posts, sand, cement, gravel, barbed wire and nails, in order to fence off her home and provide security for her family.

loans.name: Ryan

texts.en:
Here is Ryan, 33 years old, from Santa Barbara, Iloilo. He is married to Malou and they are blessed with two young children.

Ryan has been running a catering service for five years now. At times when there’s no catering scheduled, he sells fish in the town’s public market. He experiences many challenges in relation to his catering business. He suffers from lack of sleep as he has to get up early to buy the necessary ingredients. He endures the heat while cooking and defies his throbbing body pain after every day of work. Yet he focuses on his goal of providing for their everyday needs and saving for the future and for the education of his children. He also plans to buy a service vehicle for efficient operation of his business. He is expanding his network of customers and offering catering services to them. He knows that it’s best for him to have as many clients as possible even if there might be two or more occasions or catering requests at the same time. It would bring him more profit. His only problem is the limited utensils, equipment, tables and chairs to be used for simultaneous occasions. He humbly requests a PHP 50,000 loan to buy all these things. He may also need to hire occasional waiters and helpers. Hope you could be God’s instrument to grant his request and contribute a few steps to make his dreams come true someday.

Ryan draws inspiration from his co-fellowship* members who meet every week to share stories of their life and business and to draw strength from the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional utensils, equipment, tables and chairs.

loans.name: Fritzesa

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Fritzesa works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from farming vegetables. Fritzesa is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Fritzesa has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Fashion trends change from time to time. People want to wear new clothes, undergarments, footwear and use new cosmetics as well, especially girls in the line. With this mere fact, it is a very great opportunity for entrepreneurs to enter this kind of industry. Relative to this, direct selling is highly in demand especially for smaller people troops like Luisa, 64 years of age, from Pasay City Philippines.

Starting in 2005, she has engaged in direct selling. Peeking in, what she basically does is sell various products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, and others. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are getting as their income.

For now, Luisa envisions making her business more profitable in order to earn a higher income. At an amount of PHP 15,000, she can already purchase more merchandise products to sell like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products that are needed to increase her product inventory. This can also be a stepping stone for her to gradually expand her current business.

Luisa dreams of growing her business into a more profitable source of income so that she can pass it on someday to her children. She also hopes to earn more for her grandchildren’s education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise products to sell that would help increase her product inventory.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
They say there’s money from garbage. This is also Emily’s principle, which is why she ventured into buying and selling scrap or junk. She buys scrap from individual collectors or scavengers, and then she organizes it into types such as paper, board, plastic, bottles, and others. She will then sell these items to a junk shop. For some, it’s a filthy job, but for Emily, it’s her contribution to the recycling process in their community in Santa Barbara, Iloilo. She has another enterprise which is canteen operations. She pays three helpers in her two ventures, especially during these days when her second child is on the way. She makes herself busy to lessen her longing for her seaman husband who is always away from her.

Now she is appealing for a PHP 10,000 loan partly to serve as additional capital for buying scrap, and partly to buy ingredients for her canteen. Hopefully, this will further improve her business and subsequently give a higher income to her and her helpers.

She dreams that someday her whole family will enjoy a happy and sufficient living condition. She draws inspiration from her co-fellowship* members who meet every week to share stories of their life and business and to draw strength from the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more scrap or junk

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Compared to other animals, goats are easier to raise. They’re not choosy in terms of food. They just need some hay or grass. No complicated housing, just a fence to keep them together.

Analiza raises goats in her backyard in Santa Barbara, Iloilo. She serves them with hay and sometimes pastures them in grassy land. After several months, she sells them to gain the return of her investment. It’s a practical endeavor that supplies food for the community. Analiza has been running this business for 20 years and her income helps sustain their daily needs.

Now that Analiza aims to buy more kids (small goats) to raise. She aspires to obtain additional capital worth PHP 20,000. Later on, she plans to raise hogs also to maximize her time and income. She desires to help others who are in need and live rightly in the sight of God. She shares her experiences and aspirations with her co-fellowship* members at CCT Credit Cooperative. They regularly meet every week to share stories about their life and businesses and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more kids (small goats) to raise

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Hog raising combined with chicken raising are practical endeavors that alleviate food shortages in the community. Josephine has been into this business for 11 years, and she’s convinced that it is a very profitable enterprise that offers affordable food. Her income from this business helps sustain their daily needs and the education of her three children. Her husband Joseph is a construction worker with irregular income; hence, she carries a lot of financial responsibilities in the family. They live in Butuan City, Agusan Del Norte.

Josephine aims to distribute a bigger volume of affordable pork and chicken. She asks for PHP 10,000 loan to buy more piglets and chicks to raise. In a few months, she will buy a pedicab that she can use for delivery of the fattened animals. Not only this, she dreams to buy farmland in the near future. She would be happy to see her children finish their schooling and gain a stable job someday.

She regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members at CCT Credit Cooperative every week to share stories about their life and businesses and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more piglets and chicks to raise

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en:
Nargis is a married woman and has been running her own beauty parlor in her street. She is doing her job passionately; she knows the techniques of makeup and hair design and serves her customers by providing bangles, jewelry, etc. She is a well-known beautician in her town.

Nargis is a responsible mother of two children. She has slowly but surely improved her business through the support of Kashf Foundation.

Now she has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to buy more beauty products for her beauty parlor, including lotions, makeup kits, and lightening creams, to cater to a large number of customers efficiently to earn a good amount of income for bearing her everyday expenditures.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products for her beauty parlor, including lotions, makeup kits, and lightening creams, to cater to a large number of customers.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros, a 67-year-old, is married to Perlito and is a micro-entrepreneur from Pasay City. She has been operating their transportation business for thirteen years now, since 2002, and she makes a good income from this.

She has been in several businesses for a long time and for sure, she already knows the tricks of the trade. In fact, today, aside from the transportation business, she also manages a house rental business where she gets additional income.

She has a pedicab that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. The pedicab driver then remits a boundary (daily quota) each day to her. In her business the regular customers are the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 600 every day.

Milagros wants to apply for a PHP 15,000 loan assistance to continue operations of their business. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts, accessories and also for the maintenance of their pedicab cycle.

Milagros' dream is to go full blast on her business and gain more pedicabs. She is also hoping and praying for her family's health and security.

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy spare parts, accessories and also for the maintenance of their pedicab cycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the university installment for the coming semester.

loans.name: Marline

texts.en:
Marline has this dream that hides yet bespeaks hope. She's already 44 years old now and resides in the down-and-out city of Pasay with her husband Gilgam, who is currently self-employed.

She's operating a sari-sari store business which is often seen everywhere in the Philippines, most especially along the sidewalks and streets. It is most likely a convenience store, but quite a bit smaller than usual and offers only limited products which are commonly needed, such as toiletries, food, instant items, beverages and other commodities.

Well, unlike grocery stores, sari-sari stores offer products at a low cost and on a retail basis, which is really an advantage for the customers. Yet, gaining high profit here is no easy feat when customers buy on credit, delay payment or don't go with the demand.

However, Marline already learned what to do when situations like these come. CCT, on all accounts, starting in 2012 when she joined as a member, guided her to improve her livelihood.

Now, being introduced to Kiva, she would like to ask for help from you. She would like to borrow a loan worth PHP 50,000 that she would use to purchase additional products and merchandise items for her store. With this, she expects to grow her sales and provide a better remedy for their family’s daily living conditions. And, today, you can be a big part of her life.

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase additional products and merchandise items for her store.

loans.name: Dúo Elizabeth De San Juan Sac Group

texts.es:
Dúo Elizabeth de San Juan Sac
El dúo lo forma doña Victalina de 51 años de edad, tiene 4 hijos y  es la líder del grupo, desde hace 8 años se dedica a una pequeña tienda que tiene en su casa, además tiene venta de comales y hace tubo con prensa, sus actividades necesitan de recursos por eso solicita la ayuda de fape otorgándole este crédito para comprar algunos artículos que le hacen falta en su tienda como azúcar, café, pastas, jabón, detergente, arroz, frijol, maicillo, etc. También quiere comprar prensa ya que por la temporada baja el precio y puede ganarle un poco más, quiere comprar algunos comales que le han pedido y así seguir apoyando a su familia.
texts.en:
This is the Duo Elizabeth of San Juan Sac. Victalina, 51 years old, is the leader of the group. She has four children and for the past 8 years has been running a small store out of her house. She also sells griddles, newspapers and magazines.

Her business requires resources, which is why she is asking for help from FAPE, requesting a loan to buy some products for her store, such as sugar, coffee, pasta, soap, detergent, rice, beans, sorghum, etc. She also wants to buy newspapers and magazines, since the prices are low due to the season and she can get a bit more profit. She wants to buy some griddles that people have ordered, and with this continue supporting her family.

loans.use: to buy food items to sell in the store.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Agusan Del Norte is part of Mindanao region of the Philippines. Generally, the weather conditions in Mindanao are more stable compared to Visayas region. Typhoons seldom visit the area. It’s favorable to fruit-bearing trees as well as vegetable farming.

Felicitas, 48, has a vegetable stall in one of the public markets of Butuan City, Agusan Del Norte. The profits derived from her business helps provide for the basic needs of her family. However, the risk that she faces is the possibility of rotting if her vegetables are not sold on time. Somehow, Felicitas has learned the trade tips from her thirteen years of experience in vegetable vending. Now she desires to buy different varieties of vegetables to display in her stall in order to attract more buyers. She implores your kind support to make this possible. A loan worth PhP 22,000 will surely go a long way. May you be God’s blessing to her as she aspires to improve her business.

Felicitas is married to Eutemio, a laborer, and they have children, four of whom are still in elementary level. She wants to keep her family united towards the goal to uplift their lives, finish their schooling, improve their business, and acquire their own house and lot. She is a devoted member of CCT Credit Cooperative and she regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy different varieties of vegetables to display in her stall

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers.

Nida has been in this business for 10 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy livestock and feed.

loans.name: Wend La Panga Group

texts.fr: Amsatou est âgée de 22 ans, mariée mère 2 enfants. Elle est une tisseuse et elle pratique cette activité depuis 6 ans. Elle confection ses pagnes très bien et les vends très moins chère; elle a déjà une clientèle fidèle, elle fait tout pour respecter ses échéances.  Elle veut le prêt pour s’acheter du fils en gros à 200 000 f cfa. Elle a déjà reçu le prêt plusieurs fois et à rembourser aux dates prévues.
texts.en:
Amsatou is twenty-two years old, married and mother to two children.  She is a weaver and has been working for six years.  She makes good quality pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing) and sells them at reasonable prices.  As a result, she has a loyal customer base.

Amsatou has requested this loan to buy thread in bulk for 200,000 francs CFA.  She has already had several loans and has always respected the repayment dates.

loans.use: to buy thread to make pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two bundles of second-hand clothing for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy basic foodstuffs (flour, sugar, rice, oil, etc) for sale in his shop.

loans.name: Gulzada

texts.ru: Гулзада, 30 лет, замужем, есть 3 дочери. У нее среднее образование, в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, с 2009 года занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Гулзадs в хозяйстве имеется 0.18 Га собственной земельной доли, на которой она выращивает помидоры. В хозяйстве также есть 2 коровы, 3 овцы. В общей сложности деятельность Гулзады приносит около 24,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 5 телят для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита Гулзада планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса и обучение детей.
texts.en: Gulzada is 30 years old, married, and the mother of three daughters.  She has a secondary education and has been involved in animal husbandry and agriculture since 2009, two activities which constitute an additional income for her family.  Thanks to her very hard work, she now owns 0.18 hectares of her own land, on which she grows tomatoes.  She also has two cows and three sheep on her farm.  In total, her activity brings her about 24,000 som (KGS) per month.  In order to further develop her farming business, she has turned to Bai Tushum and requested a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to buy five calves for fattening and resale.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further increase her business and to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy five calves for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Fatou's Group

texts.fr:
le groupement a été créé le 24 septembre 2013. Les femmes qui le compose ont comme principale activité  le commerce. elles font aussi de l'embauche. le groupement compte 31 femmes toutes habitant la commune de Missirah

Fatoumata qui est l'emprunteuse en vedette est née le 20 janvier 1960.Sur la photo elle se trouve à droite et levant la main gauche. Fatoumata est une femme mariée et a une fille. 

Elle s'active dans l'embouche. elle achète des moutons et des chèvres pour les engraisser avant de les revendre quelques mois aprés.

Avec ce prêt elle compte acheter 4 moutons à 100000f et 4 chèvres 60000f. Elle payera pour les transport de ces animaux 10000f.

les bénéfices du prêt servirons à acheter de la nourriture pour la famille.
texts.en:
This group was created on 24 September 2013.  The women who make up the group work principally as small retailers and raise livestock.  There are thirty-one women in the group and they all live in the commune of Missirah.

Fatoumata (seen on the right in the photo with her hand raised) is the group representative.  She was born on 20 January 1960, is married and has one daughter.  She raises livestock.  She buys sheep and goats, fattens them up and sells them on several months later.  She plans to use her loan to buy four sheep for 100,000 francs CFA and four goats for 60,000 francs CFA.  She will also need to pay transport costs of 10,000 francs CFA.

The profits that Fatoumata makes will buy food for the family.

loans.use: to buy sheep and goats to raise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy vitamins, animal feed and more chickens to raise.

loans.name: G.s Los Agricultores Group

texts.es:
El señor Rodolfo tiene 41 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus cinco hijos, su negocio es la agricultura y vive en una comunidad  de Trojes,  El Paraíso, al Oriente de Honduras.
Don Rodolfo su actividad principal es la agricultura y tiene 20 años de experiencia, gracias a todo este tiempo ha adquirido mucho conocimiento en esta actividad, esta solicitando el préstamo para la compra de semillas y abono para la siembra.
Espera que esta inversión le permita obtener muy buenos resultados y así obtener las ganancias necesarias para salir adelante, uno de sus sueños es poder cambiar las condiciones de vida de su familia. Solicita el préstamo de manera grupal y  los demás integrantes son don Jesús y don Juan quienes de igual manera se dedican a la agricultura y caficultura desde hace varios años.

Trojes, Honduras - Junio del 2015.
texts.en:
Rodolfo, 41, lives with his wife and five children.  He works in agriculture and lives in a community of Trojes, El Paraiso, in eastern Honduras.

Rodolfo has 20 years' experience in agriculture and has acquired much expertise in this field.  He is requesting a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for his crops.  He hopes the investment will give him very good results so he can earn a profit and get ahead.  One of his dreams is to change his family's living conditions.  He is requesting a loan through a communal bank.  The other members of the groujp are Jesus and Juan who also have many years' experience working in agriculture and coffee production.


Trojes, Honduras - June, 2015

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for his business.

loans.name: Irma Concepcion

texts.es: Irma de 34 años de edad, habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos de 16, 10 y 5 años de edad. Irma desde hace 2 años se dedica a prestar sus servicios para una panadería  en la venta pan dulce el cual lo distribuye en su comunidad y sus alrededores, además se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado el cual es la actividad que le genera la mayoría de sus ingresos es por ello que con el propósito de seguir invirtiendo en la compra de ganado a tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para incrementar la producción de su negocio y al mismo tiempo generar mejores ingresos que le permitan brindar a su familia una mejor condición de vida.
texts.en: Irma, 34, lives in her own home with her husband and her three children, ages 16, 10 and 5.  For two years she has been working at a bakery selling pastry which she also distributes in her community and neighboring areas.  She also buys and sells cattle which generates more income.  Therefore in order to continue investing in cattle she has decided to request a loan through FUSAI to increase production.  This will also generate more income which will allow her to give her family better living conditions.

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Fredy Alberto

texts.es: Fredy es un apasionado por el buen estado físico y mental, todos los días ofrece servicio de entrenamiento personal en su Gimnasio ubicado en el municipio de Soledad a partir de las 8 a.m. hasta las 8 p.m.  Su experiencia es muy amplia, se inició en esta actividad con un socio con quien trabajo durante tres años, posteriormente se disolvió la sociedad y Fredy quedó al frente del negocio hace dos años.  La tendencia por el cuidado corporal incrementa con el trascurrir del tiempo, por esa razón su oferta de máquinas no está acorde con la capacidad del Gimnasio y para mitigar esta limitación, está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en una maquina multifuerza.  Con esta inversión podrá ofrecer un mejor servicio y aportar a la meta personal de ofrecer bienestar a su familia.  A futuro desea remodelar el local y dotarlo de más máquinas para el entrenamiento personal.
texts.en:
Fredy is passionate about good physical and mental health, and he offers a personal trainer service at a gym in the town of Soledad from 8:00 a.m. to 8 p.m.  He has vast experience and started this business with a partner who worked with him for three years.  Two years ago they split up and Fredy took over the business.

The trend toward fitness has increased over time and Fredy does not have enough machines to meet capacity.  Therefore, to overcome this limitation, he is requesting a CrediKiva loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation to buy a fitness machine.

Through this investment he will be able to offer better service and reach his goal of improving his family's well-being.  In the future he wants to remodel the gym and and add more personal trainer equipment.

loans.use: To buy a fitness machine.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: Julio de 30 años es un emprendedor que gracias a su compromiso y dedicación, ha logrado consolidar sus servicios de albañilería y transporte en el municipio de Soledad en el Departamento del Atlántico.  Durante 10 años laboró en Venezuela y desde el vecino país, enviaba dinero a sus familiares para que le hicieran inversiones en Colombia; ellos compraron dos motocarros que se utilizan como medio de transporte en  el municipio de Soledad y otros aledaños al lugar, así adquiere un ingreso diario y seguro.  Hoy en día cuenta con dos años de estar administrando el negocio y está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará otra motocarro.  Su meta a futuro es continuar prosperando en el negocio y adquirir más motos.  Su meta a futuro es ofrecer a su hijo menor de edad, estudios académicos de calidad.
texts.en:
Julio, 30, is an entrepreneur who, through commitment and dedication, has consolidated his bricklaying and transport services in the town of Soledad in the department of Atlantico.  For ten years he worked in Venezuela and would send money home to relatives to invest in Colombia.  They bought motorcycles to use for transport in Soledad and other local communities, earning a stable daily income.

Now he has been managing the business for two years and is requesting a CrediKiva loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation to buy another vehicle.  His goal for the future is to continue prospering in his business and buy more motorcycles.  In the future he wants to give his minor child a good education.

loans.use: To buy another vehicle.

loans.name: Oswaldo Segundo

texts.es: Oswaldo de 50 años por herencia familiar aprendió a elaborar bollos de maíz y al encontrarse en una difícil situación laboral, se inclinó por el negocio de sus padres puesto que su madre estaba muy enferma y su padre necesitaba de su apoyo.  En la actualidad su microempresa de Bollos lleva tres años de funcionamiento y cuenta con el apoyo de su cónyuge e hijos, así mismo contrató unos vecinos para la producción de los bollos y en total son siete sus empleados.  Sus principales clientes son tenderos del municipio de Soledad y su horario laboral inicia a partir de las 3 a.m. y finaliza a las 8 p.m. su proceso productivo inicia en la cocción del maíz, se deja reposar y se muele para convertirlo en maza que luego se añade el resto de preparativos y por último se envuelven en hojas de maíz. Con la finalidad de ser más productivo, está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar un molino eléctrico, una olla grande y materias primas.  Su meta a futuro es ampliar la capacidad de su negocio y poder tener más ingresos que le permitan comprar su propia vivienda.
texts.en:
Oswaldo is 50 years old. He learnt to make corn pies from his parents and when he found himself in a difficult work situation he opted to take on his parents' business because his mother was very sick and his father needed his support. 

Currently his micro-business has been operating for 3 years and he relies on the support of his wife and children. Likewise, he has hired some neighbours to make the pies and in total he has seven employees.

His main customers are shopkeepers in the municipality of Soledad and his working day begins at 3am and finishes at 8pm. The production process involves firstly cooking the corn, leaving it to rest, and than grinding it to create masa dough. The rest of the ingredients are then added and then finally they are wrapped in corn leaves. 

With the goal of becoming more productive, he is requesting his first Kiva loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, to purchase an electric mill, a large pot and ingredients. His goal for the future is to increase his business' capacity, and to obtain a higher income which would allow him to purchase his own home.

loans.use: to purchase an electric mill, a large pot and ingredients

loans.name: Badamjunii

texts.en:
Badamjunii, 48 years old, lives with his wife and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been selling second-hand clothes for 15 years. His wife helps him in running the business. Their son graduated from the university this summer and is actively seeking a job.

Badamjunii is requesting a loan of 5,000,000 MNT to buy building materials such as sand, cements, planks and bricks in order to repair his old house and build a barn next to it.

This renovation will have a tremendous impact on his family's well being. In winter, his house was freezing and all in his family caught colds and spent lots of money on medicine. In the future, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned, releasing less pollution into the air.

loans.use: to renovate his house in order to burn less coal for heating

loans.name: Erdenebat

texts.en:
Erdenebat, 54 years old, drives a taxi for a living and has 11 years of experience in this service. His wife has retired from work and gets a pension. Their five children all live on their own.

Erdenebat is one of the most reliable clients of our institution, and this time he is requesting a loan of 800 USD to build a greenhouse in order to grow vegetables on his own land. He wants to provide home-grown vegetables such as carrots, cabbages and potatoes to meet domestic food needs.

loans.use: to grow vegetables in order to meet domestic food needs

loans.name: Otgonsuren

texts.en:
Mrs. Otgonsuren, 47 years old, lives with her husband and son in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. She has been working as nurse at hospital for 27 years. Her husband renders taxi service to local people. Their son studies at university and will graduate next year. 

She is requesting a loan of 3000000 MNT to buy building materials such as bricks, cements, planks and fiberglass for house renovation. After that, her family will live in comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned, releasing less pollutant into air.

loans.use: to renovate her house in order to burn less coal

loans.name: Odgerel

texts.en:
Odgerel, 26 years old, lives with her husband and child in Kherlen, an easternmost town of Mongolia. She has been working as a senior manager at a trade company since 2013. Her husband works at an oil exporting company. 

The house her family lives in has deteriorated over the years and it needs urgent repair. She is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to buy building materials such as bricks, cements, planks and fiberglass for house renovation. After that, her family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned, releasing less pollutants into the air.

loans.use: to renovate her house in order to make it comfortable and warm, burning less coal and releasing less pollutants into the air.

loans.name: Marta Lopez

texts.es: Marta de 40 años de edad, vive en casa propia a lado de compañero de vida, su hijo varón  de 14 años y sus dos hijas de 6 y 5 años de edad. Ella posee una panadería en su propia casa desde hace veinticinco años por lo que posee una gran experiencia y es precisamente eso lo que le ha permitido ganarse la confianza de todos sus clientes los cuales son muchos. Marta  desea mejorar su negocio y comprar más materia prima para la elaboración del pan y es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI parta invertir en productos como: harina, azúcar, manteca, levadura, entre otras cosas más, las cuales le permitan incrementar la producción para mejorar las ganancias de su negocio ya que es la única fuente de ingresos y es de esta forma que por medio de su trabajo ha logrado seguir adelante y brindar todo el apoyo necesario a su familia.
texts.en: 40 year-old Marta lives in her own house with her life partner, her 14 year-old son and her daughters, aged 6 and 5 years. She has owned a bakery in her house for the last 25 years, where she has a lot of experience, and it is exactly this which has enabled her to gain the trust of her customers, of which there are many. Marta wishes to improve her business and buy more supplies to make bread, which is why she is asking FUSAI for a loan to invest in products such as flour, sugar, butter, and yeast, among other things. These will allow her to increase production and the income for her business, as she is its only source of income. Through her work, she has managed to provide for and support her family as necessary.

loans.use: to invest in flour, sugar, butter, yeast, among other things, which will allow her to increase her bread production.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es: Maria vive en casa propia con su hija y sus dos nietos, ella se dedica desde hace 25 años a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal para poder continuar con la elaboración de las tortillas y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Maria lives in her own house with her daughter and two grand-children; for the last 25 years she has worked making and selling tortillas. Her business is located in her home and she has many customers. She is asking for a loan to buy corn by the 100 lb and limes to continue making tortillas, in order to increase her income and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: buy corn by the 100 lb and limes

loans.name: Nubia Esther

texts.es: Nubia de 59 años, deseaba ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijas; ella necesitaba generar ingresos pero también deseaba ser una buena madre y ama de casa, así que decidió aceptar la sugerencia de un familiar y un amigo para viajar a Maicao, municipio reconocido en Colombia como centro del comercio de la Región Caribe, en donde se pueden adquirir electrodomésticos a un bajo costo y de fácil comercialización, de tal manera que desde hace 10 años y por pedidos de su clientela integrada por familiares, amigos y vecinos vende televisores, ventiladores, aires acondicionados, licuadoras etc; realiza sus ventas a crédito con pagos por cuotas quincenales o mensuales.  Los resultados de su negocio han sido satisfactorios, pues cada día tiene un mayor número de clientes y en muchas ocasiones debe esperar recuperar parte de la cartera colocada  para volver a invertir. Actualmente Nubia tramita su primer credikiva a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, recursos que requiere para invertir en la compra de televisores y aires acondicionados, para atender los pedidos de sus clientes. Ella sueña con el crecimiento progresivo de su negocio, para obtener ganancias superiores que le permitan hacer de sus hijas unas profesionales.
texts.en: 59 year-old Nubia wanted to offer her daughters a better quality of life; she needed to generate income but she also wanted to be a good mother and housewife, so she decided to accept a relative and friend's suggestion to travel to Macaio, a town recognised in Colombia as the trading centre of the Caribbean. This is where she acquired low-cost electrical appliances that were easy to introduce to the market, meaning that for the last 10 years and upon request of her customers (made up of family members, friends and neighbours), she has been selling televisions, fans, air-conditioning, blenders and so on. She sells her products in fortnightly or monthly installments. The results of her business have been satisfactory, as she gets more customers every day, and she often has to wait to make back what she has spent before investing again. She is currently processing her first Kiva loan though the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, for supplies she needs to invest in purchasing televisions and air-conditioning to keep up with her customers' demands. She dreams of her business gradually growing in order to increase her income which will allow her daughters to become professionals.

loans.use: Compra de televisores y aires acondicionados

loans.name: Samah

texts.en:
Samah is a 18-years-old single young lady from Jenin city. Her father is an employee in a local firm where he makes a low income, which is barely enough to cover all of the family's needs. Samah is a student in the university where she studies Nursing. She wants to complete a BA degree and find a job to help her family cover part of their expenses.

Samah took a USD loan from FATEN, which will help her to pay the university installment fees for the coming semester. By taking this loan, Samah will be able to pay part of the urgent expenses for her studies.

loans.use: to pay the university installment fees for the coming semester.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is a 48-year-old widow. She has had a beauty parlor for many years, and offers many services to her customers such as makeup, hair styling and facials. Through her excellent customer service, she has become very famous in her street. 

In order to meet the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying more of a variety of cosmetics products for the parlor. This is why she has applied a loan of 60,000 PKR  to buy hair care products, skin products and hair rollers to treat more customers in order to gain profits to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products and hair rollers to treat more customers in order to gain profits to build her own house.

loans.name: Nusarat

texts.en:
Nusarat is 28 years old, a married woman and mother of 6 children. She has been in the tailoring business for many years to support her husband. She accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to meet the expenses of household and the educational needs of their children. That is why she started tailoring at home to better support her family. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Now she has requested for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more reels of threads, packs of buttons, ribbons and laces for meeting orders on time. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Nusarat hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing better standard of living for her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of threads, packs of buttons, ribbons and laces for meeting orders on time.

loans.name: Anwari

texts.en:
Anwari is a 58-year- old vigorous married lady. She is a mother of seven children.

She has been manufacturing carpets for many years to contribute in the family income. She offers various handmade carpets in different colors and designs to the people of her community and makes enough to lead a decent life.

For the improvement of her business she contacted Kashf foundation and applied for a loan of 60,000 PKR to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers to increase her sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and dreams to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers to increase her sales.

loans.name: Rakhil

texts.en:
Rakhil is a 28-year-old married woman and a mother of three children.

She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing services of tailoring in her community. She has been doing this for many years. She very well knows the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life.

To help her continue operations of her business, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy stitching material such as spools of threads in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons to sew more dresses on time. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy stitching material such as spools of threads in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons to sew more dresses on time.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 19 years old, single, and lives in a sector of Jordan called Ramtha.

He is a student at the university, majoring in business administration.

Mohammad has a lot of dreams to achieve after he graduates, but his father cannot help him to cover his education fees. Therefore, he asked for an education loan to help him cover his university fees.

loans.use: to cover his university fees.

loans.name: Gulomjon

texts.en:
Gulomjon was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1980. He is living in a village with his family. He is married and has three children.

He is a farmer and keeps livestock. His wife helps him to take care of the livestock. He likes his activity and does it with pleasure.

He appealed to IMON asking financial support to pay his wife's tuition fee. He hopes to be supported by Kiva lenders and have an educated wife.

loans.use: to pay his wife's tuition fee.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a 22-year-old single lady from Gaza city. Her father is an employee in a local firm where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs.

Hanan is a student in the university. She wants to take the BA degree and find a job to help her family in part of their expenses.

Hanan took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new laptop for her study. By taking this loan, Hanan will be able to do her homework and reports easily.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for her study.

loans.name: Rosa Elida

texts.es: Rosa de 40 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos, ella posee un gimnasio y venta de suplementos vitaminicos en su lugar de residencia desde hace 20 años tiene muchos clientes por el buen servicio que brinda, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra salir adelante, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de suplementos vitaminicos por mayor para poder continuar con su trabajo ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos.
texts.en: Rosa is 40 years old and lives in her own home with her life partner and her two children. She has a gym and has been selling vitamin supplements from her place of residence for 20 years. She has a lot of clients as she provides a good service and she manages to get ahead with what she earns from her work. She is requesting a loan to buy wholesale vitamin supplements so that she can continue with her work, as that is her only source of income.

loans.use: to buy wholesale vitamin supplements

loans.name: Ana Gladis

texts.es: Ana de 32 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos desde hace varios años, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda encementando el piso pero como no posee de suficiente capital,esta solicitando a INTEGRAL un crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción y pago de mano de obra y así poder mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en: Ana, 32 years old, lives in her own house with her family. She has worked selling cosmetics for some years. With what she earns from her sales, she manages to cover some of the household expenses. She wants to improve her house, cementing the floor, but as she doesn't have sufficient capital, she is asking INTEGRAL for a loan to purchase construction materials and pay labor costs and, so, to be able to improve her house.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Dina Emerita

texts.es: Doña Dina de 59 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella posee un comedor ubicado en el mercado municipal desde hace 10 años, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo es como ayuda en los gastos del hogar ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas materia prima arroz, pollos, carne, frijoles, fruta, verduras, etc. para variar su menú y así atender mejor a sus clientes para tener mejores ganancias económicas.
texts.en: Dina, 59 years old, lives in her own house with her family. She has had a restaurant located in the municipal market for the past 10 years. She has many customers due to her good prices and her friendliness when selling. With what she earns from her work, she helps with the household expenses. She is asking for a loan to purchase more raw materials such as rice, chicken, meat, beans, fruits, vegetables, etc. to vary her menu and, so, to serve her customers better to have more earnings.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials such as rice, chicken, meat, beans, fruits, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es: Victor de 33 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el posee desde hace mas de 5 años una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, con las ganancias que obtiene logra salir adelante, el está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Victor, 33 years old, lives in his own house with his wife. He has had a small store located in his house for over 5 years. he has many customers due to his good prices and his friendliness hen selling. With the earnings get gets, he manages to get ahead. He is asking for the loan to be able to purchase more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, sweets, sweet breads, etc. and, so, to be able to have more income to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more soups, eggs, basic grains, sweets, sweet breads, etc.

loans.name: Sumaira

texts.en:
Sumaira is a 33-year-old, married woman. She has two children.

She is a vigorous lady, and for the past many years, she has been running a cloth purchase and sale business. She buys various fabrics in different colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business.

Now, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

Sumaira expects a boost in her earnings with the loan and she plans to spend the part of her profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is age 27 years married to Justine, and she supports six children.

She has been a salonist for the last seven years and the business earns her KES 5,000 per month.

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase mores stock of hair pieces, hair neutralizer, hair chemicals and a blow dryer so as to meet client needs in beauty.

She plans to use the gained profit to purchase a dairy cow for milk production and expand her projects.

Her hope is to be financially stable and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase mores stock of hair pieces, hair neutralizer, hair chemicals and a blow dryer so as to meet client needs in beauty.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase blouses, skirts, ladies' hand bags, lingerie, soup, vegetables, drinks, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is postman from Untesti village, Ungheni region in Moldova. She also manages a small farm. Angela grows cereals on her three-hectare land and raises pigs, cows, chickens and one horse.

She is married. Her husband, Nicolae, is disabled but he helps her in managing this farm. Angela and Nicolae have six children, five girls and one boy. All of them are good school students and helpers of their parents.

This hard-working farmer wants to develop her business around the pigs, cows and chickens that she owns and be able to meet her family’s needs and be self-reliant.

Angela will use this loan to build a new stable for the animals and buy school supplies for her children.

loans.use: to build a new stable for her animals and buy school supplies for her children.

loans.name: Hector

texts.es:
Héctor, de 50 años de edad, es un agricultor en pequeño, no estudio, pero aprendió a trabajar en el campo por herencias de sus padres, actualmente vive con su hijo, porque por situaciones de la vida, su compañera de vida lo abandono junto a su hijo. 

Hector, trabaja en la agricultura y también trabaja en transporte de cargas pesadas, trasladando material con un camión que compro con mucho sacrificio.

Hector, necesita el crédito para comprar llantas para su camión, porque actualmente es el encargado del traslado de la basura de su municipio y las llantas que tiene representa un peligro para trabajar, además parte del crédito será para sembrar en su parcela de maíz.

El sueña con mantener su camión en buen estado y tener una buena producción de granos básicos.
texts.en:
Héctor, 50 years old, is a small-scale farmer. He didn't go to school, but he learned to work in the countryside from his parents. Currently he lives with his son because, due to life circumstances, his life partner left him and their son. 

Héctor works in agriculture and also works in heavy transport, hauling materials with his truck which he bought with a lot of sacrifice.

Héctor needs the loan to purchase tires for his truck because currently he is in charge of hauling the municipality's trash and the tires that he has are a danger for his work. In addition, part of the loan will be to plant his plot of corn. 

He dreams of keeping his truck in good condition and having a good production of basic grains.

loans.use: to purchase tires for his truck.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new laptop for her study.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is aged 27 years married to Joash and she supports 3 children. 

She has been selling sugarcane in the market for the last 5 years and the business earns her KES 6,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase fertilizers for top dressing her crops so as to get a better harvest for sale to clients and meet client and family needs.   

She plans to use the gained profit to purchase a dairy cow for milk production and expand her projects. 

Her hope is to be financially stable and expand her business sector.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for top dressing her crops so as to get a better harvest for sale to clients and meet client and family needs.

loans.name: Abadahemuka Group

texts.en:
Rose is a group leader; aged 36 years.She is married with 3 children aged between 12 and 16 years. who has 3 years. The group is called ABADAHEMUKA means “INTEGRITY PEOPLE” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business for changing their better future. 

Rose has a shop and has been running in a business for 7 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice for sale. The profits from the business will be used to increase savings and to pay school fees of her children.

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice for sale.

loans.name: Mahdi

texts.en:
Mahdi is a 19-years-old single young man from Rafah city. His father is an employee in the public sector where he gets a low and unstable income. This income is barely cover all the family needs. 

Mahdi is a student in the university where he studies Business Administration. He wants to take the BA degree and find a job to help his family in part of their expenses. 

Mahdi took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his study. By taking this loan, Mahdi will be able to do his home works and reports easily. Mahdi appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his university course in Business Administration.

loans.name: Munira

texts.en:
Munira is a 56-year-old woman doing a business of animal purchase and sale. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is very motivated to provide her family with the basic necessities of life. 

She has requested a loan of 30,000 PKR. She intends to use this loan amount to purchase more baby goats and calves to serve more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to serve more customers.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos, es un hombre trabajador y de firmes creencias y principios morales, por tal razón es muy conocido en su comunidad y respetado en su familia, está acompañado y tiene 2 hijos de 4 y 6 años de edad.

Carlos, aprendió el oficio de la agricultura, gracias a sus abuelos que lo crecieron y le enseñaron muy bien todo acerca de la siembra de granos básicos y de esa manera ha sacado adelante a su familia.

Carlos, necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas como abono, pesticidas y herbicidas para comenzar a preparar la tierra y poder sembrar sus granos.

Carlos, desea seguir trabajando en la agricultura y que sus hijos crezcan sanos y con principios y valores bien fundamentados.
texts.en:
Carlos is a hard-working man with firm beliefs and moral principles. For this reason, he is well-known in his community and respected in his family. He is partnered and has 2 children, ages 4 and 6.

Carlos learned the agricultural work thanks to his grandparents who raised him and taught him very well about planting basic grains, and in this way he has gotten his family ahead.

Carlos needs the loan to purchase agricultural supplies such as manure, pesticides, and herbicides to begin to prepare the land and be able to plant his grains.

Carlos wants to continue working in agriculture and that his children grow up health and with good fundamental principles and values.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies such as manure, pesticides and herbicides to began to prepare the land and be able to plant his grains.

loans.name: Pedro Melvin

texts.es:
Pedro, de 29 años de edad, es agricultor, debido a escasos recursos económicos solo estudio hasta octavo grado, pero a pesar de las dificultades de la vida, ha asistido a talleres de aprendizaje al manejo de la agricultura, ya que es un conocimiento que actualmente pone en práctica, actualmente cultiva todo tipo de granos básicos y hortalizas en la época lluviosa.

Pedro, posee alrededor de 5 años de estar viviendo en la comunidad, pero por motivos de delincuencia tuvo que emigrar de ese lugar; actualmente está acompañado y en su casa vive su hija de 2 años de edad y su esposa que se dedica a prestar servicios en un molino de motor.

Pedro, necesita el dinero del préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas y pagar mano de obra para las prácticas agropecuarias.

Pedro, sueña con tener cultivos bajo protección y elaborar una casa maya, donde pueda proteger más sus cultivos para tener un mayor rendimiento en su producción.
texts.en:
Pedro, 29 years old, is a farmer. Due to limited resources, he only went to school up to the eighth grade, but despite the difficulties in his life, he has gone to workshops to learn to manage agriculture. It is knowledge that he currently puts into practice, he currently grows all sorts of basic grains and vegetables in the rainy season.

Pedro has about 5 years of living in the community but, due to crime problems, he had to leave this place. Currently he is partnered and in his house live his 2-year-old daughter and his partner, who works at a motor-run mill. 

Pedro needs the money from the loan to purchase agricultural supplies and pay labor costs for agriculture.

Pedro dreams of having his crops under protection and building a shelter of mesh which can protect his crops more to have a better level of production.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies and pay labor costs for agriculture.

loans.name: Shaher

texts.en:
Shaher is a 18-years-old single young man from Rafah city. His father is an employee in the public sector where he gets a low and unstable income. This income is barely cover all the family needs. 

Shaher is a student in the university where he studies Business administration. He wants to take the BA degree and find a job to help his family in part of their expenses. 

Shaher took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his study. By taking this loan, Shaher will be able to do his home works and reports easily. Shaher appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his university course in Business Administration

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is aged 27 years married to Amos and she supports 3 children. 

She has been selling maize cereals in the market for the last 6 years and the business earns her KES 3,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase more stocks of maize cereals for sale to clients and meet both client and family needs. 
  
She plans to use the gained profit to purchase a dairy cow for milk production and expand her projects.
 
Her hope is to be financially stable and expand her business sector.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of maize cereals for sale to clients and meet both client and family needs.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Joyce is aged 57 years married and she supports 2 children.  She has been a poultry keeper for the last 10 years and the business earns her KES 6,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase iron sheets for building a poultry house and purchasing poultry feeds so as to increase the number of poultry hatched and sold to clients.  

She plans to use the gained profit to purchase a dairy cow for milk production and educate her children. 
Her hope is to be financially stable and expand her agricultural sector.

loans.use: To purchase iron sheets for building a poultry house and purchasing poultry feeds so as to increase the number of poultry hatched and sold to clients.

loans.name: Faten

texts.en:
Faten is a 21-year-old single lady from Rafah city. Her father is an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This income is barely covers all the family's needs. Faten is a student in the university where she studied information technology. She wants to take the BA degree and find a job to help out her family with part of their expenses.

Faten took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new laptop to help her study. By taking this loan, Faten will be able to do her homework and reports easily. Faten appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new laptop to help her study.

loans.name: Loraine Paola

texts.es: Loraine de 22 años y muchos deseos de crecer personal y profesionalmente,  encontró en el negocio de venta de víveres su oportunidad para generar los ingresos que requería para cubrir sus gastos, aprovechando la experiencia que adquirió como vendedora de una cacharrería e identificando que existía una demanda insatisfecha en el barrio donde reside, debido a la distancia que debían recorrer sus vecinos para realizar sus compras diarias. En sus inicios comenzó a llevar a casa artículos de la cacharrería para comercializarlos entre los vecinos y poco a poco y por sugerencia de su clientela adquirió víveres como arroz, aceites, granos, pastas, entre otros, hasta organizar su propia tienda la cual atiende diariamente de 6:00 a.m. a 10:00 p.m., sin embargo aún requiere aumentar el surtido de su negocio para lo cual está tramitando su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, recursos que planea invertir en una mayor cantidad de víveres como arroz, aceite, granos, pastar, frutas, verduras y carnes frías. Su sueño de prosperidad se centra en ampliar cada día más su negocio para generar un mejor ingreso que le permita mejorar su calidad de vida y terminar sus estudios.
texts.en: Loraine, 22 years old, with great desire for personal and professional growth, found in grocery sales her opportunity to generate the income that she needed to cover her expenses, taking advantage of the experience that she got as a saleswoman at a neighborhood store and identifying that there was an unsatisfied demand in the neighborhood where she lives, due to the distance that her neighbors had to go to make their daily purchases. At the beginning, she began to bring basic products to her house to sell them to her neighbors and little by little, from her customers' suggestions, she got groceries such as rice, oil, grains, pasta, and more, until she established her own store which she opens from 6:00 am to 10:00 pm. However, she still needs to increase the stock in her business so she is asking for her first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, resources that she plans to invest in a greater quantity of groceries such as rice, oil, grains, pastas, fruits, vegetables and cold meats. Her dream for prosperity focuses on continuing to expand her business to generate more income which will allow her to improve her quality of life and finish her education.

loans.use: to purchase a greater variety of groceries such as rice, oil, grains, pasta, fruits, vegetables and cold meats.

loans.name: Mussrat

texts.en: Mussrat is a 33-year-old married woman with 3 children. Some years ago she started her business selling animals to help her husband in meeting their everyday expenditures. She earns a good amount to contribute to the family income. Now she has requested for a loan of 30,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount to purchase more cattle to resell in the market. She desires to improve her standard of living through all her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle resell in the market.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is aged 35 years married to Abraham and she supports 7 children. 

She has been selling potatoes, tomatoes and onions in the market for the last 8 years and the business earns her KES 5,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase more stocks of potatoes, onions and tomatoes for sale to clients and meet both client and family needs. 
  
She plans to use the gained profit to purchase a dairy cow for milk production and expand her business. 

Her hope is to be financially stable and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of potatoes, onions and tomatoes for sale to clients and meet both client and family needs.

loans.name: Ombui

texts.en:
Ombui is aged 21 years, married to Job and she supports 1 child. 
She has been selling sodas to clients for the last 4 years and the business earns her KES 6,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase more soft drinks such as sodas for sale to clients and meet client needs. 
She plans to use the gained profit to purchase a dairy cow for milk production and educate her child. 
Her hope is to be financially stable and expand her business sector.

loans.use: To purchase more soft drinks such as sodas for sale to clients and meet client needs.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: Roberto tiene 39 años de edad  y toda su vida ha estado vinculado al negocio conocido en Colombia como “tienda de Barrio” donde vende víveres como arroz, aceite, legumbres, verduras, frutas, lácteos y demás productos de la canasta familiar; cuando niño ayudaba a su padre y al adquirir su mayoría de edad continuó con la tradición del negocio familiar al abrir su propia tienda hace 23 años.
