Con constancia y la perseverancia Roberto ha logrado sacar adelante su proyecto de vida familiar, aunque  asegura que lo más difícil de este negocio es sacrificar el tiempo libre pues debe estar disponible para su clientela desde las 6 a.m. hasta las 9:30 p.m., de domingo a domingo, y resulta complicado atender las necesidades recreativas de la familia, pero ver a sus clientes felices, se convierte en la mejor recompensa. Roberto asegura que  su capital de trabajo no le alcanza para conservar el surtido diario que requiere su clientela, por lo cual está tramitando su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para la compra de granos, carnes, lácteos, frutas y verduras y adquirir un enfriador que necesita para conservar los alimentos perecederos. Su visión para el futuro en generar las utilidades suficientes para abrir otros puntos de venta que le permitan mejorar su calidad de vida y brindar una buena educación a su hija.
texts.en: Roberto is 39 years old and all his life he has been in the business known in Colombia as the "neighborhood store" where he sells groceries such as rice, oil, legumes, vegetables, fruits, dairy products, and other products for the family pantry. When he was a child, he helped his father and when he became an adult, he continued with the family business, opening his own store 23 years ago. With consistency and perseverance, Roberto has managed to get his family life ahead, though he says that the most difficult part of this business is the sacrifice of free time since he needs to be available for his customers from 6:00 am to 9:30 pm all week long, and it is difficult to take care of the family's recreation needs. But, seeing his customers happy becomes the best reward. Roberto says that his working capital is not enough to keep his daily stock of fruits and vegetables and to get a cooler that he needs to keep the perishable foods. His vision for the future is to get sufficient profits to open other sales locations which will allow him to improve his quality of life and offer his daughter a good education.

loans.use: to purchase grains, meat, dairy products, fruit and vegetables and get a cooler that he needs to keep the perishable foods.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is aged 28 years old. He has been a dairy farmer for the last 20 years and the business earns him an income of KES 20,000 per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase a dairy cow so as to increase the supply of milk  to clients. 

He plans to use the gained profit to repay the loan and educate his children. 

His hope are to expand his agricultural sector and be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow so as to increase the supply of milk  to clients

loans.name: Zaitoon

texts.en:
Zaitoon is a 41 years old married woman.  She deals in business selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. 

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 30000  to purchase more animals to increase her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to increase her sales

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 20-years-old single young man from Dier El Balah city. His father is an employee in the public sector where he gets a low and unstable income. This income is barely cover all the family needs. 

Hassan is a student in the university where he studies Medical Analysis. He wants to take the BA degree and find a job to help his family in part of their expenses. 

Hassan took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his study. By taking this loan, Hassan will be able to do his home works and reports easily. Hassan appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his university study in Medical Analysis

loans.name: Dorys Isabel

texts.es: Dorys es una emprendedora de 49 años que por tradición familiar aprendió el arte de la confección desde muy joven y perfeccionó sus habilidades trabajando en varias empresas de confección; hace 15 años decidió trabajar por cuenta propia desde la comodidad de su hogar elaborando todo tipo de prendas de vestir de acuerdo a los pedidos de sus clientes (vecinos y familiares). Dorys tiene claro cuáles son sus prioridades y armoniza sus objetivos personales y profesionales para imprimir una fuerte dinámica de acción en su trabajo y a la vez dedicar tiempo de calidad al cuidado de su hogar. Ella está tramitando su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, primer financiamiento que requiere para adquirir una máquina de coser industrial para mejorar la calidad de su costura e invertir en telas que le permitan diseñar prendas de vestir para ofrecer a su clientela. Su visión para su negocio es brindar un aporte al sector productivo organizando un taller con varios empleados y su meta es lograr su desarrollo personal, adquirir su casa propia y contribuir a mejorar la mejor calidad de vida de quienes están bajo su responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Dorys is a 49 year old entrepreneur who learned from family tradition the art of making apparel since she was very young and perfected her skills working in various apparel companies. Fifteen years ago she decided to work for herself from the comfort of her home making all types of garments according to customer orders (neighbors and relatives). 

Dorys is clear what are her priorities and harmonizes her personal and professional objectives to print a strong dynamic action in her work and also spend quality time taking care of her home. She is handling her first credikiva with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, her first financing that was required to acquire a purchase an industrial sewing machine to improve the quality of her stitching and invest in fabrics that allow her to design garments to offer to her customers.

Her vision for her business is to provide a contribution to the productive sector by organizing a workshop with several employees. Her goal is to achieve personal development, acquire her own house and contribute to improving the quality of life for those who are under her responsibility.

loans.use: to purchase an industrial sewing machine to improve the quality of her stitching and invest in fabrics that allow her to design garments to offer her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for high  milk production to clients

loans.name: Elizandro Ernesto

texts.es: Elizandro vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hija, el se dedica a la reparación y venta de llantas posee mas de 2 años de experiencia, su negocio el cual esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por su buen trabajo, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el cliente está solicitando un crédito para la compra de llantas rines, parches, tubos etc. todo por mayor ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo e ingresos.
texts.en: Elizandro lives in his own house with her wife and their daughter. He makes a living in the reparation and sale of tires with more than 2 years of experience. His business is located in his place of residence, and he has many customers due to his good work. With the earnings that he obtains he is able to solve some household expenses. He is requesting a loan for the purchase of tire wheels, patches, tubes, etc. wholesale because this is his only form of work and income.

loans.use: to buy tire wheels, patches, tubes, etc. wholesale.

loans.name: Awurade Beye Group

texts.en:
These members are part of the group called Awurade Beye, which is made up of five members. This group is made up of women who work in commerce such as materials, fruits, wax-print and general goods.

Alima, who is the second from the left in the photo, is the representative of the group. She is 36 years old, married, and the mother of one child.

Alima has worked for four years by selling African wax-print cloth. With this loan, she plans to buy more African wax-print cloth. She is going to sell from door to door. With the earnings, she is going to support her husband with their daily expenses and also reinvest back into the business.

They will hold each other responsible for repayment of the loan.

loans.use: to buy more African wax-printed cloth to sell from door to door

loans.name: Lorena Guadalupe

texts.es: Lorena de 35 años de edad, reside en casa humilde pero propia junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos de 17 y 13 años de edad quienes se encuentran estudiando actualmente. Lorena posee una venta de pupusas de variedad como son de queso, chicharrón, fríjol con queso, de mora, etc. además elabora panes con vegetales con pollo, en su casa de residencia, trabajo el cual le permite apoyar de gran manera a su compañero de  vida para el sustento diario del hogar y solventar los gastos del mismo.  Ella posee mucha clientela es por eso que  solícita un crédito a FUSAI a través del cual pueda invertir en  comprar mayor cantidad de: maíz, frijoles, pan, pollo, verduras, queso, chicharrón, etc., para la elaboración de las ricas pupusas y panes con pollo.
texts.en: Lorena is 35 years old and lives in her own modest home with her husband and two children, aged 17 and 13, who are both currently studying. Lorena sells pupusas (stuffed tortillas) with fillings like cheese, fried pork rind, beans and cheese, and blackberry, and she also makes bread with chicken and vegetables; she does this in her own home. This work allows her to support her husband with the daily living expenses and make a significant contribution to these costs. She has a lot of clients and she is therefore asking for a loan through FUSAI to invest in buying more maize, beans, bread, chicken, vegetables, cheese and pork rind, to make her delicious pupusas and bread with chicken.

loans.use: to invest in maize, beans, bread, chicken, vegetables, cheese and pork rind, to make her delicious stuffed tortillas and bread with chicken.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy farm inputs to improve the quality of their output.

loans.name: Khamphai Group

texts.en:
Sone’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  Sone and her group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now she can shift to other pursuits.  

Sone and her village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years; within this 2 years filter users, like Sone’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy bicycles to help improve service delivery

loans.name: Cad Dag Lworo Group

texts.en:
Vicky is a single mother with 2 children and lives in a starch factory in Lira district. She lost her husband during the Kony war insurgence and she has looked after her kids and pays their school feel through the brewing business.
She has applied for a loan of 300,0000 UGX to buy mollasses for alcohol brewing to increase her delivery and also serve her clients better. This will increase her income and sustain her family. 
She is so thankful to Ugafode microfinance and Kiva lenders for the opportunity given to her to meet her children's needs and increase her family's income.
The seventh person at the extreme right is the UGAFODE credit officer in charge of the group.

loans.use: boost her brewery by buying a stock of molasses to increase production

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen is a 29-year-old married woman and she supports a family of 4 children. She has been a dairy farmer for the last 20 years and the business earns her an income of 20,000 KES per month. She has applied for her first loan of 25,000 KES from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase a dairy cow for higher milk production to sell to clients. She plans to use the gained profit to repay the loan and educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to expand her agricultural sector and be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for high milk production to sell to clients

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy stock of curtains to sell

loans.name: Jaime Antonio

texts.es: Jaime vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, el posee una pequeña tienda desde hace varios años ubicada en su lugar de residencia vende una variedad de productos como golosinas, refrescos, granos básicos, café, sopas, huevos, gelatinas, azúcar, etc. y tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería por mayor ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y así podrá tener mejores ganancias para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Jaime lives in his own home with his life partner. For some years he has had a small shop in his home selling a variety of products, such as snacks, soft drinks, bulk grains, coffee, soups, eggs, jellies and sugar. He has a lot of clients because of his good prices. He is requesting a loan to buy more goods wholesale as this is his only source of income; he will then be able to earn more money for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy snacks, soft drinks, bulk grains, coffee, soups, eggs, jellies and sugar wholesale.

loans.name: Sonia Elizabeth

texts.es: Sonia de 49 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de zapatos por catálogos desde hace varios años, su negocio está ubicado en una zona muy transitada por eso posee muchos clientes, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante, Sonia está solicitando un crédito para la compra de zapatos por mayor para poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Sonia, age 49, is a single mother. She lives in her own house with her son. She has been selling shoes by catalog for several years. Her business is located in a very heavily traveled area. Therefore, she has a lot of customers. With what she gets from her sales, she manages to get ahead.

Sonia is requesting a loan to buy shoes wholesale in order to be able to have better earnings.

loans.use: to buy shoes wholesale.

loans.name: Santos Andres

texts.es:
SANTOS TIENE 33 AÑOS, SOLTERO, CON DOS HIJOS A SU CARGO CON CARGA FAMILIAR, CONOCIDO EN EL MEDIO POR SU LABOR DE MAESTRO CONSTRUCTOR, ARMADO DE TECHOS EN LA MISMA ZONA DE ZAÑA, PROVINCIA DE CHICLAYO, REGION LAMBAYEQUE, COSTA NORTE DE PERÚ.

SANTOS SE DEDICA A LA CONSTRUCCION DE VIVIENDAS, ARMADO DE TECHOS, COMO MAESTRO EN CONSTRUCCIÓN DESDE HACE MAS DE 15 AÑOS PROXIMADAMENTE. PERSONA CON BUENAS REFERENCIASPERSONALES Y LABORALES. NECESITA PRESTAMO PARA INVERTIR EN COMPRA DE MAS MATERIALES DE CONSTRUCCION, LO CUAL LE GENERARA MAS INGRESO A SU UNIDAD FAMILIAR.
texts.en:
Santos, age 33, is single. He has two children under his care and family responsibility. He is well-known in the field for his work as a master builder and reinforcing roofs. He does this in the Zaña area in the Chiclayo region, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru.

Santos has been building houses and reinforcing roofs as a master builder for over 15 years approximately. He is a person with good personal and work references.

Santos needs a loan to buy more construction materials, which will generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 23 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la venta de joyería de acero inoxidable desde hace 2 años, vende de manera ambulante por las diferentes colonias que están cerca de su casa y tiene muchos clientes, la joven es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su hija, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas joyería por mayor para poder seguir con sus ventas y así darle a su hija una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The young woman who has her face pixelated is 23 years old, and she lives in a high risk area. She has been selling stainless steel jewelry for two years. She sells in an itinerant manner in the different neighborhoods that are close to her house. She has a lot of customers. She is a single mother, and she lives in her own house with her daughter.

She is requesting a loan to buy more jewelry wholesale in order to be able to continue with her sales. This way she will give her daughter a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more jewelry wholesale.

loans.name: Edwin Alexander

texts.es: Edwin de 33 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus tres hijos, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y maicillo, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, y con las ventas que realiza logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. así como muestra en la fotografía y poder continuar con su trabajo y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Edwin, age 33, lives in his own house with his wife and their three children. He grow corn and sorghum. He sells his products at the different markets that are close to his house. With the sales that he makes, he manages to pay for some of the household expenses.

He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, compost, and pesticides, etc. as the photo shows. This way he will be able to continue with his work and have better earnings.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, compost, and pesticides, etc.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 23 years old. She is married with four children. 

She has had a retail business from which she sells retail goods such as sugar, bread, flour and groceries for two years. She will be using the loan to purchase more vegetables and fruits to sell in hopes this will help her to educate her children to university level.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to expand her business, sell more groceries, make more income and be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables and fruits for sale to make more income in hopes this will help her to educate her children to university level.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 38 years old and has a live-in partner with two children.

Elvira works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, noodles, biscuits, candies, etc., to sell.

Elvira has borrowed and paid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Elvira aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, noodles, biscuits, candies, etc., to sell

loans.name: Nieves

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Nieves works hard to support her family.

She has a welding shop business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising chickens. Nieves is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials like welding rods, etc., for her welding shop business.

Nieves has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like welding rods, etc., for her business

loans.name: Edgar Nelson

texts.es:
Edgar, de 28 años de edad, es agricultor en pequeño, debido a los escasos recursos no pudo estudiar, está casado y tiene una hija de 3 años de edad. 

Edgar, desde pequeño se dedicó a ayudar a sus padres a la laborar en la agricultura, específicamente sembraba maíz y frijol. 

Edgar, necesita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas para su parcela de maíz y para pagar mano de obra, anteriormente había sembrado, pero debido a la sequía perdió todo su cultivo.

Su mayor sueño, es volver a cultivar y tener buena producción y así poder darle lo necesario a su familia y mejorar su alimentación.
texts.en:
Edgar, 28, is a small-scale farmer. Because of a lack of funds he could not go to school, he is married and has a three-year-old daughter. 

Ever since he was little Edgar helped his parents out farming, specifically growing corn and beans. 

Edgar needs a loan to buy agriculture supplies for his corn fields and to pay for labor costs; he had planted his crop before, but because of a drought he lost the entire harvest. 

His greatest dream is to plant again and have a good outcome, and support his family and improve their diet.

loans.use: to buy agriculture supplies for his corn field and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: María Marta

texts.es:
María, de 48 años de edad, es una de la personas luchadora, que se esfuerza cada día por salir adelante y desafiando las distintas dificultades de la vida, actualmente vende antojitos como panes con pollo, yuca frita, pastelitos de carne, etc. Pero también, destaza cerdos para vender la carne, su esposo le ayuda en esta actividad; por otra parte, ella es madre de tres hijas de 3, 5 y 8 años de edad.

María, prepara este tipo de alimentos desde hace más de 8 años, la idea fue de ella y su esposo la apoyo para mejorar sus ingresos económicos.

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar cerdos para destazarlos y vender la carne, ya que la demanda de carne es muy grande y la pagan a buen precio.

Su principal sueño es seguir con esta actividad y generar ingresos para mejorar su vivienda y ampliar las habitaciones, porque el espacio es muy reducido.
texts.en:
Maria, 48, is a very hard-working person, she strives every day to get ahead and overcome all of life's various challenges. Now she sells foods like chicken sandwiches, fried yuca, meat pies, etc. She also butchers pigs to sell the meat, her husband helps her with this work. She is also the mother of three daughters, ages 3, 5, and 8. 

Maria has been preparing these kinds of foods for over eight years, she and her husband came up with the idea to boost their income. 

She needs this loan to buy pigs to butcher and sell the meat, since the demand for meat is very high and she can charge a good price. 

Her dream is to continue with this activity and generate income to make improvements to their home and construct larger rooms, since there is very little space.

loans.use: to purchase pigs to butcher them and sell the meat.

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is a kindergarten teacher from Ungheni in Moldova. She wants to grow in her career at the kindergarten. Ludmila is a fourth-year student at the university. Ludmila needs to know the newest methods in education. For this purpose, she will buy a computer with Internet connection.

She is married. Her husband, Igor, is a guardian. Ludmila and Igor have an 11-year-old grandson, Cristian. Their grandson is the most important motivation for Ludmila to continue her studies.

This loan will help Ludmila to pay her contract for her education and buy a computer.

loans.use: to pay her contract for her education and buy a computer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to get milk to sell and make more income so as to expand her farming by buying farm inputs and supporting her family.

loans.name: Reina

texts.en:
Reina is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Reina is 46 years old, and one of her children is currently in school.

Reina has a buying and selling of ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines. Reina requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stock of ready-to-wear to sell to her customers.

Reina has been in this business for five years. Reina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ready-to-wear clothing to sell to her customers

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is a woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Amelita is 60 years old now.

Amelita has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Amelita requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like garments and other supplies.

Amelita has been in this business for six years. In the future, Amelita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like garments and other supplies

loans.name: Bernardita

texts.en:
Bernardita is 60 years old and married with four children. Bernardita works very hard to provide for them.

Bernardita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

Bernardita has been in this business for 10 years now. 

In the future, Bernardita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bread, canned goods, home care products  and other groceries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand and gravel to cement the passageway and also to invest in wire fence and iron tubes to be able to set up a fence around his home

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 23 years old. She is married with 2 children. She has had a retail shop and green grocery business for 1 year now. She will be using the loan to buy more stocks of sugar, cooking oil, flour, vegetables and fruits. Mary hopes this will enable her to make more income to pay the school fees for her children. Her hopes and dreams for the future are have a big business and to educate her children .

loans.use: to buy more stocks of sugar, cooking oil, flour, vegetables and fruits for resale

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en: Belinda is 37 years old and a very hard working entrepreneur. Belinda has a general store business in the Philippines. Belinda has requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more items such as candies, noodles, canned goods, soft-drinks, cooking oil, soy sauce, etc. to sell. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Belinda has been in this business for 2 years now. In the future, Belinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items such as candies, noodles, canned goods, soft-drinks, cooking oil, soy sauce, etc. to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth works hard to support her family. Elizabeth is widowed and has a dry goods retail business in the Philippines. Elizabeth has requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like flower vase, accessories, etc. to sell. Elizabeth has been in this business for a year now. Elizabeth would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like flower vase, accessories, etc. to sell

loans.name: Zuhra

texts.ru: Зухра жительница города Курган-Тюбе. Она очень добрая и заботливая женщина. Зухра занимается растениеводством на протяжении 20 лет.  Растениеводство – это одна из основных отраслей сельского хозяйства, занимающаяся выращиванием культурных растений и использованием дикорастущей растительности для получения продуктов питания для населения, кормов для животноводства и сырья для многих отраслей промышленности. Зухра сама высаживает,  ухаживает  за всходами зерновых культур и овощей, собирает урожай, продает, а также сама для своей семьи использует в пищу. Благодаря её упорной работе её семья не нуждается ни в чем. Зухра уже посадила новый урожай, но ей не хватило денег на покупку минеральных удобрений. Она с большой надеждой обратилось за кредитом и верит, что ей помогут, для того чтобы в этом году её семья не останется без еды.
texts.en: Zuhra is a resident of the town of Qurgan-Tube. She is a very kind and caring woman. Zuhra has been growing crops for 20 years. Growing crops is one of the key sectors of agriculture, comprising the growing of crops for food use for the population, feed for animal rearing, and raw materials for many other industrial sectors. Zuhra plants the crops herself, looks after the grain and vegetable seedlings, gathers the harvest, sells it, and also uses it as food for her own family. Thanks to her hard work, her family does not want for anything. Zuhra has already planted her new crop, but she did not have enough money to buy mineral fertilizer. She has applied for a loan with high hopes, and believes that she will be supported so that her family will not be left without food this year.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Maridel

texts.en:
Maridel is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 48 years old, and her nine children are in school.

Maridel has a buy-and-sell antique articles business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more antique articles to sell.

Maridel has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more antique articles to sell.

loans.name: Zaida

texts.en:
Zaida is single and has a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines.

Zaida requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of ready-to-wear clothes, such as t-shirts, shorts, blouses, etc., to sell.

Zaida has been in this business for one year now.

In the future, Zaida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of ready-to-wear clothes, such as t-shirts, shorts, blouses, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Flordeliz

texts.en: Flordeliz has a live-in partner woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Flordeliz is 25 years old and has two children who are currently in school. Flordeliz has a food vending business in the Philippines. Flordeliz has requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. Flordeliz has been in this business for 5 years now. In the future, Flordeliz would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: As a widowed parent of five children, Josephine works hard to support her family. She has a fashion jewelries retail business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling beauty products. Josephine is borrowing PHP 8000 through NWTF to buy more stocks to resell to her customers for her fashion jewelries retail business. Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to resell to her customers

loans.name: Kathlyn

texts.en:
Kathlyn is 27 years old and married with two children.

Kathlyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Kathlyn has borrowed and repaid one loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from food vending.

Kathlyn aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
Vida is 48 years old. She is married to a mechanic and has two children. She sells sachet water in front of her salon. Vida has done this business for four years.

She will use this loan to buy more water to sell. She is hopeful that in five years time she will be able to get a bigger shop, where she will sell only sachet water.

loans.use: to buy bags of sachet water to sell.

loans.name: Henrita

texts.en:
Henrita, 56, is married with five children. One child is still in school. 

Henrita is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a business of making native bags in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years. 

Henrita has requested a loan of 9,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy additional raw materials for her business.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy additional raw materials for her business

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 50 years old and married with three children. Helen works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk food, homecare products, and other groceries. She has been in this business for 8 years. 

In the future, Helen would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk food, homecare products, and other groceries

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity, 35, is married with six children aged three to 17. Five of her children go to school.

Charity comes from Musenyi-Bwikra subcounty. Like most women, she had viable business ideas but not enough capital to start her dream business. That is until she joined UGAFODE Microfinance, though which she attained knowledge of how to establish and run a profitable business.

Charity started her boutique business in 2008. Before joining UGAFODE, she had capital of around 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) in her business. She now wants to borrow 3,000,000 UGX to restock her business. She dreams of expanding to the point where she will travel to other nations to buy in bulk and at cheaper prices, which will help her maximize her profits.

Charity receives additional income from farming, but that is seasonal, thus unreliable. She would like funders to improve roads for easier transportation.

loans.use: To buy clothing stock to boost her sales

loans.name: Gameliel

texts.en:
Gameliel is thirty years of age and a father of three. He lives at La in the Greater Accra Region. He is a sachet water vendor at La Agyema and also in the Greater Accra Region. Gameliel has done this business for three years and wants to expand the business to meet the demands of his clients.

He will use this loan to buy more sachet and bottled water to sell. He is hopeful that in five years time, he will own a wholesale water outlet, where he will sell the water in larger quantities.

loans.use: to buy more sachet and bottled water for resale.

loans.name: Chairel

texts.en:
Chairel is 34 years old with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Chairel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

Chairel has been in this business for ten years.

Chairel would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Charminda

texts.en:
Charminda is 29 years old and has a live-in partner with one child in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Charminda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as junk foods, canned goods, eggs, home care products, and other groceries.

Charminda has been in this business for five years.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

In the future, Charminda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as junk foods, canned goods, eggs, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Narfe

texts.en:
Narfe is 39 years old and has three children. Narfe is married and her three children are in school.

Narfe is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Narfe requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Narfe has been in this business for seven years now, and she has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Narfe would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en:
Charlotte is forty years old and a mother of three. She is a food vendor and a landlady at La in the Greater Accra Region. Charlotte has been selling food for ten years now. She usually fetches water from her neighbor's house to prepare her food and do other household chores.

Charlotte is requesting a loan to connect piped water to her house for her family and tenants and to also prepare food to sell. She believes that this will reduce the cost involved in fetching water from somebody's house.

loans.use: to connect piped water to her house.

loans.name: Celestial Group

texts.en:
Pasac is a community of Cantel Quetzaltenango, a bustling area which is located in the cold, mountainous valley of the Western Plateau of Guatemala.

It has been one year since the women of the trust bank “Celestial” or “Heavenly” asked for their last loan, and it has certainly been quite an impressive year, to say the least. Each member's business has grown significantly due to the intelligent investments made possible by the loans received from Kiva.

The trust bank is comprised of 10 aspiring women who aim to increase the inventories of their various small businesses which include corner stores, shoe stores, huipils embroidery, weaving, the sale of typical clothing, and the rearing and sale of animals. 

Now, after much success from the previous loan, the trust bank “Celestial” is asking for another loan to continue their development. One of the women asking for a loan is Zoila, a delightful 44-year-old member of the group. Zoila is the owner of a corner store in which she sells goods used for daily consumption. With the new loan she receives, Zoila hopes to purchase more goods that have been asked for by her clients, such as sugar, eggs, beans, chicken feed, salt, and a variety of other supplies. Zoila has also been able to further invest her profits to obtain more capital and to educate her  children. She has 7 children, but only 3 of them are studying. 

Thank you, Kiva investors, for the continuous support that you have given through the loans you provide. This has truly benefited the women of Guatemala and the economy as a whole! Thank you for your confidence in the Guatemalan people, and their ability to develop into a greater country!

loans.use: To purchase more goods such as sugar, eggs, beans, chicken feed, salt, and a variety of other supplies for her store.

loans.name: Esteria

texts.en:
Esteria is 37 years old and married with six children. With five children in school, Esteria works very hard to provide for them.

Esteria runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell such as canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

Esteria has been in this business for two years.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

In the future, Esteria would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell such as canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is a 54-year-old married woman with four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Lilia has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. She has been in this business for 26 years. 

In the future, Lilia would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Matea

texts.en:
Matea is 59 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Matea runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, homecare products, and other groceries. She has been in this business for 15 years. 

In the future, Matea would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, homecare products, and other groceries

loans.name: Silvestra

texts.en:
Silvestra is 52 years old and married with three children. With one child in school, Silvestra works very hard to provide for them.

Silvestra runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Silvestra has been in this business for 20 years.

In the future, Silvestra would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a married woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rebecca is 59 years old now.

Rebecca has a furniture making business in the Philippines. Rebecca requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy wood, bamboo, and other supplies.

Rebecca has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Rebecca would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy wood, bamboo, and other supplies

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 31 years old and married with five children. With four children in school, Rowena works very hard to provide for them.

Rowena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as eggs, canned goods, junk food, home care products and groceries.

Rowena has been in this business for four years. 

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Rowena would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as eggs, canned goods, junk food, home care products and groceries

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 44 years old and married with two children. Zenaida works very hard to provide for them.

Zenaida runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as bread, beverages, home care products and groceries.

Zenaida has been in this business for 12 years. 

In the future, Zenaida would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as bread, beverages, home care products  and groceries

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is a 33-year-old married woman with four children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Maribel has a buy-and-sell fish business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more boxes of fish to sell. She has been in this business for 3 years. 

In the future, Maribel would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is 77 years old. He is a landlord from the Greater Accra region. He is married with ten children. Rota is no longer working because of his age, however he gets income from the rent his tenants pay.

There is no toilet facility in Christopher's house, therefore his family and tenants use the local commercial toilet. 

He will use this loan to buy and install a portable toilet facility for his tenants and family. He will repay the loan from the fee he will charge his tenants for using the toilet and the monies his children give to him on a monthly basis.

loans.use: to buy and install a toilet.

loans.name: Dauda

texts.en:
Dauda is 40 years old. He is a tailor and landlord at Ayidiki in the Greater Accra region. Dauda is married with one child. 

There is no place of convenience in Dauda's house, so for this reason both his family and tenants join long queues to use the commercial toilet facility.

With this loan, he will construct a two seat toilet facility for his family and tenants. He believes that this will make them happy.

loans.use: to build a two-seat toilet facility for his family and tenants.

loans.name: Muazam

texts.ru:
Муазам жизнерадостная и трудолюбивая женщина в возрасте 49 лет. Она замужем  и имеет 2-их детей. Она обратилась в Арванд впервые, когда узнала, что есть возможность получить финансовую поддержку. Сама Муазам живёт со своей семьёй в сельской местности. Она не имеет высшего образования, так как не было возможности учиться в Университете из-за финансовых трудностей в семье.  Чтобы иметь доход на пропитание, Муазам занимается выращиванием сельхозкультур. Её сын в России на заработках. Он по возможности помогает своим родителям. Муж Муазам занимается куплей продажей сельхозкультур.  
  Сейчас Муазам собирается выдать замуж свою внучку. Она готовиться к свадебному мероприятию. Для этого нужно купить очень много вещей для приданного. Но у Муазам не хватает денежных средств, которые она накопила для свадьбы. Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку приданного для свадьбы своей внучки. Муазам очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку
texts.en:
Muazam is a cheerful and hard-working 49-year-old woman. She is married and has two children. She applied to Arvand initially when she learned of the possibility to get financial support. Muazam and her family live in a rural location. She does not have a higher education since she was not able to study at university due to her family's financial difficulties. Muazam grows crops in order to have income to buy food. Her son is away working in Russia. He helps his parents when he is able. Muazam's husband buys and sells crops.

Now Muazam is going to marry off her granddaughter. She is preparing for the wedding event. For this she needs to buy a lot of things for the dowry, but the funds that Muazam has saved up for the wedding are insufficient. For this reason she has applied to Arvand and wants to take a loan to buy the dowry for her granddaughter's wedding. Muazam very much hopes for a positive result and thanks Arvand in advance for its support.

loans.use: with her granddaughter's wedding expenses.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
El socio Javier pertenece al banco comunal “Patrón de San Sebastián” de la ciudad del Cusco. 
El socio continua  trabajando en  una institución pública, el socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, él socio es una persona responsable, él socio también sigue dedicándose a su negocio  de pasamanería, el socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicito el crédito para la compra de cepillos, cremas entre otros.
texts.en:
The member Javier belongs to the “Patrón de San Sebastián” communal bank in the city of Cusco. He continues to work in a public institution. 

He feels grateful for the credit granted and promises to comply with his established payments. He is a responsible person.

The member also continues earning a living through his passmenterie business (making decorative objects with cords and tassels). He wants to be able to continue working so he can support his family this way.

He seeks a loan to buy brushes and creams, among other things.

loans.use: to buy brushes and cream, among other things.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is 54 years old and has six children. She is married and has one child in school. Victoria is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Victoria has been farming rice for 2 years now, and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Victoria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Febe Gail

texts.en:
Febe Gail is 22 years old and married.

Febe Gail works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell such as beverages, junk food, home care products and groceries.

Febe Gail has borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from food vending.

Febe Gail aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell such as beverages, junk food, home care products and groceries

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 35 years old and married with two children. With both children in school, Janet works very hard to provide for them.

Janet runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like junk food, eggs, sugar, homecare products, and other groceries. She has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, juices, shampoo, soap, biscuits, junk food, candies and other groceries. 

Janet would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like junk food, eggs, sugar, homecare products, and other groceries

loans.name: Editha

texts.en: As a married parent of three children, Editha works hard to support her family. She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Editha is borrowing PHP 6000 through NWTF to  buy additional vegetables to sell for her business for her vegetable vending business. She has been sustaining her business activities with her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell for her business

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en: Cirila is 51 years old and has two children. Cirila is in the agricultural business of farming vegetables in the Philippines. Cirila has requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Cirila has been farming vegetables for 30 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Cirila would like to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Decirry

texts.en:
Decirry is 24 years old and married with one child.

Decirry is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Decirry requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Decirry has been in this business for six years now, and she has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Decirry would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Eyra

texts.en:
Eyra is 32 years old and has five children. Eyra is married and three of her children are in school.

Eyra is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Eyra requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Eyra has been in this business for two years now, and she has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Eyra would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a 22-year-old woman with one child, and she is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Jennifer has a buy-and-sell liquor business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like coconut wine and other liquor. She has been in this business for 1 year. 

In the future, Jennifer would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like coconut wine and other liquor

loans.name: Wendingoundi Group

texts.fr: Ami est une femme âgée de 44 ans mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Vendeuse de savon qu’elle fabrique elle-même. La qualité de son savon, la durabilité, le bon prix qu’elle vend dans les zones non loties toutes ces qualités font marcher son activité. Elle veut le prêt pour s’acheter de l’huile de karité à 100 000 fcfa et le reste dans les autres ingrédients c’est-à-dire les 50 000. Elle a déjà reçu le prêt plusieurs et à rembourser aux dates prévues.
texts.en:
Ami is a woman of 44, married and the mother of four children. She sells soap that she makes herself. The quality of her soap, its durability, and the good price at which she sells it in informal settlements--all these are the reasons her business succeeds.

Ami wants the loan to buy shea oil for 100,000 F CFA, and she will spend the rest of the loan amount, around 50,000 F CFA, on other necessary ingredients.

Ami has already received several loans and has reimbursed them on the due dates.

loans.use: to buy oil and other ingredients to make soap.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Leonida works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. She is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to  buy more boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Leonida has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream, which is to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya is 50 years old and married with three children.

Ligaya works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, noodles, personal care products, and other groceries.

Ligaya has borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, noodles, personal care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 37 years landlady from the Greater Accra region. She is a married woman with three children. Elizabeth is a teacher as well. 

She owns a three bedroom apartment which was passed down to her by her parents. Elizabeth lives in the house with her husband and children, two tenants and their family.

The toilet facility in the house is worn out and poses a great danger to people who use it. She would use this loan to buy and install a biological toilet filter system in her house. She believes this will prevent any mishaps.

loans.use: to buy and install a biological toilet filter.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is in the printing business. She lives with her parents. Doris is single and she doesn't have children, but she would like to have her own family, and she also wants to be an independent person. Doris needs a loan to buy a machine for her printing business.

Doris works very hard and her business needs some help. She hopes you can give her a hand.

loans.use: to buy a machine for her printing business

loans.name: Joaquin

texts.en:
Joaquin is 46 years old and he has his own house. He is divorced and he lives with his son. 

Joaquin makes money by providing a shower service. He has some showers installed at his house and he rents them to many customers.

He needs a loan to buy more showers. At first he had the idea to build a swimming pool, but then he realized that his business is with the showers. 

Because of the great results he has had, he hopes that you can help him again.

loans.use: to buy more showers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tomatoes, potatoes, onion, pineapple, mango, watermelon, etc.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a 49-year-old married woman with twelve children, six of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Lorna has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. She has been in this business for 1 year. 

In the future, Lorna would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Jeseca

texts.en: Jeseca is 34 years old and married with seven children. With seven children in school, Jeseca works very hard to provide for them. Jeseca runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home product care and other groceries. Jeseca has been in this business for 1 year now and sells a variety of items such as beverages, biscuits, coffee, candies, shampoo, soap and other groceries. Jeseca would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items for resale such as canned goods, beverages, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita, 53, is married with six children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has been doing so for two years. She earns additional income from retailing electronic mobile loads. 

Jovita has borrowed and paid three previous loans from the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She has now requested a loan of 9,000 Philippine pesos to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Jovita aspires to building and expanding her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Melani

texts.en: Melani is 41 years old and married with three children. With three children in school, Melani works very hard to provide for them. Melani runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items for resale like condiments, canned goods, home product care and other groceries. Melani has been in this business for 3 years now and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, noodles, vinegar, soy sauce, candies and other groceries. In the future, Melani would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items for resale like condiments, canned goods, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Veronica Del Carmen

texts.es:
Verónica, agradece la facilidad que Padecomsm y los inversionistas Kiva le dan para continuar mejorando con su negocio, está solicitando un nuevo crédito para comprar frutas y verduras frescas para que sus clientes encuentren todo lo que necesitan.
Ha Verónica el financiamiento anterior le ayudo a ofrecer mercadería más variada con lo que ha aumentado su clientela y sus ingresos están mejorando, junto a su familia vive en optimas condiciones.
texts.en:
Veronica appreciates the help that Padecomsm and the Kiva lenders give to her that enable her to continue improving her business. She is requesting a new loan to buy fresh fruits and vegetables for her customers so they will be able to find everything they need.

Veronica's previous loan helped her offer a greater variety of merchandise, which increased her customer base and improve her revenues so that she and her family can live in optimal conditions.

loans.use: to buy fresh fruits and vegetables so her clients can find everything they need.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila is 57 years old and married with one child. Lucila works very hard to provide for them.

Lucila runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell such as condiments, personal care products and groceries.

Lucila has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, soap, coffee, salt, soy sauce, juice, condiments, and other groceries. 

In the future, Lucila would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell such as condiments, personal care products and groceries

loans.name: Hilda Teresa

texts.es: Hilda es una madre soltera que ha sabido salir adelante por su hijo, ella se dedica a la cría de animales de granja y solicita el micro crédito para poder comprar una vaca orgánica con la que espera vender leche cruda orgánica en su localidad rural de Pampamarca, ella confía en que la personas gusten por consumir su leche. Hilda se seguirá esforzando día a día para que su hijos sea una persona de bien con muchos valores y sobre todo sea un gran profesional.
texts.en:
Hilda is a single mother who has been able to get ahead for her son. She earns a living raising livestock and is seeking a microloan to be able to buy an organic cow. 
She hopes to sell raw organic milk in her rural area called Pampamarca. She trusts people will like to consume her milk. 

Hilda continues working hard day after day so her children are good people with many values and above all can be great professionals.

loans.use: to buy an organic cow.

loans.name: Marita Esperanza

texts.es:
Marita, de 35 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, es madre soltera, es empleada y tiene tres hijos que aún viven con ella.

Marita, tiene varios años de trabajar como empleada en un hospital nacional como cocinera y además tiene una 
pequeña tienda de productos de primera necesidad en su casa.
 
Marita, solicita el préstamo para comprar más artículos de primera necesidad como: arroz, azúcar, sopas instantáneas, frijoles y otros productos que los clientes más solicitan, de esa manera lograra mejorar su negocio.

Marita, sueña con mantener su negocio y seguir trabajando en el hospital, para darles todo lo que necesitan sus hijos para que estudien.
texts.en:
Marita is 35 years old and finished her studies at high school. She is a single mother, works and has three children who live with her. 

Marita has been working in a national hospital as a cook for many years. On top of this work she also has a small store located at her home from which she sells basic goods.

Marita is seeking a loan to buy more basic goods such as: rice, sugar, instant soups, beans and other products that customers are looking for. this would help her to improve her business. 

Marita's wish is to keep her store running and keep working in the hospital so that she is able to provide for her children so that they are able to keep studying.

loans.use: to buy more basic goods such as: rice, sugar, instant soups, beans and other products that customers are looking for.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 53 years old and she is the mother of one daughter. 

Elvira has her own house and she needs a loan to build a perimeter wall. She is working hard to complete the construction of her house, and she really hopes you can help her.

Elvira is a seamstress and she alone supports her family, with no-one else helping her. As you can see in the picture, the place where Elvira lives is very poor.

loans.use: to build a perimeter wall

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena works in recycling metals. In the picture, she is at the place where she works. She is experienced in the recycling business and this is the only thing that she can do. 

Filomena needs a loan to buy metals and other materials that she will resell. She lives with her boyfriend but his salary is too small, so she needs your help. 

In the future, she would like to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy metals and other materials that she will resell

loans.name: Juana

texts.en: Juana is 39 years old. She is divorced and has a child. Juana is a seamstress who makes vicuña blankets and she goes to many places to sell her products. She needs a loan to buy wool to make more blankets. Juana knows that she needs to buy good wool because that is the item that helps to sell more blankets.  Juana needs your help because she wants to have her own house in the future.

loans.use: to buy wool

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Rachel works hard to support her family.

Rachel has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. 

Rachel is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy more gallons of coconut wine to sell in her coconut wine vending business.

Rachel has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more gallons of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Rosanna

texts.en:
Rosanna is 43 years old and has three children. Rosanna is married and her three children are in school.

Rosanna is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Rosanna requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Rosanna has been in this business for 23 years now, and she has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rosanna would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a 68 years old widow and a mother of four. She is a landlady in the Greater Accra region. Veronica is currently not working and gets financial support from her children on a monthly basis.

Veronica will use this loan to connect piped water to her house for the benefit of her household. She will be able to repay the loan from the financial support of her children and the rent she receives from her tenants.

loans.use: to connect piped water to her house for domestic use.

loans.name: Nila

texts.en:
Nila, 41, is married with six children. Three of her children are in school. 

Nila is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and has been in this business for two years. 

Nila has requested a loan of 9,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy more variety of fish to sell to her customers.

In the future, Nila would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more variety of fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sand, loose stone, cement and pay for labor to cement the area of the hallway.

loans.name: Apolinaria

texts.es:
Apolinaria, de 64 años de edad, no estudio porque sus padres solo le enseñaron a trabajar, es madre soltera, tiene cuatro hijos, todos son mayores de edad y residen en estados unidos, ella vive solo con un nieto.

Apolinaria, desde que sus hjos estaban pequeños se ha dedicado a vender tortilllas y tamales todos los días, de esa manera obtuvo los recursos económicos para alimentar, vestir y crecer a sus hijos.- 
 
El préstamo lo solicita para comprar materiales para preparar las tortillas y los tamales como: maíz, leña, hojas de huerta y pollo; de esa manera lograra que sus ingresos sean mejores y mejorar su calidad de vida.

El sueño de Apolinaria, es que a sus hijos les vaya bien en el país en donde se encuentran y que algún día pueda volver a verlos.
texts.en:
Apolinaria is 64 years old. She didn't study as her parents only taught her how to work. She is a single mother and has four children. She lives alone with one grandchild.

Since her children were small Apolinaria has worked selling tortillas and tamales every day. In this way she obtained the economic resources to feed, cloth and raise her children.

She will use the loan to buy materials to prepare tortillas and tamales like corn, wood, banana leaves and chicken. In this way she can increase her income and improve her quality of living.

Apolinaria's dream is for things to go well for her children in the country they are in and that one day she can see them again.

loans.use: to buy materials to prepare tortillas and tamales like corn, wood, banana leaves and chicken.

loans.name: Paola

texts.en:
Paola is a 22-year-old seamstress who sells  children's underwear and polleras (a native skirt).

 Paola needs a loan to buy fabric and thread.  Paola is hard-working, healthy, young woman whose mother taught  her how to sew. 

Paola lives with her parents but they can t loan the money.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is married and has two sons. She is an experienced cheese maker who learned to make cheese when she was very young.

 Julia needs a loan to buy a milking cow. Her husband travels a lot because of his work and he can't provide the money she needs.

 Julia hopes you can help her  to rebuild her home using bricks instead of adobe.

loans.use: to buy a milking cow.

loans.name: German

texts.en:
German is a driver who also sells quinua.   He and  his wife work together and he uses his vehicle to take the quinua to fairs and  markets.

 German pays rent and wants to take advantage of the low cost of quinua. This is the season to buy more quinua to resell.

 German and his husband would like to build their own house. The couple have 3 children.

loans.use: to buy more quinua.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is a 63-year-old widow who lives in Nagerong, Lazi, Siquijor. She owns and manages a rice  business that enables to support her family's needs. 

She learned about Paglaum MPC and decided to become a  member. She is grateful that the cooperative has offered financial assistance to borrowers like herself. She requests 9,000.00 PHP to purchase medicine.

loans.use: to purchase medicine.

loans.name: Elmira

texts.ru: Эльмира успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. На сегодняшний день у нее в хозяйстве есть 4 коровы, 10 овец. А также имеет земельный надел в размере 1,16 ГА, на которой выращивает пшеницу. Деятельность Эльмиры приносит около 12,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Эльмира обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 дойных коров и 2 бычков для увеличения объемов реализации экологически-чистого молока и поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Эльмира планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства.
texts.en: Elmira successfully repaid her loan, after using it as intended. She is grateful to the Kiva fund and everyone who had helped her with the financing. Today, her farm contains 4 cows and 10 sheep. She also has 1.16 hectares of land, where she grows wheat. Elmira's business yields about 12,000 som (KGS) per month. To continue developing her business, Elmira requested a loan in the amount of 150,000 som (KGS) from the Bai-Tushum Bank to buy 2 dairy cows and 2 bulls to increase her organic milk production volume and livestock headcount. Elmira plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further growing her business.

loans.use: to buy 2 dairy cows and 2 bulls to increase her organic milk production and livestock headcount

loans.name: Marcela Araceli

texts.es: Marcela es una señora casada, tiene 3 hijos, una chica de 14 años, un niño de 10 años y un bebe de  15 días de nacido. El esposo de Marcela se dedica a trabajar de chofer, Marcela se dedica desde muy joven a la crianza de animales, Marcela solicita el dinero del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de pollos, Marcela comenta que mediante su negocio es como obtiene recursos económicos para ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar, Marcela lucha en la vida por sus hijos, y su mayor anhelo es el de que sigan adelante en sus estudios.
texts.en: Marcela is married and has three children, a 14 year old daughter, a 10 year old son and a 15 day old baby. Marcela's husband works as a driver. Since she was young Marcela has worked raising animals. Marcela is requesting the money from the loan to invest in the purchase of chickens. Marcela comments that through her business she receives the economic resources to help her husband with the household expenses. Marcela struggles in this life for her children and her greatest wish is for them to continue with their studies.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Ana Isabela

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer de 23 años, tiene un hijo de siete años, y vive junto a su linda familia en una comunidad de Sololá.
Ana es una muchacha que se esmera día con día para darle a su pequeño hijo lo necesario, ella desde hace 5 años tomo la iniciativa de realizar su propio negocio, y la actividad que ella eligió fue la venta de granizadas por las calles de su comunidad, ella cuenta que se decidió por este negocio porque vive en una zona muy cálida, y era mucho más rentable vender algo refrescante para la gente. Ana desde hace algún tiempo se ha visto a la necesidad de comprar un terreno donde ella pueda construir su propia casa, a pesar de todos sus esfuerzos esto no le ha sido posible, es por ello que con el propósito de hacer posible esta necesidad solicita un crédito que lo utilizara para la compra de su terreno. Y con las ganancias que Ana genere de su negocio estará abonando una parte para su crédito y la otra cubrirá gastos de su familia. Ana sueña con poder instalar una tienda de abarrotes para mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Ana is a woman of 23, she has a seven year-old son, and she lives with her lovely family in a community of Sololá. Ana is a girl who strives day after day to provide for the needs of her young son. Five years ago she took the initiative to set up her own business, and the occupation she chose was the sale of shaved ice treats on the streets of her community. She recounts that she decided on this business because she lives in a very hot area, and it was much more profitable to sell something refreshing for people. 

For some time now, Ana has found herself in need of buying land where she can build her own house. Despite all her efforts this has not been possible for her; hence for the purpose of fulfilling this need she is requesting a loan, which she will use for the purchase of her land. And with the profits that Ana generates from her business, she will be paying a part to cover the loan and the other part will cover her family expenses. Ana dreams of being able to open a grocery store to improve her income.

loans.use: buy land.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna wants to be prepared for the next growing season. She wants to have enough fertilizer for her corn crop and requests a loan from the Cooperative. 

Myrna hopes to save enough money to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is a 60-year-old  married woman with  2 adult-aged children.  She lives in Dipolog City, Zamboanga del Norte. 

She has grown vegetables for 10 years. She needs 2,000.00 PHP to purchase eggplant, okra, and  bitter gourd vegetable seedlings.

loans.use: to purchase vegetable seedlings.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda learned about Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. 

Rosalinda has a  farming business and states that she owes her fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her. 

Rosalinda requests a new loan to pay for seedlings and compost. This will increase her income. Rosalinda looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and compost.

loans.name: Monina

texts.en:
Monina is a businesswoman from Dipolog City. She is 58 years old, married, and has expertise in selling. 

She runs a little sari-sari store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family. Monina is a full fledged member of PMPC and has  several previously loans. 

She maintains her membership in good standing. She needs  a loan to restock store with basic commodities. 

Monina continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet.

loans.use: to restock her store.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: Lilia is preparing her land and seedbed for the next cropping season. She wants to have enough fertilizer for her corn crop so she applied for a loan from the cooperative. Lilia hopes to save enough for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her corn crop.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en: Perlita makes a good income from her farming activities in Caputol, Aloran-oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She supports her family and is able to send her children to school. She wants to increase her farm yield, especially with the high cost of living and her children entering college. Perlita approached Paglaum for a loan to purchase a knapsack insecticide sprayer. She has high hopes that she will have good yield this cropping season.

loans.use: to purchase a knapsack insecticide sprayer.

loans.name: Lesby Andrea

texts.es:
Lesby tiene 26 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive con sus hijos en casa de sus padres en una comunidad pequeña en la zona rural del ditrito de Pucalá, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Las actividades económicas principales que se desarrollan en este distrito son la agricultura, ganadería y comercio

Lesby se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general, su negocio se encuentra en su propio domicilio, y viene funcionando hace casi tres años, cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de parte de sus vecinos y clientes, El crédito otorgado lo utilizará en la compra de mercadería para aumentar el stock de su negocio, de esta manera podrá aumentar su volumen de ventas, generar mayores ingresos y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Lesby is 26 years old and a single mother who lives with her children in her parents' home. They live in a small community in the rural district of Pucalá, located in the province of Chiclayo, in the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru. 

The main economic activities in the district are agriculture, livestock and trade. 

Lesby earns a living selling groceries through her own business based in her home. She has been doing this for the last three years and has very good personal and work references from her neighbours and clients.
