Emmalyn has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed twice in the past from NWTF to sustain it.  She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 41 years old and has three children. Mary Jane is married and her children are still in school.  Mary Jane is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Mary Jane requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Mary Jane has been in this business for 15 years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.  She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Margie is 48 years old and has four children who are currently in school.

Margie has a weaving business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials for her weaving business. She has been in this business for 23 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Absalon

texts.en:
Absalon is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Absalon is 46 years old and has one child still in school.

Absalon has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice to sell.

Absalon has been in this business for five years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Lilit

texts.en:
Lilit works hard to support her family. Lilit is single and has a weaving business in the Philippines.  She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for her weaving business.

Lilit has been in this business for five years now.  She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for weaving business

loans.name: Yiriwa Ton Group

texts.fr: Moussa   est celui qui tient la corde  et la main sur la tête du bœuf sur  la photo, compréhensive avec les membres du groupe. Il est âgé de 53 ans, il habite au Mali  et père de 8 enfants, ses enfants sont âgés de 8 ans  à 25 ans dont (3) fréquente l’école, son épouse   est une ménagère. Il  fait l’embouche bovin  il y a 11 ans, il s‘approvisionne et vend ses animaux aux marchés de sa localité. Il sollicite un prêt  subséquent    pour  accroitre ses activités d’embouche, qui lui  servira à l’auto- suffisante de la famille: santé, école, nourriture. Ses activités d’embouche peuvent lui apporté un revenus mensuel de 23000 FCFA. Il rêve   d’être automne en fin de pouvoir financer son activité avec ses propre fond.
texts.en:
Moussa is the one in the photo, who is holding the rope and his hand on the cow's head, along with the other members of the group. He is 53 years old and lives in Mali. He is the father of 8 children, ages 8 to 25 years old, three of which are in school. His wife is a housekeeper.

He has been raising cows for 11 years. He resupplies and sells his animals at the local markets.

He is requesting a subsequent loan to grow his livestock business, which will help his family to be self-sufficient for health, education, and food.

His livestock business can bring in a monthly revenue of 23,000 FCFA. He dreams of being autonomous in order to be able to finance his business with his own funds.

loans.use: to acquire animals to sell.

loans.name: Tierra Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por tres mujeres (MARJORI JOMARY, ALINA,  y CARLA) de la etnia miskita de la ciudad de Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Son mujeres emprendedoras que trabajan día a día con el empeño de lograr el crecimiento de sus pequeños negocios; se organizaron como grupo solidario desde hace año y medio para poder obtener préstamo en Pana Pana. 

Carla: Es nueva integrante del grupo solidario TIERRA, es una señora de 60 años de edad, casada con 4 hijos, mayores de edad. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos, vende ropa usada en uno de los mercados de Bilwi. Está solicitando su primer financiamiento para comprar en Managua una paca de ropa usada mixta. Ella sueña con ser una comerciante exitosa.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is made up of three women: MARJORI JOMARY, ALINA, and CARLA. They belong to the Miskita ethnic group from the city of Bilwi, in the municipality of Puerto Cabezas.

The members are enterprising women, who work every day, striving to grow their small businesses. A year and a half ago, they organized themselves as a solidarity group to be able to take out loans from Pana Pana.

Carla is the newest member of the TIERRA solidarity group. She is a 60-year-old woman, who is married and has four children of legal age. 

With the aim of generating her own source of income, she sells used clothing at one of the markets in Bilwi. 

She is requesting her first loan to buy a bundle of mixed used clothing in Managua.

She dreams of becoming a successful merchant.

loans.use: to purchase a bundle of mixed used clothing in Managua.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for college tuition.

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
Martin vive en la ciudad de Itá con sus padres, a la vez que estudia también trabaja de forma independiente repartiendo pan todos los días.
Estudia Radiología y tiene como objetivo terminar su carrera y crecer como profesional.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus gastos de titulación, ya que es un gasto un poco grande que necesita cubrir.
texts.en:
Martin lives in the city of Itá with his parents. He studies and also works independently distributing bread every day. 

He studies radiology and his goal is to finish his studies and grow as a professional.

He is requesting this loan in order to be able to pay for his degree fees, since the expense that he needs to cover is quite large.

loans.use: to pay for his degree fees.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.es:
Beatrice is 51 years old, married and supports a family of 3 child. 

She has been operating in her clothing sales for the last 30 years earning KES 6,000 per month. 

Beatrice has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply for more income gain. 

She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children and to produce enough food for the family. 

Her future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.
texts.en:
Beatrice is 51 years old.  She is married and supports a family of three children. She has been operating in her clothing sales for the last 30 years, earning KES 6,000 per month. 

Beatrice has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply.  She hopes for more income. 

She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children and to produce enough food for the family.  Her future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in metal sheeting, wood, and beams in order to begin the construction of a bedroom.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is a married woman, 54 years old.  She has four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  Alicia has a food vending business in the Philippines.  She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Alicia has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Analyn is 32 years old and has three children who are still in school.

Analyn has a weaving business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials for her weaving business.  Analyn has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials for a weaving business

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 52 years old.  She is married and has two children.  Teresita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, bread and other personal care products.

Teresita has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from fishing.  Teresita aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, bread and other personal care products

loans.name: Mary Lou

texts.en:
Mary Lou is a married woman with eight children, two of whom are presently in school. She 49 years old and is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Mary Lou has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase fishing material like fishing nets, bamboo, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business.

She has been in this business for 15 years and she would like to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials like fishing nets, bamboo, gasoline for her boat and other materials

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia es de la ciudad de coronel Oviedo, está estudiando la carrera de administración de empresas, su meta es ser una profesional exitosa y brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. 
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y de esa forma cubrir ese gasto que tiene y continuar con sus estudios.
texts.en: Patricia is from the city of Coronel Oviedo, and is studying towards a degree in business administration. Her goal is to be a successful professional and provide her family with a higher standard of living. She's applying for a loan to be able to pay her college tuition so that she can cover that expense and continue her studies.

loans.use: To pay for college tuition.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 54 years old and lives in Butuay, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is single with no dependants. 

Nenita has been engaged in a fish and spices vending business at the market stall for 11 years. She earns approximately PHP10,000 each month doing this type of business activity in which the income is so helpful to meet her needs.  She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing construction materials for her ongoing house construction. 

Nenita has been a member of PMPC for almost one year. In the future, Nenita hopes to become a fish wholesaler in her town.

loans.use: for purchasing construction materials

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es:
Hernan es de la ciudad de Itá, está estudiando la carrera de Ingeniería en Marketing, a través de la cual quiere poder abrirse camino al mundo laboral y poder convertirse en un ingeniero de marketing útil.
El está poniendo todo de si para poder crecer  y ser alguien en la vida. Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus gastos de titulación. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder ser alguien en la vida.
texts.en:
Hernan is from the city of Itá, and he is studying for a degree in Marketing, through which he wants to be able to make his way in the working world and become a marketing professional.

He is devoting all his efforts to being able to grow and be someone in life. He is requesting this loan in order to pay his university graduation expenses. He is grateful for this opportunity he is receiving to be able to be someone in life.

loans.use: to pay for university graduation expenses.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 60 years old.  She married and has one child. Aida works very hard to provide for them.

Aida runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, bread and other personal care products.

Aida has been in this business for two years.  She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, bread and other personal care products

loans.name: Ayélé Jeanne

texts.fr: Agée de 59 ans, Ayélé est une femme divorcée et sans enfant. Ayélé réside à Baguida et exerce comme activité la vente des produits alimentaire. Ayélé achète ses marchandises quatre fois par mois  au marché et les revendent à la devanture de son domicile. Ayélé fait recours à ce crédit pour commander des produits alimentaires. Avec ses bénéfices, Ayélé veut renforcer son activité.
texts.en: Ayélé is divorced and does not have children. She lives in Baguida where she sells food products. Ayélé buys her stock four times each month at the market and sells them in front of her home. Ayélé requests this loan to order food products. With her profits, Ayélé would like to reinforce her business.

loans.use: to buy 04 baskets of fresh tomatoes, 300 onions and 16 bowls of manioc flour.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 27 years old. She is known in the Pagadian City area for her boarding house rental business. She is actively participating in the various programs and services that the coop offers. She hopes to provide comfortable housing in a decent boarding house.  She applied for a loan to purchase plywood, nails, lumber, bags of cement, sand, gravel and sticks for boarding house repair. 

She hopes to maintain her membership in good-standing, with a good repayment record. It matters that she has been given a priority, as a microfinance member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC).  She is thankful that all her financing needs of her retailing business are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails, lumber, bags of cement, sand, gravel and sticks for boarding house repair

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma es de la ciudad de concepción, proviene de una familia muy humilde y trabajadora, comenta que estudia y trabaja al mismo tiempo para poder cumplir sus metas.
Ella estudia la carrera de ingeniería comercial, y por medio de su carrera quiere abrirse camino para poder ayudar a las demás personas.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos de titulación y de esa forma poder pagar ese gasto grande que tiene.
texts.en:
Norma is from the city of Concepcion, and comes from a humble and hardworking family. She states that she's studying and working at the same time so that she can reach her goals.

She's studying towards a degree in commercial engineering and wants to use her degree to forge a path for herself and be able to help others. She's applying for this loan so that she can cover the cost of her degree program and be able to pay this large expense she has.

loans.use: To pay the expenses for her degree program.

loans.name: Amakene Group

texts.fr:
Yaouna est la dame qui tiens la corne du bélier sur la photo, elle est une malienne âgée de 47ans, marié et mère de 8 enfants âgés 10 à 18 ans dont trois (3) sont scolarisés, son mari est un cultivateur.
Yaouna fait l’élevage des ovins, elle achète des moutons les élèves puis les revendre, elle a 20 ans d’activités. Yaouna fait recourt au prêt du RMCR afin d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire et de s’acheter beaucoup de moutons, elle  fait ses achats et  ses ventes dans les foires de sa localité, avec son profit elle parvient à venir aide à sa famille en prenant en charge les frais scolaire, de santé et de condiment. Elle est souvent confronter à des  situations de méventes et relève les défis avec un revendeur de sa localité. Dans les jours à venir, Yaouna aimerait avoir un prêt plus élève et s’acheter plus de moutons afin d’avoir beaucoup de profit et s’achète une moto pour sa famille.
texts.en:
Yaouna is the woman who is holding the horn of the goat in the photo. She is a 47 year-old Malian woman, married and a mother of 8 children, ages 10 to 18 years old, three of which are in school. Her husband is a farmer.

Yaouna raises ovine livestock. She buys goats, raises them, then sells them away. She has 20 years of experience. Yaouna is requesting a loan from RMCR in order to increase her turnover and to buy herself many goats. She makes her purchases and sales at the local fairs. With her profits, she manages to assist her familly by taking care of school tuition, health and food.

She is often confronted with situations of slumping sales and challenges with a local trader.

In the coming years, Yaouna would like to have a higher loan and to buy herself more livestock in order to gain more profit and to provide a motor-bike for her family.

loans.use: to buy goats to sell later.

loans.name: Iterambere Group

texts.fr:
Jeanne  fait partie du groupe  Iterambere  et  habite à Gitega. Il  a 33 ans et est marié à Désiré, un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants âgés de 7 mois  à 10 ans, dont 2  étudient. 

Elle  fait le commerce du haricot, du riz,…dans sa boutique   depuis 15 ans. 

Elle  est à son sixième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de riz, de haricot,…   à revendre  pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Jeanne is a member of the Iterambere group and lives in Gitega. She is 33 and is married to Desire, a salesman. They have four children aged from seven months to 10 years old, of whom two go to school.

 She has been selling beans, rice… in her shop for 15 years.

 This is her sixth loan from Turame. With the Kiva loan that she requests, she will increase her capital and buy a large quantity of rice, beans…to sell to earn more.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of rice, beans…to sell to earn more.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is a hardworking woman entrepreneur.  She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more items like home products, plastic wares, school supplies and other ready-to-wear clothing to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like a clothing retail business.  Maricel dreams that one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like home products, plastic wares, school supplies and other ready-to-wear clothing to sell.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a married woman.  She is 62 years old and has four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  Gloria has a fruit business in the Philippines. Gloria requested a PHP 29,500 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional fruits to sell at market.

Gloria has been in this business for 35 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fruits to sell at market

loans.name: Las Palmeras De Cocabambilla Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LAS PALMERAS DE COCABAMBILLA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Quillabamba, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Teresa ,la socia continua dedicándose al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua vendiendo  productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y aceite, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para  de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar leche, golosinas, aceite entre otros.
 Los socios en general agradecen a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
Los socios que salen adjuntos a la foto pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
These members belong to the Communal Bank “Las Palmeras de Cocabambilla”, which is located in the District of Quillabamba in La Convención Province, Department of Cusco.

One of the members is Sra. Teresa, who continues to manage a grocery store. She is a responsible and diligent individual. Teresa continues to sell basic necessity products such as rice, milk, and oil. She wants to keep working so that she can continue to support her family. Teresa is requesting a loan in order to buy milk, snack foods, oil, and other products.

The members of the group are grateful to those who have helped to fulfill their dream in this manner, so they promise to complete their payments according to the established terms. Those members who appear in the attached photos were granted permission to arrive late to the group meeting for work reasons.

loans.use: to buy milk, snack foods, oil, and other products.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 44 years old and has seven children. Rosita is married and has four children who are still in school.

Rosita is in the agricultural business, farming bananas in the Philippines. Rosita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Rosita has been in this business for 15 years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.  She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Grupo Patzite Las Magdalenas Group

texts.es:
Magdalena es una mujer de 32 años de edad, ella vive junto a su familia en una comunidad de Nahualá. Magdalena tiene dos hijos de las edades entre 7 y 12 años.
Magdalena (es la que aparece de primero en el lado derecho de la foto) es una mujer que lucha cada día para apoyar a su familia, pues desde hace tres años se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa típica, le gusta hacer esta actividad ya que lo hace desde la su casa de habitación y en algunos lugares circunvecinos de su comunidad, y esto le permite también realizar los oficios de su casa y cuidar de sus hijos, con esta actividad ella contribuye con su esposo en complementar algunos gastos.
Magdalena con el afán de seguir comprando y vendiendo ropa típica, ella solicita un préstamo para invertir en su negocio, con este dinero ella estará comprando güipiles, cortes fajas y todo lo relacionado con la línea de ropa. Magdalena sueña con que su negocio sea más grande para mejorar sus ingresos y contar con una casa más amplia.
texts.en:
Magdalena, 32, lives with her family in a community in Nahualá. Magdalena has two children who are 7 and 12 years old. Magdalena (first on the right in the picture) is a woman who strives every day to support her family. For three years she has worked buying and selling traditional clothing, she likes to do this since she does it from home and in several places nearby in the community. This allows her to also take care of the housework and look after her children. With this she can contribute to the household bills with her husband.

Magdalena, with the aim of continuing to buy and sell traditional clothing, is asking for a loan to invest in her business. With this money she will buy güipiles (traditional dress or blouse), short belts and everything related to this line of clothing. Magdalena's dream is to see her business grow in order to increase her earnings and have a bigger house.

loans.use: to buy clothes such as güipiles and belts.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 59 years old.  She is married and has ten children.  Josefina is in the agricultural business, farming fruits in the Philippines.  She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Josefina has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.  She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Twisungane Group

texts.en:
Valentine is a group leader; aged 26 years.She is married with 3 children aged between 1 and 6 years. The group is called twisungane means “support each other” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business for changing their better future. 

She has a shop and has been running in a business for 3 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of her children and renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice for sale.

loans.name: Rosibel

texts.en:
Rosibel is 45 years old and married with two children who are still in school. Rosibel works very hard to provide for them.

Rosibel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, bread, and personal care products. She has been in this business for 18 years. 

She would like to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, bread, and personal care products

loans.name: Huayhoy Group

texts.en:
Khamlar is excited the filter was available on an affordable, payment plan.  
Khamlar and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over 2 years.  The water filter Khamlar and her group purchased is guaranteed for 2 years but is known to function for up to 5 years.  

Khamlar and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Khamlar and her group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a 38-year-old married man from Rafah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip, which has an economic blockade imposed by the Israeli authorities since 2007.  He is a father of three sons and two daughters. He works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. 

Omar also has a grocery store where he sells basic grocery products. Omar  took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new refrigerator for his grocery store. With this loan, he can buy more goods for his store to resell. Omar  appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new refrigerator for his grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for construction materials and labor for home improvements.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is 35 years old, married, and lives at Clarin, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. In order to earn a living, he takes in and raises pigs from their neighborhood.  The piglets' owners share in the profit upon sale, to be divided 60/40 or 70/30, depending in their agreement.  

With a desire to earn more, he decided to raise pigs on his own as well.  Through Pauglam MPC he obtained the capital to purchase his original piglets & feed. Now, he requests a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy additional feed. He really hopes & prays that his business will grow and benefit his family, in addition to the income of his wife.

loans.use: to buy additional bags of feeds

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy stock such as soft drinks, coffee, sugar, snacks, and cake ingredients to produce various traditional cakes.

loans.name: Satom

texts.en:
Satom, 27, is a married woman from Kampong Thom province, Cambodia. She has two children. 

To make a living, she manages and operates a farming business. She grows and sells rice to the local dealers. So far, she has been involved in this business for five years. She also raises pigs for sale. She is able to make an income of USD 5.00 per day, on average.  

Recently, some parts of her house have deteriorated and they need to be fixed to provide a suitable living space. Due to the lack of funds, she has applied for a KIVA loan via HKL to pay for her house renovation. Satom and her family will be thankful to the lenders for helping them with the loan funding to improve their living standard.

loans.use: to pay for her house renovation.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
Ruben has signed up her membership with PMPC and availed the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. He is thankful for the capital it extends to a small time loaner like him. Ruben is able to turn the tide in his favor and has made good sales these days. He is also supported with his month pension that augments his monthly receivables. He wants to take advantage of the good fortune. 

Recently, he availed a loan to purchase bags of cement, plywood, galvanized iron sheets, nails and hollow blocks for house repair.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement, plywood, galvanized iron sheets, nails and hollow blocks for house repair

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more tomatoes and onions for sale to clients and meet client needs.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is aged 38 years, married to Daniel and she supports 3 children. She has been a farmer for the last 7 years and the business earns her KES 5,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers for top dressing her crops in her farm so as to get a better harvest and meet client needs.
 
She plans to use the gained profit to purchase a dairy cow for milk production and repay the loan. 

Her hope is to be financially stable and expand her agricultural sector.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers for top dressing her crops in her farm so as to get a better harvest and meet client needs.

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn is 47 years old and married.  She has four children, two of whom are currently in school.  Ailyn works very hard to provide for them.

Ailyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, bread and other personal care products.

Ailyn has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, bread and other personal care products

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a married woman with ten children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Alma is 52 years old and has four children who are presently in school.

Alma has a firewood business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more firewood to sell.

Alma has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to sell

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 45 years old and married with two children, one child still in school. Gina works very hard to provide for them.

Gina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, bread, and other personal care products.

Gina has been in this business for 10 years. 

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, bread, and other personal care products

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Gina works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell coconut business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Gina is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF in order to buy more coconut to sell to customers.

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 25 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more coconut to sell to customers.

loans.name: Martha Cecilia

texts.es: Martha Cecilia tiene 41 años, es casada, tienes 3 hijos y vive en la ciudad de México. Martha es una mujer muy feliz que disfruta cada instante de la vida, es una mujer perseverante que nunca se ha dado por vencida ante alguna adversidad, es además una mujer emprendedora que siempre le ha gustado ser independiente económicamente. Ella desde hace tres años tiene un negocio de venta de zapatos por catálogo, ella dice que le ha sido un negocio muy bien remunerado. Su principal dificultad es la falta de capital para poder invertir en los zapatos, ella solicita un préstamo de MXN 10,000 para poder comprar una gran cantidad de zapatos. Su principal meta con su negocio es poder establecerse en un local para tener más clientes, su principal motivación son sus 3 hijos pequeños, está orgullosa de ser una mujer autentica y responsable. Ella agradece mucho a todas las personas que se interesan en su causa y que le permitirán ofrecerles una vida mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en: Martha Cecilia is 41 years old, married, has three children, and lives in Mexico city. Martha is a very happy woman who enjoys every moment of her life. She is a persevering woman who never gives up in the face of any adversity. She is also an entrepreneurial woman who has always enjoyed being economically independent. For the past three years, she has had a business selling shoes from catalogues. She says it has been a well paying business. Her main challenge is lacking capital to invest in shoes. She is requesting a loan for MXN 10,000 to purchase a large quantity of shoes. Her main goal for her business is to settle into her own shop to have more clients. Her main motivation is her three small children. She is proud of being a genuine and responsible woman. She is very thankful to all the people who are interested in her cause and who will allow her to give her children a better life.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of shoes

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Janeth works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Janeth is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Janeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Sakeena

texts.en:
Sakeena is 55 years old, separated woman doing a business of animals’ purchase and sale. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of 3 children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. 

She has requested a loan of 40000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount  to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to many  customers

loans.name: Minerva

texts.en:
Minerva is a single woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Minerva is 36 years old and has four children who are presently in school.

Minerva has a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. Minerva requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy assorted goods for ready-to-wear like bags, t-shirt, pants, underwear, etc.

Minerva has been in this business for three years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy assorted goods for ready-to-wear like bags, t-shirt, pants, underwear, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Teresa

texts.en:
Ma. Teresa is 49 years old, married with one child who is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Ma. Teresa has a butcher shop business in the Philippines. Ma. Teresa requested a PHP 29,500 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more livestock for her butcher shop.

Ma. Teresa has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, Ma. Teresa would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more livestock for her butcher shop.

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en:
Shakeela , 59 years old, is a very enthusiastic person who has been successfully running a small general store with her husband, who is also shown in the photo. She offers a variety of daily use products and has a good client base. 

In order to avoid shortages, Shakeela  needs to have various goods in stock to efficiently meet customer demand. She has requested a loan of PKR 40000  to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices etc. to consistently meet the increasing demand at her store and make better earnings.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices etc

loans.name: Charlita

texts.en:
Charlita started her small time business and became a boss with her sari-sari store. She has managed to have enough inventory and rolls up her capital to gain more profit. Every day she makes good sales, since she is the only store in their Barangay.  Recently she approached Paglaum for her much needed capital to restock the store with basic commodities.

In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, soy sauce

location.town: Plaridel-Eastern Pob., Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occide

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy piglets and feed, and pay school fees

loans.name: Margery

texts.en:
Margery is grateful that she has repeatedly accessed loans and has faithfully repaid them. The proceeds of her loans have really helped finance her direct selling business and thus covered her children’s education, their personal and household expenses. 

She wants a Php 50,000 loan to pay for additional supplies and merchandise like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed for her business. She is thankful that her customers have continuously purchased her items, especially her footwear, undergarments, and toiletries. The demand for her personal products has increased since school time started in the Philippines. The common problem that she encounters is her difficulty to collect receivables from some customers but she continues to persevere and be patient because of her love of her family.

Margery dreams that her business will continue to flourish. She aims to buy a house someday. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies and merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Yamali Del Rocio

texts.es:
YAMALI TIENE 22 AÑOS DE EDAD, CONVIVIENTE, VIVE CON SU HIJO, EN CASA PROPIA, EN UNA COMUNIDAD GRANDE EN LA ZONA RURAL DEL DISTRITO DE CAYALTI, PROVINCIA DE CHICLAYO, REGION LAMBAYEQUE, COSTA NORTE DE PERU.

YAMALI SE DEDICA A LA ACTIVIDAD VENTA DE ROPA Y PRODUCTOS DE BELLEZA, DESDE HACE MAS DE 2 AÑOS DE ANTIGUEDAD, EN SU PROPIO DOMICILIO.Y GOZA DE BUENAS REFERENCIAS PERSONALES Y LABORALES DE PARTE DE SUS VECINOS. SOLICITA PRESTAMO PARA COMPRA DE MERCADERIA COMO PERFUMES, CREMAS, ACCESORIOS, ROPA Y ZAPATOS. DE ESTA MANERA HACER CRECER SU NEGOCIO, OBTENER MÁS INGRESOS Y PODER MEJORAR SU CALIDAD DE VIDA.
texts.en:
Yamali, 22, is in a common-law relationship. She lives with her son in their own home, in a large community in the rural area of Cayalti District, Chiclayo Province, in the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru.

Yamali has been selling clothes and beauty products from her home for more than two years. She has earned good personal and professional references from her neighbours. She is asking for this loan in order to buy merchandise such as perfumes, creams, accessories, clothes and shoes. In this way she can make her business grow, increase her income and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as perfumes, creams, accessories, clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Lenny

texts.en:
Lenny is a 47-year-old married woman with four children, one of whom is still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Lenny has a food vending business in the Philippines. Lenny requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF (Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation) to buy ingredients such as meat, fish, spices, and cooking oil, as well as utensils and other materials for her food production business.

Lenny has been in this business for ten years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as meat, fish, spices, and cooking oil, as well as utensils and other materials for her food production business.

loans.name: Lerna

texts.en:
Lerna is 44 years old and married.  She has three children. All of her children attend school.

Lerna earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs. Lerna has been raising pigs for ten years and also earns additional income from fish vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
As a married mother of eight children, Salvacion works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Salvacion is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell in her fish vending business.

Salvacion has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Rosally

texts.en:
Rosally is 35 years old and married. She has five children, four of whom are currently in school.

Rosally is in the agricultural business, raising cattle in the Philippines. Rosally requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccines, and other supplies to raise her cattle.

Rosally has been in this business for four years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccines, and other supplies to raise her cattle

loans.name: Sotheary's Group

texts.en:
Sotheary is 47 years old living in a rural area of Kratie province’s Sambour district and she has a dependent child who is in school. Nowadays, she grows cassava and works on her co-villager’s farm for a fee to support her living condition. She has been involved in these businesses for ten years. Her crops are growing not well so to gain low yields. 

Due to lack of funds to do farming, she decided to take her first Kiva loan via VisionFund. Meanwhile, Sotheary and another member will take a loan of 1,400,000KHR for each. She is the leader of two members, will use it to buy seed and pesticide for supporting her rice fields. She hopes that this loan will help her to get more income to have ability to keep her daughter in school until she graduate.

loans.use: to buy seed and pesticide for supporting her rice fields.

loans.name: Abanyamurava Group

texts.en:
Immaculee is a group leader; aged 28 years.She is married with 1 child who has 6 years. The group is called ABANYAMURAVA means “Integrity people” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business for changing their better future. 

She has a shop and has been running in a business for 4 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice for sale. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standards of living and to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice for sale.

loans.name: Farah

texts.en:
Farah  is 32 years old, married woman. She has been helping in her husband's business of furniture making. They have been doing it together for many years. Over time they have become famous for providing good quality furniture in her community. She is a responsible mother of 2 children and is liable to provide them with the basic necessities of life. 

Currently she has applied a loan of 50000 PKR from Kashf foundation  to purchase good quality wood along with the packs of polish and nails in larger quantity to increase their production. In this way they would be able to cater to more customers without delay which ultimately helps in bringing more cash home. Farah  dreams of providing a bright and prosperous future to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase good quality wood along with the packs of polish and nails in larger quantity to increase their production

loans.name: Nueva Generacion De Putucusi Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “NUEVA GENERACION DE PUTUCUSI”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Quellouno, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Visitacion  ella es soltera y tiene 50 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de cultivo de frutas, la socia tiene un terreno donde cultiva plátanos, café, mandarinas y naranjas, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir sacar adelante a su familia, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar su terreno de cultivo. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de agrucultura, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the New Generation of Putucusi communal bank. This bank is located in the Quellouno district in the province of La Convencíon, department of Cusco.

The member is Visitacion. She is 50 years old and single with one son. She cultivates fruit. She has a plot of land where she grows plantains, coffee, mandarins, and oranges. She works from 6am until 5pm. She wants to help her family get ahead through her business. She has worked in this business for some years and it is going very well. Her dream is to expand her plot of land. She is requesting a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

The other members work in livestock, agriculture, grocery stores and food sales.

The member is grateful to those who take part in her dream through this medium. She promises to comply with loan payments in the manner specified.

loans.use: buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Saim

texts.en:
Saim, 45 years old, is living in a community of Pursat Province, Cambodia. She has five children who are in school. 

To make a living, she manages and operates a farming business in rice farmland which is located near her house. So far, she has been involved in this business for twenty five years. On average, she is able to earn USD 3.00 per day. 

She wants to get household energy at a reduced monthly cost by purchasing a solar energy home system. Because there is inadequate money, she has requested a Kiva loan through its partner, HKL. After this initial investment, she hopes to have clean energy to power her household lights, TV and radio. 

She is very happy and thankful because with this loan, HKL has provided her a special interest rate lower than its general loan rates. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to pay for solar energy home system

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: mobile phones, batteries, covers, chargers, cases, keypads, and other items.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
This is Wilma, aged 40, resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Guadencio, a seaman, and a mother to her two elementary children. A year ago, Wilma thought of putting up a "Piso Net" business.

Wilma manages her own Computer Shop. "Piso Net" is a combination of PC rental and Arcade rental services wherein customers can use the services by inserting  a Peso coin to the machine. There is an increasing need for services like these in the Philippines as not everyone has Personal Computers at home. Her main patrons are students who do their school requirements. There is also an increased need to rent computers for business purposes like writing a resume, any office documentation and just the desire and hobby to surf the net and any social network. One can also play games in the renter computer. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 50000 loan. She will use the loan to buy additional Piso Net unit. This will definitely boost her income as she expands her business. Her earnings from the Shop helps meet the growing needs of her family.

Wilma dreams to have a bigger "Piso Net" Shop. She prays for God's protection for her family especially her husband who works as seaman. She also prays for wisdom for her ministry at churchShe meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for one Personal Computer for her "piso net" business.

loans.name: Jescyl

texts.en:
Jescyl works hard to support her family. Jescyl is single and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Jescyl requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell.  Jescyl has been in this business for three years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Donna Marie

texts.en:
Donna Marie is married and she works hard to support her family.  She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a frozen food retail business. Donna Marie is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Donna Marie has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Mailyn

texts.en:
Mailyn is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Mailyn is 42 years old and her children are in school.

Mailyn has a food vending business in the Philippines. Mailyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, fish, spices, cooking oil, additional utensils and other materials for her food production business.

Mailyn has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, fish, spices, cooking oil, additional utensils and other materials for her food production business

loans.name: Elsa Maria

texts.es: Elsa a sus 52  años de edad es una señora  dedicada  a su hogar y a su negocio  de crianza de animales menores, el esposo de Elsa trabaja de cuidador de maquinaria, Elsa tiene 5 hijos; 4 son mayores de edad y uno tiene  15 años y se encuentra estudiando, Elsa va a invertir el dinero del crédito en la compra de pollos, Elsa junto a su familia vive en una casa prestada, Elsa espera mejorar su negocio y de las ganancia que le quede seguir apoyando a su esposo en los gastos de su hogar y de educación de su hijo.
texts.en:
Elsa is 52 years old. She is devoted to her home and to her business raising small animals. Her husband earns a living as a machinery caretaker. She has five children—four of whom are of legal age and a 15-year-old, who is a student. 

Elsa is going to invest the loan in the purchase of chickens.

Elsa lives with her family in a borrowed house. She hopes to improve her business and use the remaining profit to continue helping her husband with the household expenses and their son's education.

loans.use: to purchase chickens.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
The member in the photo is Esther, 57 years old, married and a mother of 6 children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in year 2012 and has been trained on enterprise and financial management.

She has been able to run successfully a green grocery and she is borrowing from Kiva to increase stock like kale, carrots, tomatoes and cabbages. This will increase her sales and be able to cater for her basic need like food and clothing.
She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay her loan in time.

loans.use: To add more stock of vegetable thus more sales and thus be able to pay for basic need e.g food and clothing

loans.name: Yesu Tsuikrong Group

texts.en:
This group will begin its 5th loan cycle with Yesu tsuikrong. It is made up of four members and they are into materials, gari (cassava flour), sugar, tooth paste, rice and oil. 

The loan that they are taking out will benefit small-time micro-entrepreneurs, one of whom is Gloria. She says that she joined ID-Ghana three years ago at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the organization. Currently, she has a business selling materials. She shares that she learned this trade five years ago through her own initiative.

The loan she is now taking out is for an increase in working capital (to buy different materials). She will get these from the wholesale market in the city of Accra and later will sell them in from door to door. This type of work allows her to generate income to support her family financially, because she is single and has two children.

When she is asked what she likes about ID-Ghana, she answers that she likes the area of health, the training, and the payment meetings that the organization offers.

loans.use: To buy different materials from the market and sell to customers.

loans.name: Sidra

texts.en:
Sidra  is 26 years old working woman. After her marriage, she felt that she should support her husband to improve their financial condition. So she started a business of selling clothes. She believes she can earn some respect and make a better world for her children and their education. Sidra is well known  among her neighbors for her collections and has a good client list. 

Currently she needs a loan of 40000 PKR  to purchase good-quality cloth of different colors to earn substantial profits through this investment. This would lead her to live a decent life and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase good-quality cloth of different colors to earn substantial profits through this investment

loans.name: María Margarita

texts.es: Margarita tiene 48 años es casada, tiene dos hijas y vive en el Estado de México. Es una mujer muy proactiva y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, siempre ha apoyado a su esposo en las decisiones que él ha tomado. Desde hace dos años cuando su situación económica se tornó difícil, ella decidió ayudar a su esposo obteniendo más ingresos a través de una miscelánea, en dicho negocio ella vende: refrescos, frutas y verduras, lácteos, pan, entre otros. Con un préstamo de MXN 15,000 Margarita podrá comprar productos en grandes cantidades, de tal forma que le serán más baratos y tendrá una utilidad mayor. Ella desea que en el futuro su tienda sea tan conocida que pueda esparcirse por toda la región, a ella le da una gran satisfacción cuando ve a sus clientes contentos con los productos que ella ofrece. Margarita estará muy agradecida con todas las personas que la ayuden a hacer crecer su negocio, al colaborar con margarita no solo la estarás apoyando a ella, también a su familia y a todas las personas que dependen de los productos que ella ofrece.
texts.en:
Margarita is 48 years old, is married, has two daughters, and lives in the State of Mexico. She’s a very proactive woman and in her eagerness to succeed has always supported her husband in the decisions that he has made. Two years ago when their economic situation became difficult, she decided to help her husband get more income with a corner shop. In this business she sells soft drinks, fruits and vegetables, dairy products, and bread among other things. 

With a loan of 15,000 Mexican Pesos (MXN), Margarita could buy products in larger quantities so that they will be cheaper, and she will have a larger profit. She hopes that in the future her store could be so well-known that she can spread throughout the region. It gives her great satisfaction when she sees her happy customers with the products that she offers. 

Margarita will be very thankful towards all of the people who help her grow her business. By collaborating with Margarita you won’t just be supporting her, you’ll also be supporting her family and all of the people who depend on the products that she offers.

loans.use: to buy products in larger quantities so that they will be cheaper

loans.name: Rahima

texts.en:
Rahima was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1977. She is married and has three children and is a teacher. She teaches beginners at secondary school. She has 11 years of practice working at school. 

She feels herself unwell and wants to test her analysis at a medical clinic. She has not money to test and have further treatment. She appealed to IMON asking a loan to treatment expenditures. She hopes to be supported and awaits Kiva lenders kindness.

loans.use: to test her analysis at a medical clinic

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.es:
Evelyn es estudiante de la carrera Administración de Empresas, también trabaja una empresa, y comenta que tiene como meta culminar su carrera para poder trabajar mejor, obteniendo mejores ingresos.
Ella es una persona muy sacrificada que lucha por poder salir adelante y mejorar cada día.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y también para poder comprar libros
texts.en:
Evelyn is studying for a degree in Business Administration. She also works for a company and says that her goal is to finish her degree so that she can do a better job and earn more income.

Evelyn is a self-sacrificing individual who strives to move forward and improve each day. She is requesting this loan so that she can pay her degree fees and also buy books.

loans.use: to pay her degree fees and buy books.

loans.name: Siempre Unidos Triunfaremos Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SIEMPRE UNIDOS TRIUNFAREMOS, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Karin continua con su  negocio de venta de productos de belleza como cremas, colonias, perfumes entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia continua vendiendo  a pedido para sus clientes que le solicitan como amistades, familiares entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
 La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de colonias entre otros.
La foto fue tomada en dos grupos por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
Karin belongs to the communal bank Siempre Unidos Triunfaremos. The bank is located in the Cusco district the Cusco department.

Karin is continuing with her business selling beauty products such as creams, colognes, and perfumes among others. Karin spends a lot of time on her business which is going well thanks to the determination she has every day. She still sells by orders from her customers, such as friends and family members, among others, who make requests. Karin wants to be able to continue working so that this way she can continue supporting her family.

Karin is grateful for the loan offered and is committed to making the repayments on time.

Karin is asking for the loan in order to buy colognes, among others. The photo was taken in two groups due to work reasons.

loans.use: to buy colognes, among other merchandise.

loans.name: Sokeng

texts.en:
Sokeng, 36, lives in a community of Pursat Province, Cambodia. She is a lovely mother of two children. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farmland which is located near her house. So far, she has been in his types of business for around ten years. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 3.00 a day.

She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine for the welfare of her family

loans.name: Smpphors

texts.en:
Smpphors, 23, lives in a community of Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She is a lovely mother of one child. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farmland which is located near her house. So far, she has been in his types of business for around two years. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 5.00 a day.

She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from KIVA to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine for the welfare of her family

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 45 years old and lives in Seti, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with four children who are now adults and of school age.

Her main source of living has come from coconut buying and a copra processing business for 15 years already. She earns approximately 5,000 PHP each month with this type of business activity, and this amount is so helpful to meet their needs.

Juliet has requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to be used in purchasing coconuts for copra processing and for resale.

She has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for two years. In the future, she hopes that all her children will finish their college education.

loans.use: to purchase coconuts.

loans.name: Hinsangom Group

texts.en:
Ya understands the difference the water filter can make for his family and for his group’s families.  Ya knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  The water filter Ya purchased will increase his family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood.  The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.    

Ya is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for 2 years – so he and his group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more stocks such as; cooking oil, sugar, rice, noodles, wheat, etc,

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair the damaged parts of his home

loans.name: Vet

texts.en:
Vet, 51, is a married woman from Kampong Speu province. She has two children. To make a living, she manages and operates a farming business, grows and sells rice to the local dealers. So far, she has been involved in this business for twenty years. She is able to make an income of USD 5.00 per day, on average. 

 Recently, some parts of her house have deteriorated and they need to be fixed to provide a suitable living for the household. Due to the lack of funds, she has applied for a Kiva loan via HKL to pay for her house renovation. She and her family will be thankful to the lenders for helping them with the loan funded to improve their living standard.

loans.use: to pay for her house renovation

loans.name: Phonmeuang Group

texts.en:
Xayboualy understands the difference the water filter can make for his family and for his group’s families.  Xayboualy knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  The water filter Xayboualy purchased will increase his family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood.  The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.    

Xayboualy is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for 2 years – so he and his group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Yaon's Group

texts.en:
A local resident living in Siem Reap province’s Prasat Bakong district, Yaon is 49 years old and is the mother of three dependent children who are all in school.

Nowadays, she has been selling sugar cane juice to support her family’s living condition for three years. The price of sugar cane is increasing, which is the problem for her business.

She has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for three loan cycles already, and she has fully repaid her past loans successfully. Yaon is the leader of two members who will take a new loan of 1,600,000 KHR for each.

Meanwhile, she will manage her entire loan portion to buy more kinds of beverages to attract more customers. She hopes to get more income to update her family’s condition.

loans.use: to buy more kinds of beverages to attract more customers.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Prasat Bakong district

loans.name: Oun

texts.en:
Oun, 58, is lives in a small community of Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has four children, two are married and two are single. She is a grocery seller and earns, on average,uy7g USD 5.00 a day. So far, she has been in this career for fifteen years. 

She is now would like to apply for Kiva loan to buy a plot of land to operate a farm. She hopes that this new farmland will become an additional source of her family’s income and help to remove poverty from her life. She is thankful to all lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land to operate a farming

loans.name: Icyizere Acb Group

texts.en:
ICYIZERE is a group led by Claudine who is 27 years old. The group name means “Support each other” in English. She has been a group leader for 1 years. She sells clothes and has been selling in a business for 2 years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more shirts and dresses for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of her children and improve her standards of living.

loans.use: to buy more shirts and dresses for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy metal sheets, beams and pins to replace the roof of her home.

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en:
Yusuf was born in a northern part of Tajikistan in a family of farmers. He is living in a village with his family. He is married and is an agrarian. He keeps and sells livestock. For 7 years he does business and well knows how to take care of his livestock. 

He has a sick child. He wishes to treat him at hospital, but has no money. He appealed to IMON asking financial support to treat his child at hospital. He hopes to be supported and awaits Kiva lenders compassion.

loans.use: to treat his child at hospital

loans.name: Mahsuda

texts.en:
Mahsuda was born in a northern part of Tajikistan in 1987. She is single and lives with her parents. She is a business lady who buys and sells vegetables and grocery products at her small store in the domestic market. She is responsible, careful and honest person. She helps her parents to earn money for living. 

Her mother became sick. She wants to treat her at a medical clinic, but she has no money. She appealed to IMON asking financial support to pay her mother’s treatment at medical clinic.

loans.use: to treat her mother at medical clinic

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana tiene 63 años de edad, es casada, vive con su esposo en una zona rural en el caserío Gramalotillo, del distrito de Santa Cruz que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la Sierra norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Juana se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como pollos, gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio.Además de contar con una pequeña bodega. Cuenta con 10 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que solicita será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como gallinas, patos, pavos, pollos, entre otros, así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para estos. Con esto Juana espera ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir generar mayores ingresos y por ende incrementará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Juana is 63, married, and lives with her husband in a rural area in the hamlet of Gramalotillo, located in the district of Santa Cruz in the province of Cutervo, Cajamarca region, along the northern Peruvian mountain chain. The residents of this district are mainly engaged in agriculture, livestock, and trade.

Juana earns her living breeding and selling small animals such as chickens, ducks, turkeys, and others. Her business is located in her home. She also has a small shop. She has ten years of experience in her business with very good personal and professional references in the area. Her requested loan will be used to purchase a greater flock of animals such as chickens, ducks, turkeys, and more. She will also purchase quality feed for them. Juana hopes her loan will allow her to offer a better product to her customers, which will allow her to generate more income and increase the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: to increase her flock of chicken, ducks, and turkeys

loans.name: Cruz Margarita

texts.es:
Cruz tiene 25 años de edad,conviviente, vive con su conyuge y sus dos hijos en una zona rural del distrito de Cayaltí que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Cruz se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como pollos, gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con 10 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que solicita será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como gallinas, patos, pavos, pollos, entre otros, así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para estos. Con esto Cruz espera ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir generar mayores ingresos y por ende incrementará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Cruz is 25 years old and lives with her partner and two children in a rural zone in the Cayaltí district. It is in the Chiclayo province, in the Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru. The residents of this district work primarily in agriculture,  ranching, and commerce. 

Cruz works breeding and selling small animals like chickens, hens, and turkeys, among others. Her business is located in her own home. She has ten years of experience in this business and has great personal and work references in the area. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy a greater amount of animals like hens, ducks, turkeys, and chickens, among others. She will also buy balanced feed for them. This way, Cruz hopes to offer her clients better products, which will allow her to earn a better income, thus improving her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy a greater amount of animals like hens, ducks, turkeys, and chickens, among others, as well as balanced feed for them

loans.name: Twitezimbere Sub Group A

texts.en:
Beatrice is a group leader; aged 35 years.She is married with 2 children aged between 1 and 6 years. The group is called TWITEZIMBERE means “Develop each other” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business for changing their better future. 

She is a tailor and has been running a business for 3 years. With the loan, she would like to weave more material for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay pay school fees of her children and renovate her house.

loans.use: to be able to weave more material for sale.

loans.name: Maricor

texts.en:
Maricor is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy more variety of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Maricor has been in this business for 2 years. Maricor earns more income from food vending.

Maricor has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more variety of fish to sell

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana  has been doing a business of shoe-making for many years. She is an energetic person and eager to support her family. She is responsible for taking care of the basic necessities of her children, including food, health and clothing. She is also accountable for improving their standard of living.  By the support of Kashf Foundation she is fulfilling her dreams and is able to manage her children’s education. 

Now she requested for a 40000 PKR  to buy additional material for shoes, including leather, artificial leather, and plastic soles, etc. In this way, she can handle the growing demand for her shoes in the market and hence, better support her family.

loans.use: to buy additional material for shoes, including leather, artificial leather and plastic soles, etc

loans.name: Saidpochcho

texts.en:
Saidpochcho was born in a northern part of Tajikistan in the family of farmers. She is living in a remote district with her family, is married and has three children. Her husband is a teacher. She has worked at a government agency for 19 years. Three years ago she became a manager of department work with women and family. 

Recently, she is sick; she wants to be treated at hospital. She appealed to Kiva and IMON to get a loan to be treated at hospital. She hopes to be understood and supported.

loans.use: to be treated at hospital

loans.name: Anvaroi

texts.en:
Anvaroi was born in a northern part of Tajikistan in 1965. She is living in small town with her family, is married and has two children. She has 19 years of experience working at a secondary school as a teacher. She is well known among tutors and friends. She likes her job. 

She is sick and willing to be treated at hospital. She applies to get a loan from IMON and Kiva to be treated at hospital. She wishes to be supported and continue working when she would recover.

loans.use: to be treated at hospital

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.es:
La socia Eulalia pertenece al banco comunal LAMAY QOSQO, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Lamay, provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Eulalia continua con su  negocio de venta de comida, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua vendiendo diferentes platos como arroz con pollo, sopas entre otros a todos sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
 La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de menestras, carnes, arroz entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Eulalia belongs to the LAMAY QOSQO communal bank. The bank is located in the Lamay district, Calca province, Cusco department. She continues her business selling food.  She is responsible and diligent.  She sells different dishes like chicken with rice and soups, among others, to all of her customers that request her food.  In this way she has helped her family to move ahead.  

She is requesting the loan to buy supplies like vegetables, meat, rice among others. She is grateful for the loan that was granted, and she pledges to make her payments punctually.

loans.use: to purchase mixed vegetables, meat and rice among other ingredients.

loans.name: Mavjigul

texts.en:
Mavjigul is a bright girl. She was born in a northern part of Tajikistan in 1988 and is living in a small town with her family. She is working as a specialist at government agency in her area and is single.  She has seven years of working experience at the agency and at the same time she is a student. 

She studies at part time department.  She appealed to IMON asking a loan to pay her higher education costs. She hopes to be supported and awaits Kiva lenders compassion.

loans.use: to pay her higher education costs

loans.name: Crisosto

texts.es:
Crisosto tiene 45 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y dos hijos menores, en Callayuc, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.Una comunidad de clima frío su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería
