El se dedica a la carpintería, talla sillas, mesas, bancos, puertas entre otros,cuenta con buenas referencias laborales y personales, tiene experiencia en el rubro de 12 años, solicita el prestamo para la compra de una garlopa y herramientas que le permitan realizar acabados en sus trabajos y de esta manera ofrecer un mejor servicio, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Cristoso is 45 years old. He lives with his spouse and two young children in Callayuc, located in the Cutervo province, part of the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru. A community with a cold climate, its population works in farming, trade and ranching. 

He is a carpenter. He makes chairs, tables, benches and doors, among other things. He has good personal and work references, and has been in this business since he was 12 years old.

He is requesting the loan for the purchase of a jack plane and tools that will let him make finishes on his jobs, and in this way offer better service, generating greater income for his family.

loans.use: to buy a jack plane and tools that will let him make finishes on his pieces.

loans.name: Senia Leticia

texts.es:
Senia es una joven de 36 años de edad quien anteriormente obtuvo su título de secundaria como secretaria y técnico en computación, continuó sus estudios universitarios y esta por postularse como profesional en la administración de empresas.
Es madre y esposa, actualmente reside en compañía de su esposo y sus dos hijos de 15 y 4 años de edad,el menor de sus pequeños hijos fue diagnosticado con síndrome de Down desde pequeño, condición que le ha generado muchos esfuerzos económicos para el bienestar de él y el de toda su familia, razón por la cual ha solicitado un apoyo de financiamiento para culminar sus estudios.
Sus cualidades mas destacadas, es la responsabilidad,la organización en sus planes de vida, es proactiva, diligente y colaboradora.
Su motivación inicial para continuar su meta académica, es abrir nuevas oportunidades que le permitan desempeñarse como una profesional sumamente competitiva, considera que con la educación fomentará el mejor ejemplo para su familia ya que su  perseverancia ante cualquier situación, la ha convertido en una persona luchadora. desea contribuir al país, mediante su aporte al desarrollo empresarial.
La joven menciona lo difícil que ha sido para ella el poder llegar hasta donde hoy en día se encuentra, ya que cuando culminó sus estudios de secundaria, aspiraba a iniciar sus estudios universitarios pero como requisito le exigieron estudiar 2 años mas la carrera de perito mercantil y contador público, hoy en día se siente orgullosa de haber estudiado y perseverado para lograr muchas de sus metas, ya que otras aun no las ha cumplido pero luchará hasta lograr cada sueño y logro de vida.
Sus planes a futuro, están centrados en el apoyo educativo para sus pequeños hijos, para que al momento que ellos deseen estudiar todo sea diferente mediante mejores condiciones de vida que sus metas le permitirán alcanzar.
texts.en:
Senia is a young woman of 36 years who previously earned her high school diploma with a specialization in clerical and computer technician work. She has continued her studies and is about to graduate as a professional in business administration. 

She is a mother and wife and lives with her spouse and their two children, 15 and 4 years of age. The youngest of her children was diagnosed with Down syndrome as a child, a condition which has necessitated an economic effort to provide for his welfare and the welfare of the entire family, which is why Senia is seeking a loan to complete her studies. 

Her most outstanding qualities are her responsibility, the organization of her life plans, her proactivity, diligence, and cooperation.

Her initial motivation to continue her academic studies was to open new opportunities that allow her to serve as a highly competent professional. She believes that education will encourage the best example for her family and her perseverance in any situation has allowed her to become a fighter. She wishes to contribute to the country through her contribution to its business development. 

Senia has mentioned how difficult it was for her to get where she is today because once she finished high school she wanted to go to university. However, there was a requirement that demanded studying two additional years at a trade school to become a CPA. Today, she is proud that she studied and persevered to achieve many of her goals. Others have not been fulfilled but she will work hard to achieve every dream and lifetime achievement.

Her future plans are focused on educational support for her young children so that they can study and have better life conditions that allow them to achieve their goals.

loans.use: to finish her university studies in business administration

loans.name: Ilolbi

texts.en:
Ilolbi was born in southern part of Tajikistan in 1965. She is living in a big city with her family, is a widow and has two children. For about five years she is working as a rental worker. She gets orders at home and serves people cleaning and cultivating their gardens. She is hardworking, responsible and punctual person. 

She has problems with health and needs to take courses of treatment each year. She appealed to IMON and asked a loan to be treated at hospital. She hopes Kiva lenders compassion and support.

loans.use: to be treated at hospital

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.es:
El socio Bernardo  se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de palos y leñas, por medio de este negocio el socio quiere salir adelante, el sueño del es ampliar el negocio de venta de palos y leñas. El socio solicita el crédito para palos y leñas.

venta de palos y leñas
texts.en: Bernardo continues working selling sticks and firewood. By means of this business, the member wants to get ahead. His dream is to grow the business of selling sticks and firewood. The member is requesting this loan for sticks and firewood. [....the sale of sticks and firewood].

loans.use: to buy sticks and firewood.

loans.name: Loradel

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Loradel works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from food vending.  Loradel is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to  purchase more ready-to-wear products to sell in her stall.

Loradel has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more ready-to-wear products to sell in her stall

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is a 48-year-old married mother of eight children, four still in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Luzviminda has a buy-and-sell nipa roofing business in the Philippines. Luzviminda requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more nipa roofing to sell.

Luzviminda has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more nipa roofing to sell

loans.name: Carmelina

texts.en:
Carmelina is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a food-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

Carmelina has been in this business for five years. Carmelina earns additional income from raising livestock.

Carmelina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: New Twitezimbere Sub Group B

texts.en:
New twitezimbere is a group led by Clemantine who is 36 years old.she have 5 children aged between3 and 18 years. The group name means “Develop each other” in English. She has been a group leader for 12 years. She sells clothes and has been selling in a business for 2 years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more shirts and dresses for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of her children and improve her standards of living.

loans.use: to buy more shirts and dresses for sale.

loans.name: Bety

texts.es:
Bety joven madre y esposa de 36 años de edad, actualmente reside en compañía de su esposo y sus hijos de edades 19,15 y 10 años, comenta que se graduó en su secundaria de bachiller en ciencias y letras, seguidamente inició sus estudios universitarios obteniendo el título de licenciada en pedagogía, actualmente labora como coordinadora de negocios en una empresa del país. 
Esta por iniciar sus estudios de postgrado en el área de dirección comercial y ventas, ya que su cargo actualmente en la empresa donde labora le exige siempre estar a la vanguardia de los cambios económicos y de negocios es por eso que la orientación comercial y ventas es la carrera de su interés.
Bety es una joven pro activa, emprendedora, orientada al logro, es responsable y amable con las personas que la rodean es de mente joven y de pensamientos positivos.
El crecimiento profesional se ha convertido en la primera motivación para continuar con sus estudios, ya que solo con el esfuerzo y sacrificio personal se abren oportunidades de vida que mejoran las condiciones de cada persona ante cualquier situación que pueda ser de éxito para los mas pequeños del hogar.
Mediante su educación desea contribuir al desarrollo de su país con cada con conocimiento y habilidad aprendida a lo largo de su carrera como profesional.
Bety recuerda que sus esfuerzos y esmeros por ser siempre una profesional de éxito, influyeron en su vida ya que durante estudiaba su carrera universitaria, ella fue becada por 5 años pero logró finalizar sus estudios antes de tiempo en 4 años ya que estudiaba mucho día a día y cursaba clases por suficiencia logrando así avanzar en su rendimiento académico, esto sin duda es sinónimo de orgullo para Bety y su familia, un claro ejemplo de preparación académica para sus hijos.
En sus planes a futuro, esta conocer otro país y adquirir nuevos conocimientos y mecanismos de trabajo que puedan ser de mucha ayuda en su ambiente laboral.
texts.en:
Bety, 36, is a young mother and wife. She currently lives with her husband, and their children who are 19, 15 and 10 years old. She says that she graduated from secondary school with a diploma in Arts and Sciences, and then started her university studies, obtaining a degree in teaching. Currently, she works as a business coordinator in a company.

She now wants to start her postgraduate studies in Commercial and Sales Management, since her workload in the company where she works requires her to be at the forefront of economic and business changes, and this is why she is interested in this area. Bety is a proactive, enterprising young woman. She is results orientated, responsible, and friendly with people who surround her. She has a young mind and positive thoughts.

Professional development has become the primary motivation to continue her studies, since with just some effort and personal sacrifice she can open life opportunities that can improve conditions for everyone, in the event of any situation that could be a success for the children.

During her education Bety wants to contribute to the development of her country with the knowledge and skills she has learnt throughout her career as a professional.

Bety remembers that her efforts and carefulness being a successful professional influenced her life, since while she was studying for her degree, she was awarded scholarships for five years, but she managed to finish her studies in four years since she studied a lot and took enough classes to allow her to advance in her academic performance. This is without doubt something Bety and her family are proud of, a clear example of academic preparation for her children.

For her future plans, she wants to visit other countries and gain new knowledge and work mechanisms that could be of great help in her work environment.

loans.use: to pay for her postgraduate studies in Commercial and Sales Management.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
La socia Magdalena se dedica al negocio de artesania, la socia vende  tejidos, chompas, mantas y telares, la socia vende diferentes tejidos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de tejidos y telares. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar tejidos, chompas y telares.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Magdalena is in the business of selling hand crafted items.  She sells weavings, sweaters, blankets and textiles.  She sells different weavings.  She works from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm.  She has been doing this for 8 years and it is going very well.  Her dream is to increase her business selling weavings and textiles.  

She is asking for the loan to purchase weavings, sweaters and textiles.  She is happy about the loan and promises to make the scheduled payments.

loans.use: to purchase weavings, sweaters and looms.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more rice

loans.name: Genaro

texts.en:
He is Genaro is 48, resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. He is happily married to Joan, a sewer and has two children.  

Genaro is into food business for six years already. He buys several kilos of fresh chicken then fry them into quarter and sell them at his stand. He has already established regular customers for his long years of selling fried chicken. Friend chicken has been a favorite quick meal of his neighbors and the local working community. 

He is now seeking financial assistance in the amount of Php 30000 to buy several kilos of fresh chicken, gas, oil to fry quartered and whole chickens. He trust that you could grant him the amount he needs to grow his business. 

Genaro dreams to send his children to allow them better opportunities in life. He meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God he studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fresh chicken to fry and sell them at his stall.

loans.name: Merinet

texts.en:
Merinet is 47 years old and married with five children.

Merinet works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, shampoo and other personal care products.

Merinet has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from food vending.

Merinet aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, shampoo and other personal care products

loans.name: Maxima

texts.en:
Maxima works hard to support her family. Maxima is married and has a food-production business in the Philippines.

Maxima requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like flour, sugar, margarine, and eggs for her food-production business.

Maxima has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Maxima would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like flour, sugar, margarine, and eggs for her food-production business

loans.name: Hernane

texts.en:
Hernane works hard to support her family. Hernane is widowed and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Hernane requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.

Hernane has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Hernane would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is 34 years old; she is a married woman and one of her sons is also shown in the photo with her.  She deals in a business of selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. 

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 45000  to purchase more animals to inflate her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to increase her sales

loans.name: Javier Hilarion

texts.es:
Javier continúa con su negocio de servicio de transporte urbano e interdepartamental. El crédito anterior lo invirtió en la compra de llantas y en el pago del mantenimiento. El pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque no tuvo problemas. Su camión transporta todo tipo de carga, como; ladrillo, estuco, traslado de casa, etc., y este constantemente necesita mantenimiento y cambio de piezas gastadas, “mi herramienta de trabajo es mi camión por eso lo cuido y le doy mantenimiento continuamente para que me dure más…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con cargas y traslados diarios, la desventaja es la falta de capital para realizar el mantenimiento y continuar trabajando. Su sueño es comprarse otro vehículo, él desea realizar el pago del mantenimiento del camión y la compra de una batería. Esta es la 3 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que trabaja como transportista.
Es por esos motivos que Javier solicita un préstamo para pagar el mantenimiento del vehículo y la compra de batería para continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Javier is continuing with his urban and interdepartmental transportation service. He invested his previous loan in buying tires and paying for vehicle maintenance. His repayments were on time as he had no problems. His lorry transports all kinds of cargo such as bricks, plaster, home removals etc., and it constantly needs maintenance and worn parts replaced. "My work tool is my lorry, this is why I look after it and carry out maintenance continuously so that it will last longer..." he says.

The advantage to Javier's business is that he has daily cargos and journeys, the disadvantage is that he does not have enough capital to carry out the maintenance and continue working. His dream is to buy himself another vehicle, he wants to pay for the maintenance of the lorry and a battery. This is the third loan he has taken out with the institution in the 10 years he has worked as a transporter. It is for these reasons that Javier is asking for a loan; so that he can pay for the vehicle's maintenance and a battery to continue his business.

loans.use: to pay for vehicle maintenance and a battery to continue his business.

loans.name: Diloshub

texts.en: Diloshub is a hard-working woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in a family of workers. She is married and has one child. She is living in a village with her family. She has sown traditional women dresses for three years. Diloshub sews beautiful dresses at home and sells them in the domestic market. She has regular customers every day. For additional income, she also teaches students how to sew. Her child is sick but she does not have enough money to pay for his treatment. Diloshub appealed to IMON and Kiva asking for financial support to treat her child at a medical clinic. She awaits your kindness and hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to pay for her child's treatment at a medical clinic

loans.name: La Perla Del Oriente Group

texts.es:
Asunta es una mujer de 36 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos, y su negocio es la venta de golosinas y refrescos.
Ella es emprendedora, constante, amable, fuerte, atenta, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza dentro de una escuela en la zona ‘virgen de lujan’ situado atrás del parque industrial, una zona residencial con crecimiento poblacional, con movimiento comercial y de esparcimiento como: restaurantes, Canchas, Parques, etc. un lugar seguro, y de fácil acceso. De clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Asunta es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (la primera de la derecha, viste chompa negra). Su vida la comparte con sus familiares que trabajan, viven en un cuarto propio construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de cemento que cuenta con energía eléctrica, agua potable y alcantarillado. Debido a la necesidad de mejorar su segunda actividad, formó una banca de personas con negocios, como; venta de comida, librería, elaboración de sombreros de sao, artesanía en cuero, venta de flores, venta de remedios naturales y comercio de verduras, para solicita run crédito y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de golosinas y refrescos, en su puesto de venta fijo dentro de una escuela en donde trabaja como portera, cuidando todo el equipamiento e infraestructura del mismo, “trabajo en esta escuela durante varios años y vi la necesidad que tienen los alumnos por refrescos y golosinas, es un pequeño negocio dentro de mi trabajo…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son continuas durante todo el año escolar, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de refrescos y golosinas para la venta en el kiosco de la escuela. Su sueño es abrir una tienda en la calle con víveres de primera necesidad, ella desea realizar la compra de golosinas y refrescos para estabilizar su segunda actividad. Esta es la 3 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 17 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Asunta solicita un préstamo para la compra de refrescos y golosinas para estabilizar su segunda actividad.
texts.en:
Asunta is a woman of 36 years years. She is single, has no children, and her business is selling sweets and soft drinks. She is enterprising, consistent, kind, strong, careful, responsible, and hardworking. She conducts her business inside a chool in the Virgen de Lujan region, which is located in an industrial and residential area with great population growth, commercial activity, and recreation with restaurants, tennis courts, parks, and more. It’s a safe and easily accessible place in a warm subtropical climate with a temperature that varies during the day between 21-35 degrees Celsius. 

Asunta is dark complected with brown eyes, long black hair, short stature, and a robust physique. Her mother tongue is Guarani, which she speaks with her family. She speaks Spanish in general and while doing business. She is the first on the right in a black sweater. 

She shares her life with relatives who work together. She lives in her own room built of brick and cement with a tin roof and cement floor that has electricity, water, and sewage. Because of the need to improve her business, she formed a group with entrepreneurs with businesses in food sales, making hats, book sales, leather crafting, flower sales, natural remedy sales, and vegetable sales seeking loans to improve their activities. Asunta’s business is selling sweets and soft drinks at a permanent post in the school where she works as a custodian. She takes care of all the school equipment and infrastructure. She says, “working in this school for several years, she saw the need for students who wanted to purchase sodas and candy. It is a small business at my job.” The advantage of her business is that sales are continuous throughout the school year. The disadvantage is the lack of capital to purchase her supplies, like soft drinks and candy, for the school kiosk. Her dream is to open a shop on the street selling basic grocery necessities. She wants to buy candy and soft drinks to stabilize her business. This is her third loan from the institution in her 17 years of working at this business. 

For these reasons, Asunta has applied for a loan to purchase soft drinks and sweets to stabilize her secondary source of income.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks and sweets

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es:
La socia Matilde  pertenece al banco comunal LAMAY QOSQO, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Lamay, provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Matilde continua con su negocio de crianza de animales menores como pollos, cuyes entre otros, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas,la socia continua criando a estos animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes  que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de pollos entre otros.
texts.en:
Matilde is part of the LAMAY QOSQO communal bank, located in the Lamay district of the Calca province and Cusco department. 

Matilde continues in her business of raising young animals  such as chickens and guinea pigs, among others.  She is a responsible and diligent person.  She is grateful for the loan that she has been granted and promises to make the scheduled payments.  

She continues raising these small animals to sell to her customers.  This is the way that she is improving her family.  She is asking for the loan to purchase chickens and other small animals.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and other items.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agness, 24, is honest, hardworking and lives in Kyarushesha-Hoima. Agness had viable business ideas but didn’t have enough capital to start her own business until she joined a group trained by UGAFODE. She attained training on how to establish and run profitable business activities. She has been a cattle trader since 2010.
Agness is single with two dependents, her nephews, as her sister passed away five years ago. Both are going to school. After the training, she now wants to borrow UGX3,000,000 to fatten her cattle. Her dream is to improve her cattle trading business and get married. Her additional income from a retail shop is limited and spent on taking care of her two dependents. She appreciates the efforts of the lenders in fighting poverty among rural communities.

loans.use: To boost her cattle trade business

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is a married, 67-year-old mother of five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Rosalia has a food-production business in the Philippines. Rosalia requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

Rosalia has been in this business for 12 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business

loans.name: Shabnam

texts.en:
Shabnam, age 41, is a married woman. She is been in work of hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. 

To help her to continue her operations, she has requested for a loan of 40000 PKR  to buy spools of threads in different colors and along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for its embellishment; will allow her to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful to get an increase in her income by targeting more customers. She dreams for her bright future and desires to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy spools of threads in different colors and along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for its embellishment which will allow her to cater to more customers consistently

loans.name: San Isidro Labrador Group

texts.es:
El grupo está dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, cada una busca el porvenir de sus seres queridos,  para poder dar a sus familias un mejor estilo de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Teresa, quien se dedica a la venta de prendas variadas, comenta que por medio de sus ventas tiene los medios necesarios para poder dar a sus seres queridos todo lo que necesitan para una vida digna y sin privaciones.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de remeras, camisas, pantalones, blusas y otros, de manera a poder cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
This group is part of the Poverty Elimination Program, each concerned with the future of their loved ones and giving their families a better lifestyle.

One of the members is Teresa, who sells clothes of varied styles. She reports that her sales allow her to give her family what they need for a decent life without deprivation. She has requested this loan to buy t-shirts, shirts, pants, blouses, and other clothes in order to meet her clients’ needs.

loans.use: to purchase shirts, pants, and more to sell

loans.name: Cristo Milagroso Group

texts.es: Este es el nuevo grupo cristo milagroso conformado por 6 socios con deseos de progresar. Este es el caso de Maria una mujer emprendedora  con 32 años de edad. Ella es conviviente con dos hijos dependientes .con ganas de mejorar su calidad de vida puso un restaurante. Hace más de un año y siete meses que puso dicho negocio el cual le va bien. Su mayor deseo es de poder ampliar su negocio y ayudar a sus hijos. Solicitó el crédito  para la compra de arroz fideos verduras y carnes. El grupo cristo milagroso” agradece a los Inversionistas de Kiva por el apoyo brindado. Maria es encuentra de pie en la parte posterior es la primera del lado derecho y viste casaca color plomo.
texts.en:
This new group is called Cristo Milagroso. It consists of 6 partners who are wanting to progress. This is the situation of Maria, an enterprising woman of 32 years of age. She is married with two dependent children. She is eager to improve their quality of life by establishing a restaurant. She has had her business for more than a year and seven months and it is doing well. Her greatest wish is to expand her business and help her children. She has requested a loan to buy rice, noodles, vegetables, and meats. The Cristo Milagroso group thanks Kiva lenders for their support. 

Maria is located on the back row. She is the first on the right and wears a dark tracksuit.

loans.use: ro purchase rice, noodles, meat, and vegetables

loans.name: Ry

texts.en:
Ry, 47, is a married woman from Kampong Speu province. She has two children. To make a living, she works as a sales assistant in one shop which is located in her community. So far, she has been in this career for two years. She is able to make an income of USD 4.00 per day, on average.  


Recently, some parts of her house have deteriorated and they need to be fixed to provide a suitable living for the household. Due to the lack of fund, she has applied for a Kiva loan via HKL to pay for her house renovation. She and her family will be thankful to the lenders for helping them with the loan funded to improve their living standard.

loans.use: to pay for her house renovation

loans.name: Sopheak

texts.en:
Sopheak, 25, lives in a community of Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has only one child. To support the family, she works very hard on her own rice farmland and sells the crop to the local dealers and customers in the market. The net profit that she can generate is USD 5.00 a day, on average. 

Beside being a rice farmer, she has other agricultural business which is raising pigs for sale. Currently, she is requesting a Kiva loan to buy pigs food for her pigs. With the supporting from this loan, she hopes that it can help all of her pigs grow better and faster. She is thankful for their generous behaviors.

loans.use: to buy pig food

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
La socia Lucila continua dedicándose al  negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua vendiendo  productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche y aceite entre otros a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, golosinas, gaseosas entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Our client Lucila continues to earn her living selling groceries. She is a responsible and earnest person. She stills sells staple products like rice, sugar, milk, and cooking oil, among others. Her customers request her goods. Lucila has had her business for several years and does well thanks to her effort she puts into her business each day.

Lucila is requesting a loan to buy rice, candy, soft drinks, and other products. She is grateful for the loan and promises to make her repayments.

loans.use: to purchase rice, candy, and soft drinks for her store

loans.name: Fely

texts.en: Fely is 72 years old, a widow from Biasong, Lopez JAena-Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She owns and runs a pottery showroom and a pottery manufacturing business. This business gives her sufficient income for her family needs. Recently, she avails a loan from Paglaum MPC of PHP 10,000.00 to buy clay for her pottery making business.

loans.use: to buy clay for her pottery making business

location.town: Plaridel - Biasong, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Leoncia

texts.en:
Leoncia is 39 years old and married with three children.

She is in agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Leoncia is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Leoncia has been in this business for 7 years and also earns additional income from general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is a married woman, 50 years old with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Perla has a fishing business in the Philippines. Perla requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing nets, bamboo, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business.

Perla has been in this business for 18 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, bamboo, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business

loans.name: Emelinda

texts.en:
Emelinda is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell peanut business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of peanuts for her business.

Emelinda has been in this business for 20 years. Emelinda earns additional income from raising pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting this new loan to further build her business.

Emelinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of peanuts to sell

loans.name: Maria Elisa

texts.es:
La socia Maria Elisa se sigue dedicando al negocio de crianza de animales, la socia cria cuyes y gallinas, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere poner su tienda de abarrotes ya que es su sueño tener su propio negocio, la socia también quiere tener un lugar más amplio para que pueda vender sus animales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas y también alimentos para los animales.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member, Maria Elisa, continues to make a living raising animals. She raises guinea pigs and chickens. With the help of this work, the member hopes to start a grocery store, as her dream is to have her own business. In addition, she wishes to have a larger space where she can sell her animals.

The member is requesting a loan to buy guinea pigs and chickens as well as food for these animals. She is happy to receive this loan, and she promises to make her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and chickens as well as food for these animals.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
Blanca vive en la ciudad de Itá, vive con sus padres y se dedica a la venta de perfumes y joyas de platas hace varios años. Está está cursando el cuarto año de Derecho, su mayor anhelo es obtener su título y empezar a ejercer su profesión y estar al servicio de la sociedad.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas, lo cual le será de mucha ayuda para seguir estudiando.
texts.en: Blanca lives in the city of Ita with her parents and she has made s living for several years now living selling perfume and silver jewelry. She's currently in her 4th year of Law, and her biggest desire is to obtain her degree and start working in her profession and serve the public. She's applying for this loan to be able to pay her tuition, which will really help her continue her studies.

loans.use: To pay for college tuition.

loans.name: Mujeres Triunfantes Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Triunfantes está en su ciclo número 4, son mujeres luchadoras que luchan por poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde dos señoras se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir en una situación de pobreza extrema.
Rita es una de las que Integrantes del grupo, quien se esfuerza por su familia y sus seres queridos, ella tiene una librería y pide este préstamo para poder comprar libros, cuadernos, lápices y otros, de manera a poder seguir surtiéndose para poder cumplir con sus clientes.
Todas están contentas por la oportunidad que están recibiendo de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
texts.en: The group called Mujeres Triunfantes is on its fourth loan cycle.  These women are fighters who struggle to improve the living conditions of their families and themselves.  They are conducting a survey to eliminate poverty, in which two women find themselves below the poverty line - that is, in a situation of extreme poverty.  Rita is one of the members of the group.  She pushes herself for her family and loved ones.  She has a bookstore, and she is requesting this loan in order to purchase books, notebooks, pencils and other products, to keep supplying the store and fulfilling her customers' orders.  All of the members are happy to receive the opportunity to improve the living conditions of their loved ones and themselves.

loans.use: to purchase books, notebooks, pencils, and other products to supply their bookstore

loans.name: Maylinda

texts.en:
Maylinda, 38, is married and has nine children, four of whom are currently in school. For the past ten years she has earned an income fattening and selling pigs in the Philippines.

Maylinda has taken out and successfully repaid twenty previous loans through Kiva's field partner NWTF to sustain her business. She has now requested a 15,000 PHP loan to buy feed and other supplies for her pigs. She is working to save money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Katupyry Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado tiene 17 integrantes, todas están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, todas están en una linea de pobreza extrema, luchando por mejorar sus vidas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Natividad quien vende ropas, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que lucha por poder ayudar a su familia para que no les falte nada. Ella comenta que empezó con muy poco, pero que poco a poco se ha abierto camino.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar  , de manera a poder tener mayor variedad que poder ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The Katupyry Group is made up of 17 members.  They are all in the Elimination of Poverty Program.  They are all on the extreme poverty line and are fighting to make their lives better.

One of the members is Senora Natividad.  She sells clothing.  She is a very hard-working woman who is determined to be able to help her family so that they don't lack anything. She says that she began with very little, but that little by little, the road ahead has been opening up for her.   She is requesting this loan to be able to buy jeans, shirts, pants, t-shirts, jackets and other clothing so that she can have a greater variety to be able to offer to her customers.

loans.use: to buy jeans, shirts, pants, t-shirts, jackets and other clothing

loans.name: Tehran

texts.en:
Tehran is 50 years old, married with 3 children and a refugee. Tehran is a dairy farmer, is an honest, hard-working and successful man. He earns money for her family by bringing up animals and selling their meat and wool at local bazaar. Tehran has started keeping dairy cows 20 years ago. Ever since, he has developed and grown his business steadily to a point where he is able to get more than 12 liters of milk every day which he sells to his customers in local bazaar. Also In Azerbaijan the most popular dishes are made from meat; such as Bozbash, Kutab, Kebab etc. When he was young Tehran started this business with an amount of small capital and in time he loves his own business and wants to improve it. 

Now he wants to grow his business and buy a few more cows and improve both his business and family conditions. He needs some funds and requires Kiva Lenders to support him.

loans.use: grow his business and buy a few more cows

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina is 40 years old, married and lives in Usocan, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She primarily supports her family needs through her buy & sell business of palay grains. He also operates a sari-sari store (convenience store) on their place. She is a full-fledge member of Paglaum MPC where she avails necessary capital for her business ventures. Currently, she avails another loan of PHP 15,000.00 to purchase additional palay grain for sale.

loans.use: to purchase additional palay grain for sale

loans.name: Pacesa

texts.es:
Pacesa es una mujer de 49 años de edad, casada, tiene un hijo de 15 años, y su negocio es la pesca.
Ella es buena madre, fuerte, luchadora, constante, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la comunidad ‘Cachilaya’ que se encuentra a una altura de 3900 metros sobre el nivel del mar, al sureste de Lago Titicaca, próxima al glaciar Huayna Potosí. Allí viven 10 comunidades de origen Aymara. Las principales actividades la constituyen el cultivo de; papas, quinua, habas, cebada y avena, y la crianza de ganado camélido y ovino. La mayor parte de los productos cultivados se destina al autoconsumo, mientras que una parte del ganado se vende en el mercado.
Pacesa es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte en compañía de su esposo que se dedica a la agricultura y con su hijo que estudia en la escuela y trabaja en la pesca, viven en una casa propia construida de adobe con techo de calamina y piso de ladrillo que cuenta con energía eléctrica y agua de pozo extraída mediante bomba eléctrica. Su trabajo es la pesca, las principales especies son el karachi, ispi, el mauri y la boga entre las especies nativas, y el pejerrey, La trucha arcoiris, entre las introducidas, “mi principal necesidad son las redes de pescar, estas se rompen y se rasgan continuamente, necesitamos comprar redes para poder trabajar…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que la pesca es constante durante todo el año, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de redes de pescar para reponer las que tiene. Su sueño es mejorar sus ingresos, ella desea realizar la compra de redes de pescar para reponer las que tiene y poder trabajar el resto del año. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que desarrolla esta actividad de forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Pacesa solicita un préstamo para la compra de redes de pescar para reponer las que tiene y poder trabajar el resto del año.
texts.en:
Pacesa is a 49-year-old woman, married with one 15-year-old child, and her business is fishing. She is a good mother, strong, a fighter, persevering, responsible and very hardworking. 

She carries out her business in the community of Cachilaya, which is found at an altitude of 3,900 meters above sea level in the southeastern part of Lake Titicaca near the Huayna Potosí glacier. There live 10 communities of Aymara origen. 

The main activities [that] constitute it [are] the cultivation of potatoes, quinoa, fava beans, barley, oats, and raising cattle, camelids and sheep. The greater part of the products cultivated are allocated for personal consumption, while part of the cattle is sold in the market. 

Pacesa has a dark complexion, brown eyes, long black hair she wears in braids, a short stature, and a robust physical build. She wears traditional dress (a hat, blanket [shawl] and skirt). Her native language is Aymará, which is spoken in this place, and she speaks Spanish as part of general culture and for the work she does. 

She shares her life in the company of her spouse who is a farmer, and with their son who is in school and works as a fisherman. They live in their own house made of adobe with a corrugated iron roof and a brick floor, which has electricity and well water extracted by an electric pump.

She is a fisherwoman. The main species are karachi, ispi, mauri and boga, among the native species, and sand smelt, rainbow trout among the introduced [species]. "My main necessity is fishing nets. They constantly break and tear; we need to buy nets so we can work," she says. 

The good thing about her business is that fishing is continuous throughout the year. The downside is the lack of capital to buy fishing nets to replace the ones she has. 

Her dream is to increase her income. She wants to buy fishing nets to replace the ones she has so she can work the rest of the year. 

This is the first loan sequence with the institution in the 10 years she has been independently developing this business. For those reasons, Pacesa is requesting a loan to purchase fishing nets to replace the ones she has so she can work the rest of the year.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets to replace the ones she has, so she can work the rest of the year.

loans.name: Mezeil

texts.en:
Mezeil is 32 years old, married and lives in Calaca-an, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She runs an egg production business for balut making. She has local customers that buys her eggs produce. This business of her gives her an income of PHP 12,000.00 per month. She is also a full-fledge member of Paglaum MPC where she enjoy all fiancial assistance for her business. 

Recently, she avails a loan of PHP 15,000.00 to buy additional ducks for increase egg production in balut making.

loans.use: to buy additional ducks for increase egg production in balut making

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 68 years old, widow and lives in La-o Proper, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is a pensioner-member of Paglaum MPC where she avails all fiancial assistance that help her to get back on her feet after her husband died. She ventures into retailing business and fish selling to support her family. 

Recently, she avails another loan of PHP 30,000.00 to pay for medical check-up & purchase maintenance medicines.

loans.use: to pay for medical check-up & purchase maintenance medicines

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Nancy works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns income from food vending and raising pigs.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more merchandise to sell in her general store.

Nancy has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting this new loan to further build her business.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell in her general store

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry is 36 years old and married with three children. All three children are sent in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Cherry is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Cherry has been raising pigs  for seven years and also earns additional income from fish vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Renone

texts.en:
Renone is 57 years old, married with two children.

Renone works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Renone has borrowed and paid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from fattening pigs.

Renone aspires to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mely

texts.en:
Mely is married and works hard to support her family. For the past ten years she has sold fresh fish to earn a living in the Philippines.

Mely has applied for a 22,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers. She is working to ensure a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Mercidita

texts.en:
Mercidita is 46 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Mercidita has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from electronic mobile load retailing.

Mercidita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es de la ciudad de Encarnación, es una persona que se esfuerza por poder cumplir sus metas y ser una profesional exitosa que pueda ayudar a las demás personas. Comenta que su préstamo anterior le fue de mucha ayuda para poder cubrir parte de su gastos de titulacion.
Hoy pide nuevamente este préstamo para poder cubrir la totalidad de los gastos de su titulacion para poder terminar sus estudios y seguir luchando por su meta.
texts.en:
Maria is from the city of Encarnación. She is the type of person who strives to reach her goals so that she can become a successful professional who is able to help other people. Maria says that her previous loan was a great help since she was able to cover the expenses for her degree.

Today she is requesting another loan so that she can cover all of her degree expenses. This will enable her to finish her studies so that she can continue striving toward her goal.

loans.use: to pay her degree expenses.

loans.name: Willy

texts.en:
Willy, 31, is unmarried and has yet to have any children. He has had a motorcycle transport business for the last five years.

Willy has applied for a 30,000 KES loan through Kiva's field partner VisionFund Kenya to buy another motorcycle, which he hopes will help him improve his business. His dream for the future is to have a happy family.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle, which he hopes will help him improve his business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine, a 34-year-old married mother of four, grows maize and beans and also rears goats and cows. This will be her second loan with VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to buy fertilizer and animal feeds.

Josephine will use the anticipated profit from her expanded business to educate her children. She hopes and dreams to see her children complete their education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and animal feeds

loans.name: Mario Martin

texts.es:
Mario tiene 29 años de edad, es soltero y vive en casa familiar, en el distrito de Cayalti, donde la vida es tranquila, es una comunidad rural y pequeña, que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo, Región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Mario se dedica a las actividad de venta de cerveza con una experiencia de 03 años, con buenas referencias laborales y personales, solicita préstamo para la compra de mercaderia para aumentar el stock de su negocio. De esta manera tendra mayores ventas y por ende mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Mario is 29 years old. He is single, and he lives in a family home in the Cayalti district, where life is calm. This is a rural and small community that belongs to the Chiclayo province, which is located in the Lambayeque region in the northern coast of Peru.

Mario makes a living selling beer. He has 3 years of experience in this business as well as good professional and personal references. He is requesting a loan to buy merchandise in order to increase the stock of his business.This way, he will make a greater number of sales and, therefore, earn a higher income.

loans.use: to buy merchandise in order to increase the stock of his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional clothes to sell and so support his family

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers to get a better harvest

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell, hoping that this will help him get more income to support his family.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 42 years old, married to Omwando and supports one child. 
She has been a farmer for the last 10 years and the business earns her KES 13,000 per month. 
Rebecca has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase fertilizer for top dressing her crops to get a better harvest for family use. She will sell the surplus in the market. 
She plans to use the gained profit to purchase a dairy cow for milk production and to pay school fees for her child. 
Her hope is to educate her child to higher levels and improve her living standard.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for top dressing her crops to get a better harvest.

loans.name: Annalyn

texts.en:
Her name is Annalyn. She is 36 years old and a resident of General Trias, Cavite, Philippines. She is happily married to Mario, her business partner, and has a child in college and a child in high school. They may not have the luxuries enjoyed by families living in first world countries, but as with most Filipinos, her family is happy and content living a simple life as long as the family is intact.

Annalyn has been running her small general store for 11 years already. It has been their source of income to provide for their family's needs. Her store means a lot to her for it helps send her children to school. Most Filipinos give top priority to education since it is a path out of poverty for many children and Filipino families.

To help sustain her store operations, she is seeking and asking for your help for a PHP 10,000 loan that she will use to buy large quantities of grocery items like canned goods, coffee, eggs, instant noodles, beverages, etc. She wants to make sure that her store has most of the essential food and household items to offer. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her. 

Annalyn's dream is to have a big grocery store someday. She aims to give her children a college education to allow them to have a better future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups, each composed of 15 to 30 community partners, that gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, beverages and toiletries to sell at her store.

loans.name: Purita

texts.en:
Purita is a 61-year-old married mother of seven children, one still in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Purita has a vegetable-vending business in the Philippines. Purita requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell.

Purita has been in this business for 14 years. Purita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Loren

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Loren works hard to support her family.

She has a retail clothing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from selling frozen food. Loren is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more clothes to sell.

Loren has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Shirley works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from . Shirley is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to  buy fish net, bamboo, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business.

Shirley has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish net, bamboo, gaosline for her boat and other materials for her business

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 38 years old and married with three children.

She is in agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Helen is borrowing PHP 24000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Helen has been in this business for 3 years and also earns additional income from fishing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell banana and coconut business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase more bananas and coconuts.

Lolita has been in this business for eight years. Lolita earns additional income from a general store and raising pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested this additional loan to further build her business.

Lolita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas and coconuts.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
A very hardworking entrepreneur, Rosario is a 41-year-old married woman with four children, all of whom are in school. For 10 years she has been selling  spare parts and lubricants in the Philippines. 

Rosario has requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell

loans.name: Adrian Santiago

texts.es: Adrián con apenas 19 años se consolidó como un empresario independiente en el municipio de Chocontá, todos los días a partir de las 9 a.m. su Café Internet esta abierto al público ofreciendo los servicios de navegación ilimitada, fotocopiado, llamadas a todos los operadores y papelería.  Su mamá lo incentivo para iniciar con este negocio, ella identificó oportunidad en esta población puesto que en el sector no existían negocios de este tipo.  En la actualidad cuenta con un año de funcionamiento y está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en papelería, tóner de impresoras y fotocopiadora y paquetes de minutos. Esta inversión es muy importante para capitalizarse y tener a la mano los insumos necesarios para la prestación de sus servicios.  Su meta de negocio a futuro es poder adquirir una impresora multifuncional y acortar sus tiempos de entrega de pedidos. Así mismo desea ingresar a la universidad y graduarse como profesional para apoyar económicamente a su mamá.
texts.en:
At barely 19 years old, Adrián established himself as an independent business owner in the municipality of Chocontá. Everyday, starting at 9:00 a.m., his internet cafe is open to the public, offering unlimited browsing, photocopies, calls to any operator, and stationery. 

His mother encouraged him to start this business. She identified the opportunity in this town since businesses of this type didn't exist in the area. It has now been in operation for a year, and is applying for its first Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo in order to invest in paper, printer and photocopier toner, and packets of minutes. 

This investment is very important to capitalize the business and have the necessary supplies on hand to lend his services. 

His business goal for the future is to acquire a multifunctional printer and reduce his time delivering orders. Likewise, he would like to go to the university and graduate as a professional in order to support his mother economically.

loans.use: to invest in paper, printer and photocopier toner, and packets of minutes.

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
Stanley is 36 years old and comes from Nyairongo-Hoima. 
Stanley has been a farmer since 2010. He is married to Sarafina and they have three children, ages 12, 8 and 5, and they all go to school. Before joining UGAFODE, Stanley didn’t have the skills to run a business.
Since he's received training, he wants to borrow UGX 3,000,000 to buy maize and beans which are currently available cheaply this harvest season. He will sell when the prices increase. He is assured of a market, especially from the schools. His dreams are to see all his children graduate and to expand his farm for commercialized agriculture. His additional income is from selling charcoal but it’s very seasonal. He faces challenges like weather changes and low prices of agricultural products.

loans.use: To buy maize and beans to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 27 years old and she supports seven children. She has been a farmer for the last 22 years, and the business earns her KES 44,000 per month.

Esther has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply for more income gain. 

She plans to use the gained profit to repay the loan and to educate her children. Her hope is to change her family life style.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply for more income gain.

loans.name: Linet

texts.en:
Linet is 25 years old, married, and supports a family of three children. She has been operating her general retail store for the last 10 years, earning KES 6,000 per month. 

Linet has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply for more income gain.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children and to produce enough food for the family. Her future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply for more income gain.

loans.name: Nehemia

texts.en:
Nehemia, a 25-year-old married father of one, has been operating a profitable motorcycle transport business for one year now. He will be using this loan to buy another motorcycle in the hopes of making more income and opening another business. 

Nehemia's aspirations for the future are to expand his business and have a successful life.

loans.use: To buy another motorcycle to make more income and open another business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase vegetables, condiments, meat, chicken, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Verline

texts.en:
Verline is 43 years old and married with three children. With two of her children currently in school, Verline works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines, where she sells a variety of items such as noodles, coffee, cereals, canned goods, snack foods, soft-drinks, etc.

She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Verline has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Caramelo Group

texts.es:
CARAMELO: Este grupo solidario está conformado por 4 mujeres emprendedoras, que se organizaron hace 6 meses, con el propósito de acceder a financiamiento para mejorar sus pequeño negocios incrementando su mercadería y así poder mejorar también sus ingresos que les permita poder cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar, asegurar la educación de sus hijos y ampliar sus negocios.

CELSI: Es integrante del grupo solidario Caramelo, tiene 25 años de edad, casada con un hijo de 8 años. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingreso desde hace 3 años vende fritos y refrescos naturales en su vivienda de tambo y madera. Está solicitando su segundo financiamiento para comprar insumos e ingredientes: repollo, tomate, vinagre, cebolla, pepino, aceite, pollo, aceite, carbón, azúcar, frutas, entre otros productos. Ella sueña con vender ropa usada.
texts.en:
CARAMELO: This supportive group is made up of 4 enterprising women who organized themselves 6 months ago for the purpose of accessing financing to improve their small businesses, increasing their goods to be able to also improve their income which permits them to be able to cover the basic necessities of the home, ensure the education of their children and grow their businesses. 

Celsi is a member of the supportive Caramelo group. She is 25 years old, married with an 8-year-old son. With the intention of having her own source of income, for the last three years she has been selling fried snacks and natural beverages from her wood house built on stilts. 

She is requesting her second loan to buy supplies and ingredients: cabbage, tomato, vinegar, onion, cucumber, oil, chicken, oil, charcoal, sugar and fruit, among other products. 

Her dream is to sell used clothing.

loans.use: to buy supplies and ingredients: cabbage, tomato, vinegar, onion, cucumber, oil, chicken, sugar and fruit, among other products.

loans.name: Norelyn

texts.en:
Norelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net and gasoline for her fishing business.

Norelyn has been in this business for four years. She earns more income from buying and selling fish.

Norelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She aspires to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net and gasoline

loans.name: Raul

texts.es: Raul de 43 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus cuatro hijos, el se dedica a la agricultura y también trabaja como jornalero, cuanta con más de 15 años de experiencia e inicio con capital propio, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante, el quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo las paredes pero como no posee de suficiente capital esta solicitando a INTEGRAL un crédito para la compra materiales de construcción y pago de mano de obra para poder tener una vivienda digna para su familia.
texts.en:
Raul is 43 years old and lives in his own home with his four children. He makes a living in agriculture and also works as a day laborer. He has more than 15 years of experience and started with his own capital. With what he obtains from his sales he manages to get ahead. 

He wants to improve his home by building the walls, but as he doesn’t have sufficient funds he is asking INTEGRAL for a loan to purchase construction materials and pay for the labor to be able to have a dignified home for his family.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials and pay for labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food supplies such as flour, eggs, meat, corn, rice, bread, sausages, and other cold meats.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en: Luz is 58 years old and lives in Usocan, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children. Luz has a fish-vending business and owns a fishing boat. She earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month from her business. She has requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase a fishing boat for her business. Luz has been a member of PMPC for five years.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing boat for her business.

loans.name: Ana Joy

texts.en:
She is Ana Joy, 25 years old and a resident of General Trias, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Jhon Joseph, a seaman, and has one child. She has recently opened a beauty parlor by her house, not only to keep herself busy but also to augment their income.  

Ana Joy offers various services at her beauty parlor. Her passion for beauty and the latest hair trends led her to start this kind of business. She does different hair cuts,  hair coloring, manicure and pedicure. Her pleasing and friendly personality draws customers to her parlor even if they have to wait for their turn.

She is now seeking financial assistance in the amount of PHP 18,000 to pay for beauty supplies to use and sell at her salon and improve her services. She will use the proceeds of her loan to buy big bottles of shampoo, conditioner, hair treatment, nail polish and new scissors.

She is thanking God and you in advance for granting her request for it will surely help grow her business. Her earnings will help for her daily sustenance and to send her child to school.

Ana Joy's dream is to open a salon in a commercial area. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups, each composed of 15 to 30 community partners, that gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for big bottles of shampoo, conditioner, hair treatment, hair dye and other supplies needed at her salon.

loans.name: Mujeres Dulces De Xejuyu Group

texts.en:
San Lucas Toliman can be found south of the beautiful Lake Atitlan, on the west side of Guatemala. In this location, a population of Mayan Kaqchikel people can be observed. Women there maintain their remarkable traditions through their brilliant traditional clothing. Many of the residents of San Lucas live their lives as bean farmers, corn farmers, wholesale and retail vendors, and animal growers.

Roughly fifteen minutes away from the town, there is a rural community in which you will find a trust bank, which is known as “Mujeres Dulces de Xejuyu”, or’ “Sweet Women of Xejuyu”. The group, which consists of eight women in total, is asking for its first loan from Friendship Bridge.

Deyni, the president of the group, is one of the lucky few who had the opportunity to study until eighth grade. Deyni is married and has two children. One is four years old and the other is seven years old. The loving mother dedicates herself to raising animals such as chickens and pigs, and she is requesting a loan so that she can buy two pigs and a few chickens. She will fatten them and then sell them. 

The women of the trust bank are learners that wish to better their quality of life. With an average age of thirty years old and the average amount of children being five, the mothers have a lot of responsibility to help themselves and their families. In order to do so, the eight women participate in Friendship Bridge’s Micro Credit Plus program, which teaches clients about various development topics with the hopes of eradicating poverty.

loans.use: To buy two pigs and a few chickens so that she can fatten them and sell them.

loans.name: Savy

texts.en:
In the picture, Savy, 52, is on the left and her husband, Sam Eourn, 52, is on the right. The couple is living in a community of Kandal Province, Cambodia. To make a living and support the family, they manage and operate a farming business on a small rice farmland which is located near their house. So far, they have been in this type of business for around twenty years. On average, the couple is able to make an income of USD 14.00 a day.

Savy wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from KIVA to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine for the welfare of their family

loans.name: Miguel Alonso

texts.es: Miguel de 18 años de edad,  soltero y sin hijos, es un excelente estudiante de informática que estudia mucho para alcanzar sus metas en la vida. Miguel con la ayuda de sus padres y con mucha dedicación a sus  estudios está logrando un buen record de notas y así poder ser un buen informático.  Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  para el pago de su matrícula y pensiones. Miguel  se encuentra muy agradecido  por la ayuda brindada y se despide con muchos deseos de culminar sus metas propuestas agradece a Kiva y Edaprospo.
texts.en:
Miguel, 18, is single and has no children.  He is an excellent computer science student who studies hard to reach his life goals.  Miguel, with the help of his parents and his dedication to his studies, has achieved a good grade point average, and so he will be able to become a good computer expert.  With this loan he will pay for his tuition and his room and board.  

Miguel is very grateful for the help he is receiving and he sends his regards.  He is eager to accomplish the goals that he has set out for himself, and he thanks Kiva and Edaprospo.

loans.use: to pay for tuition and room and board

loans.name: San Antonio Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado “San Antonio” forma parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde una de las integrantes es la Sra. Mabel, quien en su  encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, lo que quiere decir que está en una pobreza extrema.
Mabel pese a estar en un nivel rojo se esfuerza por poder mejorar y lo hace participando de las capacitaciones, y por medio de su negocio, consistente en la venta de cubiertos variados. Es una persona muy trabajadora que con la lucha diaria se gana la vida de una manera honesta.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar cubiertos de todo tipo, y de esa forma poder seguir luchando con su micronegocio para ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The group called "San Antonio" is part of the poverty elimination program. One of the members is Mabel whose poverty level in the survey was scored at level one, which means extreme poverty.

Despite being in the survey's red zone Mabel works hard to improve and does so by participating in training, and has consistent sales in her cutlery business. She's a very hard-working person who makes an honest living with her determination every day. She's applying for this loan to be able to buy all types of cutlery, so she can continue working hard on her small business to help her family.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of cutlery to sell.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.es:
Wilson es de la ciudad de Curuguaty, estudia y también está trabajando en una empresa de ventas de autos de la familia y está cursando el segundo   año de la carrera de Agronomía.
Él es una persona que se esfuerza para poder ser alguien en la vida y ayudar a sus familiares.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Wilson is from the city of Curuguaty.  He is in school and also works for a family business selling autos.  He is in his second year studying for a degree in agronomy.  He is a person who is working hard to become someone in life and help his family.

Wilson is requesting this loan to pay for his tuition.  This way, he can continue with his studies.

loans.use: to pay university fees

loans.name: Luzmienda

texts.en: Luzmienda is 62 years old and lives in Sta. Cruz, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with four children. Luzmienda has earned a living from raising ducks and selling duck eggs for almost 10 years. She earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month from her business. She has requested a loan to purchase an additional 400 ducklings for her business. Luzmienda has been a member of PMPC for 10 years. In the future, Luzmienda hopes to expand her duck raising and duck egg business.

loans.use: To buy an additional 400 ducklings

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy piglets, feed and to pay school fees

loans.name: Galecia

texts.en: Galecia is preparing her land for the next cropping season. She wants to have enough fertilizer for her corn so she applied for a loan from the cooperative. Galecia hopes to save enough for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her corn for a better harvest.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel is 56 years old, married and has five children.

Isabel is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Isabel requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Isabel has been raising pigs for six years now and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Khoneken Group

texts.en:
Keo’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.
