Keo and his group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now he can shift to other pursuits. 

 Keo and his village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years; within this 2 years filter users, like Keo’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Ailene

texts.en:
Ailene is 38 years old and married with four children. All of her children are attend in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Ailene is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for pigs.

Ailene has been raising pigs for six years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for pigs.

loans.name: Tatiana

texts.en:
Tatiana is a laundry woman from Ungheni in Moldova. At the same time she manages a small farm near her house, producing chicken and pig meat. Tatiana is a widow. Her son Ion works as a constructor in Russia. He helps Tatiana periodically by sending money from abroad.

Tatiana wants to develop her small chicken and pig farm that she owns and be able to meet her family’s needs and be self-reliant.
Tatiana will use the loan to buy animal feed and extend her farm's capacities.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy chain link, sand, cement, and iron posts to build a fence around her home.

loans.name: Surayo

texts.en:
Surayo was born in northern part of Tajikistan in 1993. She is a farmer, living in village with her family and is married and has two children. She takes care of livestock and sells them at the extra price. She is well known among friends and neighbors. She likes her duty very much. 

She is unhappy, because her child is sick. She would happy when her child will be recovered. She appealed to IMON asking financial support to treat her child at medical clinic. She hopes to be understood and supported by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to treat her child at a medical clinic

loans.name: Nercita

texts.en: Nercita, 55 years old, lives in Tudela, Misamis Occidental with her husband and two children. Her husband is a construction worker. Unable to sustain the needs of the family with only her husband’s income, she has found ways to attain income through snack & food vending. It began with selling a small amount of viand & snack to their neighbors. She joined Paglaum Cooperative, which helped her in the capitalization of her sari-sari (small grocery) store in January of 2004. She has received loans several times already and all were paid in a timely fashion. Now, she applied for PHP 50,000.00 to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 54 years old, resident of province of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is happily married to Celso, her business partner and has three children but only one goes to school. 

Susan has been operating her food stand for nine years already. She cooks different kinds of dishes but her specialty is "lugaw" (Filipino rice porridge, a plain congee with any kind of meat or seasonings, a favorite among the Filipinos. It is very much a staple in the Phil.cuisine and can be enjoyed as breakfast, as snack and even as main dish. Susan on her long years of running her eatery has already established and growing customers in their area.

To help her sustain and grow her eatery she is requesting for a Php 30000 loan to buy several kilos of rice, fresh meat, vegetables like corn and cabbage, noodles and various veggies, seasonings, gas to cook dishes to sell at her food stand. She will be grateful and is thanking you in advance that you could grant her the amount she needs for her business. Her food stand means a lot to her since this is where she gets the funds she need to meet daily needs and school needs of her child. The only problem she encounters is during rainy season since she only has a tarpaulin to cover her food stall.

Susan dreams to have a place of her own for a more secured eatery. She wants to send her two other children to school. She faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for ingredients and to cook dishes to sell at her food stall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer to improve her harvest.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 39 years old, married and the mother of three children. She earns a living by running a retail shop and has been in the business for the last five years. She is requesting her fifth loan from VisionFund Kenya to buy items to sell in her store, including maize flour, tea leaves, detergent, rice, bread, and paraffin. Rose intends to use the profits from her expanded business to pay school fees for her children. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to expand her business so she can become a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy supplies to sell in her store.

loans.name: Antonina

texts.en:
Antonina is 36 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Antonina is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Antonina has been in pig fattening for 10 years and also earns additional income from farming vegetables.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 46 years old and has six children. Susana is married and has five children in school.

Susana is in the agriculture business and raises pigs in the Philippines. Susana requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Susana has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Susana would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Viola

texts.en:
Viola is 33 years old and has two children. Viola is married and has two children are still in school.

Viola is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Viola requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vaccine, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Viola has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vaccine, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy local brew for selling

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar system to provide electricity for his home

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario es de la ciudad de Curuguaty, trabaja y estudia al mismo tiempo, y está cursando el Quinto año de la Carrera de Ingeniería Agronómica, y comenta que por medio de sus estudios quiere poder abrirse camino al mundo laboral.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar sus útiles de la universidad para poder seguir estudiando.
Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir con sus estudios y cubrir sus gastos de materiales.
texts.en:
Mario is from the city of Curuguaty. He works and studies—he is currently in his fifth year of Agricultural Engineering. 

Mario says that it is through his studies that he wants to break into the labour market.

He is asking for this loan to purchase his university supplies so that he can continue with his studies.

He is grateful for being granted the opportunity to continue with his studies and cover his supplies expenses.

loans.use: to purchase his university supplies.

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en: Zarina is a happy woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1978 and lives in a big, busy city with her family. She is widow and has two children. She also runs a business that provides for and feeds her children. It is not easy to be a widow, and she has been very challenged since her husband's death. In order to feed her family and live well, she started a business buying and selling women's clothing. Zarina tries to communicate well with customers and has some regular clients. Each season she needs to refresh her assortment of clothing and is requesting a loan to buy new items for her store. She is grateful for the support of Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy a new assortment of clothing for her store

loans.name: Nthenya

texts.en:
Nthenya is 55 years old. She is married and has six children. She sells cereals and firewood. She has been in the business for the last five years. This is her second loan from VisionFund Kenya. 

She will use the loan to buy stock of maize, beans and cow peas. She intends to use the anticipated profits from expanded business to pay school fees for her children and increase her savings. 

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a big business to become a wholesale supplier of cereals.

loans.use: purchase cereals - maize, beans and cow peas, for sale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 57 years and supports five children. She has been a farmer for the last ten years and earns KES 4,000 per month. She has applied for her first loan, for KES 25,000, from VisionFund Kenya to buy fertilizers for her crops so she can get a better harvest for family use and have produce to sell in the market. Rose plans to use the profit she earns to buy a dairy cow to make milk and to pay school fees for her children. Her hope is to educate her children to the highest possible levels.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Seyha

texts.en:
Seyha is a 21-year-old single student who resides the Kratie Province in Cambodia. Currently, he is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in finance and banking, and is in his second year at a university in the province. His parents are rice farmers. 

Because Seyha is short of finances to cover his tuition fees from the second to the fourth year, he would like to request a loan. With this loan, he will be able to cover his university fees and earn a bachelor’s degree successfully. His dream is to have a proper job with a decent salary, so that he will be able to save money to renovate his parent’s house.

loans.use: to cover his tuition fees from the 2nd to the 4th year for a BA in Finance and Banking

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clay in bulk.

loans.name: Maria Leticia

texts.es: María de 41 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo y su hijo de 19 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se desempeña como vendedora de frutas y verduras, dicha actividad la realiza en el mercado municipal, desde hace quince años por lo que cuenta con mucha experiencia y una extensa cantidad de clientes que siempre buscan sus productos. María desea construir una pila la cual le permita almacenar de mejor manera el agua que utiliza para consumo y uso diario ya que actualmente lo hace con barriles los cuales tienen poca capacidad de almacenaje por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena, grava, hierro, ladrillo y además pagar la mano de obra, para construir la pila para agua e iniciar la construcción del baño ya que no cuenta con uno en su vivienda.
texts.en:
María, age 41, lives in her own house with her husband and her 19 year old son. She is an enterprising woman who sells fruit and vegetables. She has been engaged in this business activity at the municipal market for 15 years. Therefore, she has lots of experience and an extensive amount of customers who always seek her products.

María wishes to build a sink, which will allow her to better store water that is used for consumption and daily use. She currently does this with barrels that have a small storage capacity. That is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, gravel, iron, and bricks and to pay for the labor to build a sink and to build a bathroom that she does not now have in her house.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, iron, and bricks and to pay for the labor to build a sink for water and to start to build a bathroom in her house.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie is 36 years old and has 3 children to provide. For 6 years she has been run for this sari-sari store in selling goods in their community to earn a living.  Despite the small income, it brought daily income which is just the family needed. She took  a loan to buy additional stocks for her store in order for her to gain more income.

Marjorie's plan for her future is to earn more profit and expand business to support her children for their education.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 36 years old and married with eight children.  With three children in school, Leonila works very hard to provide for them.

Leonila runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Leonila has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned good and other groceries. 

In the future Leonila would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jessamie

texts.en:
Jessamie is 28 years old and married. Jessamie works very hard to provide for them.

Jessamie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, shampoo and other personal care products.

Jessamie has been in this business for 3 years. 

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, shampoo and other personal care products

loans.name: Kunduz

texts.ru: Кундуз, 42 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 детей. У Кундуз - среднее образование, на протяжении 20 лет она занимается сельским хозяйством. Семья образцовая, все дружно помогают по хозяйству. Стартовала Кундуз 20 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Кундуз, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 коровы, также обрабатывают 1,0 ГА арендованной и 0,60 ГА собственной земли, где ежегодно выращивает овощи. Ежемесячный доход составляет 7,700 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Кундуз обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для увеличения поголовья, часть средств направит на полеводство. Доходы от кредита Кундуз планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение е бизнеса и завершение строительства дома.
texts.en:
Kunduz is 42 years old, married, and together with her husband is raising five children. Kunduz has a secondary education. For the past 20 years, she has been engaged in agriculture. She has an exemplary family: everyone amicably helps around the farm. Kunduz began 20 years ago with a livestock purchase of 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work, Kunduz today has four cows on her homestead, and also works 1.0 hectare of rented land and 0.60 hectares of her own land, where she grows vegetables each year. Monthly income amounts to 7,700 som (KGS).

With the aim of further developing her homestead, Kunduz applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase livestock for increasing her herd and part of the money will go for farming.

Kunduz plans to invest income from the loan in further augmenting her business and completion the construction of a home.

loans.use: to buy some livestock in order to increase her herd and to cultivate her land.

loans.name: Ana Mie

texts.en:
Ana Mie is 33 years old and has four children. Ana Mie is single and has four children are presently in school.

Ana Mie is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Ana Mie requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vaccine, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Ana Mie has been in this business for 4 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vaccine, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Charlene

texts.en:
Charlene is 34 years old and has two children. Charlene is married and has one child still in school.

Charlene is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Charlene requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Charlene has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Above All Group

texts.en: Mary leads a two-person loan group called Above All that has applied for its fourteenth loan from ID-Ghana. Mary and her fellow group member do various kinds of work, including selling utensils, slippers and fresh fish. Mary joined ID-Ghana five years ago at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the organization. She now earns money selling fresh fish, a business she taught herself twenty years ago. She will use this loan to buy more fresh fish to sell in the wholesale market in Accra and in one other market. She will use the income she earns to support her family, because she is single and has six children. When asked what she likes about ID-Ghana, she mentioned health, trainings, and the payment meetings that the organization offers.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish to in the local market.

loans.name: Neema 'b' Group

texts.en:
Salmada, who is in her early 30s is a widow with one small kid.  She has been running a grocery store for two years now.  She works from 04am to mid-night daily and is able to make a a good monthly profit.

This will be Salmada's 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase on the drinks store and has paid back all her loans successfully.  She used the profit to to take care of her child and her self, to repay loan and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to buy the fast selling drinks in her grocery store.  She dreams of own a wholesale shop for drinks.

Salmada will share this loan with her loan group Neema "B" which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy the fastest selling drinks in her grocery store.

loans.name: Ever

texts.es:
Ever está estudiando la carrera de Derecho, con el deseo de poder abrirse camino en el mundo profesional, es una persona que está poniendo todo de sí para poder crecer y salir adelante.
Él quiere ayudar a las demás personas y también a su familia por medio de sus estudios. Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Ever is studying for a law degree with the goal of opening up a pathway into the professional world. He is a person putting forth all of himself in order to grow and move forward.

Using his education, he wants to help other people, as well as his family. He requests this loan in order to pay the fees for his degree and in this way, to be able to continue studying like he has been.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 19 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la venta de hamburguesas y licuados de fruta, el negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia desde hace mas de 2 años y lo inicio con capital propio, gracias a su trabajo es como puede ayudar en su casa con los gastos, la joven vive en casa propia con su madre, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda poniendo el techo en el lugar donde tiene su negocio pero no posee suficiente capital, por esa razón esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de laminas,polines y pago de mano de obra para tener un mejor lugar para vender.
texts.en:
The young woman whose face is blurred is 19 years old and lives in a high risk area. She makes a living selling hamburgers and fruit smoothies. She has run this business out of her own home more than two years ago, and she started it with her own money. Thanks to her work she is able to help with her household expenses; she lives in her own home with her mother.  

She wants to improve their home by putting a roof over where she has her business, but she does not have sufficient capital. For this reason she is asking for a loan to buy metal sheets, poles and pay for labor, so that she may have a better place to sell her food.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets, poles and pay for labor to improve her premises.

loans.name: Hidoyat

texts.en:
Hidoyat is a bright woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1973. She is living in quite a big town with her family. She is divorced and has one child. She is a teacher at a secondary school. She has 15 years of experience teaching pupils at school. She saved money from her salary and studied at pedagogical institutions. 

Recently, she needs and wants to enter her child in the university. She asked for a loan from Kiva and IMON to pay her child’s higher education costs. She wishes to be understood and supported by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay her child’s higher education costs.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Evelyn is 56 years old, and two of her children are in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a PHP 29,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Evelyn has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, Evelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ma. Liza

texts.en:
As the married mother of three children, Ma. Liza works hard to support her family.

She has a personal product retail business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Ma. Liza is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of clothes to sell to customers.

Ma. Liza has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of personal products to sell.

loans.name: Adriana Maria

texts.es:
Siempre con una sonrisa dibujada en su rostro y con el mejor ánimo sale cada día la señora Adriana a dar lo mejor de sí en su negocio, trabaja en la  preparación de alimentos como lo son platos típicos, bandeja paisa, sudado, sancocho se gana la vida y mantiene en un hogar el cual comparte con su pareja y sus dos hijos de 10 y 6 años de edad.

Su propósito central al iniciar su trabajo fue el mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y con paciencia pero con perseverancia lo ha ido logrado poco a poco.

Adriana desde  que inicio en la preparación de alimentos lo ha hecho con sus implementos de su propia cocina de la casa, solo ha comprado algunas ollas por necesidad y nada más.

Al no disponer de activos para su negocio Adriana no puede producir mayor cantidades, es por esta razón que desea un apoyo económico para la compra de una nevera para albergar mayor cantidad de alimentos, comprar de elementos de cocina, como ollas, cucharones, cubiertos, porcelana e insumos para la preparación de almuerzos y desayunos.
texts.en:
Adriana always goes out each day with a small drawn on her face and in the best mood. She does this to put the best of herself into her business. She works preparing food such as typical dishes like 'bandeja paisa' [a popular dish traditionally including beans, rice, chicharrón, ground meat, chorizo, fried egg, plantain and avocado], 'sudado' [a type of stew], and 'sancocho' [a type of soup]. This way she earns a living and supports her household, which she shares with her life partner and their two children, ages 6 and 10.

Her main objective upon starting her work was to improve her living conditions. With patience and with perseverance she has been doing so, little by little. Ever since she started preparing food she has done so with the kitchen utensils from her own house. She has only purchased some pots out of necessity, nothing more.

Because she does not have available assets for her business, Adriana is not able to produce larger quantities. That is the reason she wishes to have financial support to buy a refrigerator to store a larger quantity of food. She also wishes to buy cooking items like pots, ladles, cutlery, china, and supplies to make the lunches and breakfasts.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator, kitchen tools, and supplies to prepare breakfasts and lunches.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis es estudiante de la carrera de administración de empresas, él es un joven que se esfuerza para poder salir adelante. Actualmente comenta que trabaja y estudia para poder salir adelante.
Tiene una pequeña empresa que consiste en la venta de bebidas, y por medio de su trabajo tiene los medios para poder seguir luchando.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos de titulación, ya que está en el último año estudiando y esforzándose por poder terminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Luis is a student in business administration. He is a young man who strives to get ahead. He notes that he is currently working and studying in order to get ahead. He has a small business consisting of selling beverages. Through his work, he has the means to continue forward. 

He requests this loan in order to cover his graduation costs since he is in his final year of school and striving to complete his studies.

loans.use: to pay graduation fees.

loans.name: Solidarity And Funny-N8T6Qthái Group

texts.en:
Mrs Huê is 27 years old and she is married. She works in agriculture raising poultry for two years. Huê lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa Province. Her family is a low-income household in the village; moreover the market need is low in this region. The main hardship that Huê faces is lack of capital.  

In 2015, Huê joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Huê has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She is a reputable person in the community. Huê  and 2 other women established the loan group "Solidarity And Funny-N8T6Qthái" to get loan and share experience to do business for a better life.
She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future. 

With her business profits, Huê hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Ariel

texts.es: Ariel tiene 35 años vive en una comunidad de Olanchito, Honduras se dedica a la agricultura de hortalizas y granos básicos desde hace 15 años, tiene cuatro hijos y junto a su esposa Mirian luchan juntos por darles un mejor futuro,  pero  en la comunidad donde vive Ariel y su familia no hay acceso a energía eléctrica por lo cual las tareas del hogar que realiza su esposa y dos de sus hijos que estudian se dificultan un poco. Tienen que comprar velas y lámparas a base de kerosén para poder iluminarse, ellos están conscientes que el humo que estas generan es perjudicial para su salud, es  por esta razón que  Ariel está solicitando financiamiento a SOLUZ HONDURAS para adquirir un sistema solar que  ayudara a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y  no será perjudicial para la salud.
texts.en:
Ariel his 35 years old and lives in a community of Olanchito, Honduras. He works in the farming of vegetables and basic grains, which has been doing for 15 years. He has four children and, along with his wife Mirian, works together to give their children a better future. 

However, in the community where Ariel and his family live, there is no access to electricity. For that reason, the household chores that his wife completes, and those of his children in school, are a bit difficult. They have to buy candles and kerosene lamps to provide lighting. They are aware that the smoke that these methods generate is harmful for their health. It is for this reason that Ariel is asking for a loan from Soluz Honduras to obtain a solar electricity system that will help improve his family's quality of life without harming their health.

loans.use: for the purchase of a solar electricity system that will benefit and improve his living conditions.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar power system to improve his household conditions.

loans.name: Halumaya

texts.en:
Halumaya is 52 years old. She is married and has four children aged 27, 21, 19 and 12.

In 1983 she established her handicraft business. Working six days a week and seven hours a day, she supports her family.

Halumaya takes loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent one to buy raw materials for her business.

In the future, she plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

Nepal has a long and rich history of traditional handicrafts. Throughout the Kathmandu Valley, skilled artisans produce unique pieces of art that reflect Nepal's cultural diversity. Terra cotta pottery comes from the red clay of the surrounding Himalayan foothills. Bronze and silver statuettes are formed using wax molds and intricate hand tool finishing. In Patan, Newari culture and traditions are reflected in the images and symbols etched into metal or formed in stone. With the help of a Kiva loan, Nepal's artisans are able to purchase raw materials in greater volume. This increase in volume allows a single artisan to work on several pieces at the same time while increasing her profit margin.

loans.use: to buy bamboo.

loans.name: Bonsai Nkl Group

texts.en:
“Bonsai NKL” is a group consisting of a man and four women. The leader of this group is Marsel, a 33-year-old woman, who is standing in the middle in the picture. In her marriage, she has been blessed with three children: Melani, 12, a junior high school student; Cindy, 9, an elementary school student; and the last one is Aron, 3, who is not attending school yet. 

Marsel runs a small kiosk business that sells about 200 liters of kerosene in a month and also sells mobile phone credit. Marsel dreams of expanding the business by increasing the stock of kerosene and mobile phone credit; however, the capital she has at the moment is very limited. 

Along with other neighbors who have the same problem in their business capital, she has formed a group and has requested a loan from TLM in the amount of IDR 15,000,000. Marsel has spent the loan to purchase 250 liters of kerosene and mobile phone credit in the amount of IDR 250,000 to her business. 

As well as Marsel, Nelci, Yasinta, and Inda  – who have been running a kiosk business that is home based – have spent the loan to restock the kiosk stuff such as instant noodles, coffee, sugar, tea, snacks, etc., while Kalvinus, the only man in this group, has a business of a vegetable stall in a traditional market, and he used the loan to buy more vegetables such as spinach, string beans, carrots, cabbage, etc. in larger amounts.

loans.use: to purchase 250 liters of kerosene and mobile phone credit in the amount of IDR 250,000.

loans.name: Elna

texts.en:
Elna is 56 years old and lives with her four children. She is in agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Elna has been in this business for four years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

Elna is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Blanca Estella

texts.es:
Ella es Blanca es una incansable luchadora y soñadora de la vida, la cual adopto la profesión de confeccionista por necesidad económica, por independencia económica, por apoyar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar, es una persona que con paciencia y perseverancia ha adquirido su maquinaria y ha rebuscado sus clientes.

Hoy a sus 54 años de edad trabaja por el sostenimiento y crecimiento de su negocio y es por ello que necesita maquinaria que apoye sus deseos de ser competitiva y ofrecer algo bueno a los clientes, como, mejoras en los tiempos de entrega, diferentes acabados, entre otras facilidades.

En base a sus deseos y con el entusiasmo muy alto de crecer, Blanca solicita un préstamo para la compra de una maquina plana.
texts.en:
This  is Blanca. She is tireless, hardworking and a forever dreamer, who turned into dressmaking due to financial need, and to gain independence and support her husband with the household expenses. With patience and perseverance she's been able to get a sewing machine and secure some customers.
Today, at 54, she works to maintain and grow her business, and she needs a sewing machine that can withstand her competitive needs to offer quality products to her customers. She wants to improve delivery times, different finishings, and other features.
Based on her wishes and enthusiasm to grow, Blanca is asking for a loan to buy a flatbed sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy a flatbed sewing machine.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 39 years old and married with five children, all of whom are currently in school. For the past 10 years, she has run a general store in the Philippines. Analyn works very hard to provide for her family.

Analyn is requesting a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, and other items. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, and other items

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 37 years old and is married with two children, one who is still in school. For the past four years, she has run a business buying and selling frozen food in the Philippines. Analyn is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Analyn is requesting a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase sausages, hot dogs, and other frozen foods to sell. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase sausages, hot dogs, and frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Noris Evelec

texts.es:
Noris, de 34 años de edad, estudio hasta octavo grado, está acompañada y su pareja vive en E.E.U.U.    sus hijos viven en su casa todavía y van a la escuela.

Noris, se dedica a la venta de antojitos y pupusas, ella aprendió este negocio gracias a una amiga que  realiza la misma actividad; antes vendía semilla de marañón en la calle, ahora el negocio lo tiene en su casa y sale a venderlo en la colonia donde vive.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar una plancha para hacer pupusas y poder continuar con su negocio.

Sus sueños son, mantener su negocio estable y funcionando, para tener más ingresos y cubrir las necesidades de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Noris, 34 years old, finished up to eighth grade in school. She is in a relationship, and her partner lives in the U.S. Her children still live at home and are in school.

Noris works selling snacks and pupusas (Salvadoran food made of a thick corn tortilla stuffed with cheese, fried pork rind, chicken, or refried beans). She learned this business thanks to a friend who works in the same activity. Before, she used to sell cashew nuts in the street. Now, she has her business at home, and goes out to sell in the neighborhood where she lives.

The loan will be used to buy a griddle to make pupusas, and to be able to continue with her business.

Her dreams are to maintain a stable and functioning business, in order to have more income and take care of her children's necessities.

loans.use: to buy a griddle to make pupusas (food)

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Kyon Paing Village Group 1 A

texts.en:
Nyunt is 68 years old, married and has five children. He and his family live in Kyon Paing village in Dedaye, located in the Ayeyarwaddy Delta region in Myanmar. There the population mainly focuses on crop farming. Some households have small grocery stores in the village and plant seasonal foods such as coconuts and betel leaves as well.

Nyunt farms his four acres of crops while his wife works at their grocery store underneath their house. The parents are satisfied in that some of their children work on the farm and some work at jobs elsewhere.

Kyon Paing Group 1 A is overseen by Nyunt, the Community Based Organization or CBO leader of this group, which includes the five members pictured above: War, Myint, Chit, Aung and Nyunt himself. A 1,000,000 MMK loan through Kiva's field partner Proximity Designs will help the group members purchase fertilizers and other farming materials.

Nyunt’s portion of this loan will help the family invest more in their farm and specifically, buy farming materials. Nyunt's family hopes to see improvements in their farm over the last years. As a grandparent, Nyunt wants his grandchildren to be educated and graduate from school.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farming materials

loans.name: Girlie

texts.en:
Girlie is 28 years old and single.

She earns a living with her pig fattening business in the Philippines. Girlie is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional feed for her pigs.

She has been in the pig fattening business for 1 year and also earns additional income from selling prepaid recharge mobile load.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional feed for her pigs

loans.name: Celia Fe

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Celia Fe works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell beauty product business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Celia Fe is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like beauty products, etc. for her buy-and-sell personal product care business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Celia Fe has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beauty product, etc.
